story:
Seckman High School students with severe to profound disabilities need your support. We are seeking donations to help fund arts education for 25 students. Our students rely heavily on their senses, and the primary purpose of this project is to help our students reach their fullest potential through sensory stimulating art lessons that enhance their daily experiences and activate their independence.

The funding will cover costs of materials and individualized arts education from local St. Louis artists, who will provide instruction in creating one-of-a-kind art that showcases our students' abilities, rather than disabilities. Our aim is to enter students' art work in the St. Louis Outsider Art Fair .

Outsider Art, aka Art Brut, describes art created outside the boundaries of official culture by those on the outside of the established art scene.

story:
Hi! I’m Anna, and I’m here to ask for your support to do an artist residency where I'll explore the intersection of sustainability issues and weaving.

When I graduated from college I moved to New York for an internship with a textile designer. Soon after my internship began I saw that they were throwing fabric in the trash. Everyday. There was no attempt to recycle or repurpose textiles that no longer served them.

I was really shocked by this, and it didn’t sit well with me. I started taking whatever I could carry out of the trash home with me and brought it to GrowNYC’s textile recycling collection. Knowing that this was just one designer, for one collection, of a multi-national corporation gave me a glimpse of how much waste is produced by the global textile industry.   

I knew this wasn’t the career path I wanted, and since then I’ve been dreaming of doing something that uses my love of weaving to address the huge environmental and social issues that are a product of the industry.

This winter, I have an opportunity to participate in an artist residency program with Weaving Hand, a weaving studio in Brooklyn. This residency would be a focused time for me to learn processes that will address sustainability issues that affect all of us. 

What I Need & What You Get

  • Your support will help me cover the tuition for the artist residency, and the rest will go to taking classes to learn more advanced skills and purchasing materials for projects.  
  • Have I mentioned I love to weave?! In exchange for your support you’ll receive something handwoven with love, from me! 

The Impact

  • My goal is to create practical, usable items from textiles and materials that would otherwise be sent into the waste stream. 
  • I’ll experiment with recycled materials such a plastic shopping bags, and create woven garments from natural dyes and locally produced fibers.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Have yarn laying around the house that you’re never going to use? I'll put it to good use! I'll also be collecting old jeans that are worn out for a special project! 
  • Share my campaign with your community or anyone you know who is passionate about sustainability and textiles!

Thank you so much! 

XOXO, 
Anna

What I Need & What You Get

Your support will help me cover the tuition for the artist residency, and the rest will go to taking classes to learn more advanced skills and purchasing materials for projects.  
Have I mentioned I love to weave?! In exchange for your support you’ll receive something handwoven with love, from me! 

The Impact

My goal is to create practical, usable items from textiles and materials that would otherwise be sent into the waste stream. 
I’ll experiment with recycled materials such a plastic shopping bags, and create woven garments from natural dyes and locally produced fibers.


Other Ways You Can Help

Have yarn laying around the house that you’re never going to use? I'll put it to good use! I'll also be collecting old jeans that are worn out for a special project! 

Share my campaign with your community or anyone you know who is passionate about sustainability and textiles!
Thank you so much! XOXO, Anna

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Tim.  I'm a new Dad and am hoping to start my own small business while I am home with my daughter.  My wife and I decided it was important to have one parent home with our baby, and since I have always wanted to work for myself - this felt like the right time to give it a try!

If I am able to reach my funding requests, my goal is to be able to cover the start up costs associated with opening a new business (legal fees for an LLC & insurance - YAY!).  Anything above and beyond that would go to renovating my outdoor shed to turn it into a fully functioning wood shop that I could use year-round (dust collection system, electricity, heating, equipment & supplies).  I hope to be able to sell handmade home goods and wooden wares online (www.etsy.com), at local craft shows, and to do small repair work for folks in my area.

Thanks!

~Tim

What We Need & What You Get

Breakdown:

  • Legal Fees at this point are approximately $800-$1000 for LLC paperwork, business insurance is $500 due up front.  Throw in materials, equipment...all that good stuff is what any extra funding would go towards -- making my shed a wood shop.
  • If I reach my $$ goal, I would be able to offer unique, handmade wooden wares to folks that contribute to my campaign!  These are things ranging from chopsticks and cutting boards to beautiful wooden bowls, depending on your donation.
  • If I don't reach my goal, any funding I receive would go towards legal fees and insurance costs, which have to get paid before anything else.

The Impact

  • Why?  You'd be supporting a small business, a new family, fair use of local woods that might otherwise be trashed or burned, design and artisan craftsmanship...it's all good!
  • I have been working with wood since I was 10 years old in my Dad's shop.  I have made everything from coffee tables to guitars and love coming up with new ideas and sharing my talents with others.
  • Starting my own business would allow me to contribute to an online and local community while supporting my family.

Risks & Challenges

Once the business is open it has to thrive.  I will need clients and jobs to keep things moving.  My high quality craftsmanship and past experience in woodworking will guide me along the way.

I also plan to consult local professionals and institutions (universities with small business classes and meetings).

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share Matlack Woodworking's campaign info on social media outlets and with all your friends! 
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for your support!

story:
We see disparity in the workplace, in our wages, in limited paternity leave; we see it in our government, in our educational system, in products and advertising, and in the way women are portrayed by the media.  Even in the arts, of all places, where you would expect opportunities to be fairest and most liberally balanced, we still see it.  Too often, women's creative voices are being overshadowed. It's not just a concern for us; It's a concern for the next generation.

Obviously, collaboration is key; we're not trying to diminish the value of men's creativity.  We just wanted to take the frustration of being secondary, less than, or simply not heard, and turn it into an act of bold progressive artistic rebellion; shining the spotlight on the women who do write, and helping them own and showcase their work, to say "Yes, we are here. And this is what we have to say." 

So we're putting together a show:

Tuesday, April 7th at 7pm @ L'Etage.

We believe by putting our work out there, we can inspire young women to do the same. Help us raise money to stage this amazing event, support female artists and empower women everywhere!  If we meet our goal and cover the overhead cost, then 100% of the profits from April 7th benefit can go DIRECTLY to Girls Rock Philly, which, if you haven't heard, is one of the coolest new non-profits on the block. http://www.girlsrockphilly.org/

(Listen to the promo song here: https://soundcloud.com/kanakodrums/girlswillroc...)

story:
Mi presento

Mi chiamo Ramona Bruno, illustratrice e content creator italiana, laureata in architettura e diplomata in illustrazione a Napoli. Dopo la laurea ho conseguito un master in illustrazione a Roma e contemporaneamente ho approfondito le mie conoscenze sulle tecniche serigrafiche ed ora ho dato il via alla mia carriera da freelancer trasferendomi in Francia. Ho uno stile piatto, tendenzialmente prediligo le tecniche digitali cercando però di simulare gli effetti delle stampe risografiche e serigrafiche. Ultimamente sto studiando animazione per il web.

Sul mio sito http://www.ramonabruno.com troverete molti dei miei ultimi lavori.

 

Il Progetto

"2019 Risograph Calendar" è uno dei due progetti calendario 2019 che ho curato. Amo moltissimo il risultato di stampa ottenuto con la tecnica Risografica , scoperta dopo aver collaborato al primo numero della zine "Papayas Pineapples and the Apocalypse"  ed ho pensato di creare qualcosa di mio che vi accompagnasse per tutto il 2019. Per contenere i costi di stampa ho dovuto optare per un progetto grafico a singola pagina (foglio A3 Cyclus 200 g/m²), scegliendo una combinazione a tre colori forniti dallo studio grafico scozzese Risotto .

I tre colori sono:

  • Orange 021U
  • Burgundy 235U
  • Fed Blue 294U

Il calendario misura 29,7x42 cm, orientamento verticale  verrà stampato in 50 copie, tutte numerate e firmate da me.

Su questo sito non sono accettate raccolte fondi inferiori a 500€, ma per avviare una stampa a tiratura limitata di 50 copie in tecnica risografica ho bisogno solo di 300€ 

Ogni copia ha un valore di 15 € spese di spedizione incluse (EU-EU)

 

Come fare per aiutarmi?

Ordinare la vostra copia qui!

Ho pensato di fare una raccolta fondi valida come prenotazione qui su indiegogo perchè mi sembra la maniera più semplice e corretta per gestire il vostro denaro e per valutare in quanti desideriate questo oggetto nelle vostre case.

  • Se non si raggiungerà la quota minima stabilita di 300€ per avviare le macchine, i soldi raccolti verranno restituiti per intero;
  • Se invece supererete il budget aggiungerò altri prodotti in regali a scelta tra stampe, artwork originali, adesivi, borse, ecc...

Grazie mille per il vostro supporto!

story:
Après trois ans d'études, d'efforts et d'apprentissage, nous voilà maintenant à la dernière étape de notre parcours dans le programme de photographie au Cégep du Vieux Montréal. Il est maintenant temps de prouver que nous sommes prêt(e)s pour le marché du travail en montrant nos meilleurs travaux et portfolio. Ainsi, le vernissage des 28 finissants en photographie aura lieu le 3 juin prochain au Local Infopresse à 17h.
Pour ce faire, nous avons besoin de toute l'aide possible afin de préparer une exposition à la hauteur du talent des futur(e)s photographes.

Le projet

Grâce à cette exposition, les étudiant(e)s auront la chance

  • D'avoir une expérience semi-professionnelle qui les prépareront à la réalité du marché québécois
  • De rencontrer et de recevoir des commentaires de professionnels du milieu de la photographie à Montréal
  • De pouvoir utiliser l'exposition afin d'établir un réseau de contacts concrets qui les aideront dans leur futur

L'argent amassé

Nous établissons notre objectif à 1500$. L'argent amassé servira entre autre à financer

  • La location de la salle et du mobilier pour l'exposition
  • Le service de traiteur et du bar pour les invités
  • Tout achat d'impression et de papier pour les images servant à être exposés

D'autres façons d'aider

En tant qu'étudiants, nous reconnaissons que l'argent n'est pas toujours au rendez-vous. Toutefois, vous pouvez toujours partager et en parler autour de vous! La visibilité est la clé! Sinon, cela nous fera plaisir de vous voir à l'exposition célébrer nos débuts dans la photographie professionnelle à Montréal!

story:
Hello!

We are The Treehouse Theatre. 
Who's that? 
A group of young adults who started a theatre company, that's who! 
This is our first production that has transformed from page to stage, and we couldn't be more excited about it! 
We create our own work, starting from absolutely nothing, and see how it transforms. 
This particular show St. Arbor the Nursery  is a multi-media show, featuring one woman live on stage, and 2 actresses projected on screen. This show will be a world premier at the Scranton Fringe Festival. For more information/to buy tickets, click here. 
It's not your typical theatre piece, but that's what makes it cool and exciting! 

Ok, I get it, but what's in it for me?

If you donate to our campaign, you get showered with gifts!

$1-9: honorary sapling mentioned in our program

$10-19: everything above, and a signed post card from the cast

$20-29: everything above, and seeds for at-home worship

$30-39: everything above, and 2 tickets to the show

$40-49: everything above, and a handmade surprise from Anna Flynn Meketon

$50-59: everything above, and a soundtrack from the show

$60- 75: everything above, and a personalized thank you from St. Arbor and the  godesses

$75-99:  everything above, and a meal cooked by Melissa Raub  

$100 +: everything above, and we donate a tree in your name in the location of your choosing  

The Impact:

With a little bit of help from you, we can make our debut show a very professional, high quality one. We have big plans for this show after the Scranton Fringe, and we need your help to live out our dreams!
You are not just investing in this show, but our future careers as theatre artists. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Feel free to email us at Melissaraub@gmail.com if you want to donate props or set pieces or want to volunteer!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
I'm so excited to launch the 2nd edition of the Quilter's Planner. Your support and belief in this idea made last year's inaugural edition a run-away success that sold out in just 45 days!

The Quilter's Planner is all about celebrating community. Together we share in the simple beauty we bring to the world through our creativity, hope and joy. You share warmth and kindness through your art, and these small actions make the world a better place.  This is the reason I love our quilting community.

This year's edition is  full of improvements made from the comments and suggestions you provided, including:

  • Weekly and monthly calendar pages
  • Laminated cover and tabs to last all year (NEW!)
  • Gorgeous quilt photography by Kitty Wilkin, of Night Quilter (NEW!)
  • More Project Planning Pages
  • More quilt patterns by top designers (14 to be exact!), 2 in the planner and 12 in a digital download ebook (NEW!)
  • A pocket on the back cover (NEW!)
  • Weekly block designs (with links to full online tutorials)
  • Weekly free motion quilting designs (and links to how-to videos!) (NEW!)
  • A small, elegant, companion planner for when you're on the go (additional purchase required- upgrade to include this for only $10 more) (NEW!)
  • A color chart from Cloud 9 Fabrics Cirrus Solids to help you choose the perfect fabric for your next quilt (NEW!)

 

Like so many of my quilting friends, I used to rely on my smart phone and computer to organize my life and projects. But it just didn't work.

It turns out, research shows that most of us are more productive and happier when we put pen to paper. It makes things more tangible, more real - which means we get more done.

With the Original Quilter's Planner, the projects we daydream about, the tasks for a given week or month - they're all contained in one place - in one book. Nothing gets lost or forgotten or left in a pile of papers to be accidentally tossed in the trash bin.

The Quilter’s Planner is the first of its kind, designed specifically for busy, creative quilters who have many life responsibilities.

It contains everything you need to organize the work, personal and quilting parts of your life.

CALENDAR PAGES

The weekly two-page calendar has plenty of space to  write your daily appointments. The left hand margin has instructions for a quilt block design. Forty of these block designs were developed by fantastic bloggers in our quilting community, and twelve are traditional, tried-and-true blocks that we all love to make.


Just under the block design, you'll find a free motion quilting design from my sketchbook, with a link to a how-to video, to inspire you to practice each week.
The bottom of the page has separate areas for writing your work, personal and quilting to do lists, and an area for notes.
 

The paper is high-quality, which means highlighters will not bleed through. 
 

 

At the top of each day, there is space to write your daily top three -- the most important 3 things you need to get done to have a successful day. Using this method of daily planning will decrease stress and increase your focus, so you'll find you're actually more productive!

The monthly calendar is simple and uncluttered, allowing you the space you need to plan your life.

The left margin has a space to set your monthly goals, to inspire and remind you about what you're working toward achieving each month.  It could be living a healthier life, it could be to finish the quilt that's sitting on your shelf.  It's up to you!  But research shows that setting realistic goals and writing them down leads to more success, so go for it!

 

 

 

PROJECTS

 

I designed The Quilter's Planner not only to be a place that you track your appointments and responsibilities, but also a place you can plan and organize your projects.

The planner contains graph paper for sketching new quilt designs, and space to doodle and practice your free motion quilting designs.

 

This page allows you list all your Works in Progress, so you can see all your quilting projects in one place.  You can track your progress, priorities and deadlines.  This year, there are two pages instead of one.  Need more?  Then make sure you order our newest addition to the line-up this year: The Quilter's Planner Mini. Read more about it below!
 

With the Project Planning page, you can keep notes about what materials you need or have, and the steps you need to take to finish. This can also become a mini-scrapbook of the projects you complete through the year.  Just because you give away a quilt as a gift, doesn't mean you should forget the joys and challenges that went into making it.    
And my favorite part of the Project Planning Page? You can even attach fabric swatches at the bottom and a picture or sketch of your project at the top, with sticky dots!
 

PATTERNS

There are 14 beautiful full quilt patterns, with color instructions, by amazing quilt designers, including:

 

Amy Friend of During Quiet Time

Amy Sinibaldi of Nana and Co.

Amy Smart of Diary of a Quilter

AnneMarie Chany of GenXQuilters

Cheryl Brickey of Meadow Mist Designs

Christa Watson of Christa Quilts

Karen Lewis of Karen Lewis Textiles

Kari Vojtechovsky of Craft-Happy

Katie Blakesley of Swim Bike Quilt

Lee Monroe of May Chappell

Lindsey Rhodes of LR Stitched

Rita Hodge of Red Pepper Quilts

Stephanie Palmer of Late Night Quilter

Yvonne Fuchs of Quilting Jetgirl

 

QUILTING REFERENCES

 

The planner also contains a reference section with important quilting measurements and construction techniques for common designs.  Forgot how to make 8 HSTs at a time?  Just flip to the reference section.  Need to choose a solid backing fabric for that baby quilt you're gifting next month?  Check out the useful Cloud9 Fabrics Cirrus Solids Color Card that's included in your planner. Need to figure out how many squares you can cut from your yardage?  It's all right there, at your finger tips.

 

 

 

BEAUTIFUL & INSPIRATIONAL QUOTES

 

This year you'll find a selection of my favorite quotes that will keep you inspired all year long. These meaningful quotes, in beautiful typography, are perfect for pinning up on your craft room wall.

 

NEW THIS YEAR: A COMPANION BOOK

Think of the Quilter's Planner as your command central for your desk, and the new QP Mini as its trusty side-kick.  They are designed to by used together, to bring maximum organization and peace to your life.

For those of you who like to carry your planner with you wherever you go (hello, that's me!), I've got good news for you.  This year, you can order our QP Mini  in a bundle along with the Quilter's Planner.

The QP Mini is a  small, 5" x 7" book that fits nicely in your bag, and has plenty of room to write your to-do lists, appointments, sketches on graph paper, and project ideas on planning pages.  As the year goes on, you'll be able to visit the QuiltersPlanner.com website to order replacements.

I have been experimenting with the QP Mini this year.  I carry it with me everywhere, and jot down things as they come up.  Then, each morning, I wake up, and sit with a cup of coffee and review the things from my Mini that need to be transferred to my Quilter's Planner to ensure that I know the most important things for my day.

Just because you've got 50 responsibilities to handle that day, with the QP Mini you won't ever forget where you have to be or what you're supposed to be doing when you get there.  What a huge relief!

 

  • Look at the big picture and know what's coming. The monthly calendars allow you to get a bird's eye view of your year and months so you can plan ahead and stay organized.
  • Manage your time. A daily appointment calendar allows you to easily keep track of where you need to be, and how you spend your time.
  • Create a keepsake of your quilting and personal life. By tracking your projects and life, you are keeping a journal, a snap-shot of your life.  You can look back in years to come and see how you've grown and all you've achieved. 
  • Be inspired. Inspirational quotes and beautiful artwork keep you motivated and encourage creativity.
  • This planner set is designed to be tailored to your life.  Whether you're balancing work and your creative life, or setting new goals as a quilter, this planner gives you flexibility to use it in the way that serves you best.
  • Follow your bliss. Manage your time and set realistic goals so you can do more of what you love!
  • Get focused. Weekly and daily layouts, and room to prioritize your daily top three tasks that need to get done allow you to focus your attention on the most important things in your life. 

The Quilter’s Planner is made in the USA.

The self-publishing costs for a printed planner are substantial.  By pre-ordering your planners here on Indiegogo, you'll make sure that you reserve a Quilter's Planner before they sell out, and you're helping me determine just how many to order from the printer this year.  

 

Thank you so much for the love and support you've shown me for the planner this past year, and for helping me make it even better than ever. Please help me get the word out to quilters everywhere about this amazing tool.  Once you log in to Indiegogo, you can quickly and easily share this campaign on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter using the share tools on the sidebars.
 

 

Can I have it shipped to a different address from my billing address or send it to someone as a gift?

Yes! Just tell us at check out where and to whom you want it to be shipped! Gift purchases will include a note so the lucky recipient knows it’s from you. Or you can email me at latenightquilter@gmail.com.

Is the Quilter’s Planner available outside of the United States?

Yes. International shipping can be an uncertain enterprise (as we all know from attempting to ship fabric and swap items to our friends overseas!).  I have worked to get the best rates for and will provide tracking for international shipments. The rates reflect the actual cost for postage and materials - NO PROFIT is derived from shipping fees. 

Last year, I was very green and undercharged for international shipping, which resulted in a significant financial loss on those orders. I cannot afford to make that mistake this year and thus overseas shipping rates are slightly higher than last year.

Do you offer bulk discounts or wholesale purchases?

Yes!  You can check out the Perks section to see the retail bundle discounts I offer. Please contact me with inquiries about wholesale prices at latenightquilter@gmail.com.

Do you offer The Quilter’s Planner in different colors?

No. The Quilter’s Planner 2016 edition is only available in the classic cover. We may offer a variety of colors in the future!

Can I buy The Quilter’s Planner in a retail store?

Yes! You can also buy The Quilter's Planner online at Fat Quarter Shop, and you may see them at quilt shops across the country later this year.   

What is the size of The Quilter’s Planner?

The Quilter’s Planner measures approximately 8.5" x 10".

What is the deal with the Add-On Mini QP Book?

This is designed to work in collaboration with the Original Quilter's Planner; not instead of it.  The QP Mini is designed for you to take with you when you're "on the go" and has space to write down appointments, to-do lists, graph paper sketches and project planning ideas.  It does not have weekly or monthly calendars in it... that is still the job of The Original Quilter's Planner. I'm offering it here on Indiegogo at a discounted price of $9 as part of a bundle with the Quilter's Planner. Additional copies of the QP Mini will be available for purchase at the standard price from www.quiltersplanner.com.

For US purchasers, there is no additional shipping charge when the QP Mini add-on book is included as part of a bundle with the Quilter's Planner. International shipments incur additional charges based on weight, and I have to charge an additional amount to cover this. 

There is NO PROFIT on shipping - just the costs for the fulfillment center and the best rates I was able to negotiate.

When will the Quilter’s Planner arrive in my mailbox?

We’re starting this IndieGoGo campaign with the goal of delivering the 2017 Quilter’s Planner by early October 2016. If you're giving this is a gift (and it certainly WOULD make a phenomenal gift), rest assured - the lucky recipient should have it in his or her hands for the holidays! There is a small chance we’ll face a printing or shipping delay, however you will have this planner in your hands prior to the beginning of the new year!

 

Designing, printing, and shipping a planner has many moving parts. I have a great team that is very experienced in the details of creating and delivering a high quality planner; they are dedicated to making this project a success.

Though we've planned this meticulously, there is a small (less than 5%) chance the Quilter’s Planner could arrive in mailboxes in mid October instead of early October. 

The Quilter’s Planner(TM) is under US Copyright protection and may not be produced, distributed, or used for commercial or personal purposes without our express permission. 

If you have questions or comments, I'd love to hear from you.  You can email me at latenightquilter@gmail.com.
story_txt:
I'm so excited to launch the 2nd edition of the Quilter's Planner. Your support and belief in this idea made last year's inaugural edition a run-away success that sold out in just 45 days!The Quilter's Planner is all about celebrating community. Together we share in the simple beauty we bring to the world through our creativity, hope and joy. You share warmth and kindness through your art, and these small actions make the world a better place.  This is the reason I love our quilting community.This year's edition is  full of improvements made from the comments and suggestions you provided, including:
Weekly and monthly calendar pages
Laminated cover and tabs to last all year (NEW!)
Gorgeous quilt photography by Kitty Wilkin, of Night Quilter (NEW!)
More Project Planning Pages
More quilt patterns by top designers (14 to be exact!), 2 in the planner and 12 in a digital download ebook (NEW!)
A pocket on the back cover (NEW!)
Weekly block designs (with links to full online tutorials)
Weekly free motion quilting designs (and links to how-to videos!) (NEW!)
A small, elegant, companion planner for when you're on the go (additional purchase required- upgrade to include this for only $10 more) (NEW!)
A color chart from Cloud 9 Fabrics Cirrus Solids to help you choose the perfect fabric for your next quilt (NEW!)
 Like so many of my quilting friends, I used to rely on my smart phone and computer to organize my life and projects. But it just didn't work.It turns out, research shows that most of us are more productive and happier when we put pen to paper. It makes things more tangible, more real - which means we get more done.With the Original Quilter's Planner, the projects we daydream about, the tasks for a given week or month - they're all contained in one place - in one book. Nothing gets lost or forgotten or left in a pile of papers to be accidentally tossed in the trash bin.The Quilter’s Planner is the first of its kind, designed specifically for busy, creative quilters who have many life responsibilities.It contains everything you need to organize the work, personal and quilting parts of your life.CALENDAR PAGESThe weekly two-page calendar has plenty of space to  write your daily appointments. The left hand margin has instructions for a quilt block design. Forty of these block designs were developed by fantastic bloggers in our quilting community, and twelve are traditional, tried-and-true blocks that we all love to make.
Just under the block design, you'll find a free motion quilting design from my sketchbook, with a link to a how-to video, to inspire you to practice each week.The bottom of the page has separate areas for writing your work, personal and quilting to do lists, and an area for notes. The paper is high-quality, which means highlighters will not bleed through.   

At the top of each day, there is space to write your daily top three -- the most important 3 things you need to get done to have a successful day. Using this method of daily planning will decrease stress and increase your focus, so you'll find you're actually more productive!

The monthly calendar is simple and uncluttered, allowing you the space you need to plan your life.
The left margin has a space to set your monthly goals, to inspire and remind you about what you're working toward achieving each month.  It could be living a healthier life, it could be to finish the quilt that's sitting on your shelf.  It's up to you!  But research shows that setting realistic goals and writing them down leads to more success, so go for it!
 
 
 PROJECTS
 
I designed The Quilter's Planner not only to be a place that you track your appointments and responsibilities, but also a place you can plan and organize your projects.
The planner contains graph paper for sketching new quilt designs, and space to doodle and practice your free motion quilting designs. 
This page allows you list all your Works in Progress, so you can see all your quilting projects in one place.  You can track your progress, priorities and deadlines.  This year, there are two pages instead of one.  Need more?  Then make sure you order our newest addition to the line-up this year: The Quilter's Planner Mini. Read more about it below! 
With the Project Planning page, you can keep notes about what materials you need or have, and the steps you need to take to finish. This can also become a mini-scrapbook of the projects you complete through the year.  Just because you give away a quilt as a gift, doesn't mean you should forget the joys and challenges that went into making it.    
And my favorite part of the Project Planning Page? You can even attach fabric swatches at the bottom and a picture or sketch of your project at the top, with sticky dots! PATTERNS

There are 14 beautiful full quilt patterns, with color instructions, by amazing quilt designers, including:

 
Amy Friend of During Quiet Time
Amy Sinibaldi of Nana and Co.
Amy Smart of Diary of a Quilter
AnneMarie Chany of GenXQuilters
Cheryl Brickey of Meadow Mist Designs
Christa Watson of Christa Quilts
Karen Lewis of Karen Lewis Textiles
Kari Vojtechovsky of Craft-Happy
Katie Blakesley of Swim Bike Quilt
Lee Monroe of May Chappell
Lindsey Rhodes of LR Stitched
Rita Hodge of Red Pepper Quilts
Stephanie Palmer of Late Night Quilter
Yvonne Fuchs of Quilting Jetgirl QUILTING REFERENCES
 
The planner also contains a reference section with important quilting measurements and construction techniques for common designs.  Forgot how to make 8 HSTs at a time?  Just flip to the reference section.  Need to choose a solid backing fabric for that baby quilt you're gifting next month?  Check out the useful Cloud9 Fabrics Cirrus Solids Color Card that's included in your planner. Need to figure out how many squares you can cut from your yardage?  It's all right there, at your finger tips.

story:
A crowd-funding campaign, raising money to organise and put on, an extraordinary  inspiring central London based group exhibition, exploring the damaging effects of objectification through art,- imagining an alternative more compassionate reality for all.
Wonderful people of the crowd-funding sphere, my name is Jess, i am London based Berliner Artist, Feminist and after this i guess you can call me curator too.

( you can always call me a badass ninja tho!!)

I talk regularly with people about topics such as Feminism, gender inequalities, sexism and the constant objectification many of us face day in and day out.

After yet another defeatist comment like ' Nothing you can do about it' and 'i see your point, but we all know that's not going to change in your life-time' i figured, like Michael Jackson already sung ...... 

If you wanna make the world a better place

TAKE A LOOK AT YOURSELF AND MAKE A CHANGE! 

And then STOPJECTIFY was born....


So here i go, MAKING CHANGE HAPPEN. 

But being an artist and having run a successful crowd-funding campaign for my last solo show #bigswingingovaries once before, i know that without YOU and YOUR HELP, it's pretty difficult, if not impossible.

Change can happen, and it can happen quick. And anybody that tries to convince you otherwise is generally just to afraid to dream big.....not me. 

STOPJECTIFY is going to be a central London based group exhibition. 

This is something much bigger than myself, that i feel will leave much greater impact if many creative thinkers and visionaries  get together and produce an artistic expression of just how damaging objectification and the often directly related self-hate is.

Some sort of benchmark for all of us, to stop the unsolicited judgement of others and ourself,constantly happening in our head without any challenge,

- and turn it into an internal conversation each time it occurs, because realisation is the first step to actually create change. 

The other and hopefully even bigger part of the show, will be art which dares to imagine an alternative reality. One where we are much more conscious about what we say and do to each other and the impact that it has. 

To get people involved from all over the globe ( because this is something we ALL have to deal with) i want the submission process to be as accessible as possible. 

What many of you are not aware of, but all of my artistic fellows know far to well, is that to get our work in front of an audience, we already have to pay frequently and not small amounts of money either, which often doesn't even guarantee that the work will be exhibited, which leaves us artists with a tricky loop to overcome.

To sell art you need to establish yourself, to establish yourself, you need to get your work seen as much as possible, to do that you need money, to make money you have to sell art, or get another job to support your art-making, which sadly often means that artists haven't got enough time to actually make art....

you see what i am getting at. 

SO to fund this show, I NEED YOUR HELP!

This is also the point in the campaign where i am asking YOU to submit work! 


If you are an artist and you want to submit your work  resonating with the project and points below, please head over to www.bigswingingovaries.com/stopjectify   

and fill out the submission form. To me it is irrelevant when the work was produced as i believe that a lot of art is made before it's time and don't want to limit this exhibition by silly time-restrictions.

What i am looking for in this exhibition is art that :


 • defines objectification as one of our universal root problems

• Addresses gender inequalities and social taboos

with regards to objectification

• Explores the difference between consensual roleplay

and everyday misogyny and objectification

• Imagines an alternative, more compassionate

reality where people are more conscious of their

behaviours towards others


Objectification isn't exclusively a gender Problem, it is THE problem, or more to the point- the cause of most of the problems we have in the world today.

The hate and violence against refugees and migrants is also the result of objectifying people.

If we had more empathy and  "humanisation" towards people from other cultures and countries, we wouldn't have a refugee crisis. In other words, we wouldn't have refugees, because there wouldn't be poverty, misery and war in the world. 

( the last part is a direct quote from my brother and had to be added due to it's poignance!)


Please do understand that of course not all art submitted can be accepted, as i am expecting a high attendance and above all the show needs to work as a whole message. 

So if your work doesn't get selected, PLEASE don't take that as a comment on your artistic ability, our friendship or let it stop you from submitting works in the future. It might just mean that somebody submitted work similar to yours already or that in the big picture it just didn't fit with this particular show. ( i know everybody is sensitive about their art ;) 

I have secured the ground-floor space of  central London Gallery, which means the exhibition will be easily accessible ( because trust me, accessibility is a major factor for people to go and see art), it also means that it's not cheap...


In order to allow artists to purely concentrate on creating and submitting work which will fit the brief and inspire you, me and all of us in the process, i need your collective help to pay for this project because if everybody puts in a little, we will all get a lot out of this!

Other costs will be for setting up,taking down and marketing of the exhibit, as well as for the general assistance i will need to pull this off! 

The gallery has a downstairs too, which i want to hire as well, but to not lay all the financial burden on you, i  will also submit an application to the arts council to match-fund my,... our project, as soon as the campaign is up and running because,

I REALLY BELIEVE IN THIS!! 

THE REWARDS AND THE HELPERS

One of the many reasons i am massively excited about this project, is that already so many beautiful people have been helping to get it of the ground. 

From Mr Nick Smith, my forever trusted friend  and web-designer who makes all my design dreams come true in exchange for haircuts :)  .

Mr David Hay who is a producer and pulled in favours left right and center to help me make the video! Richard Topping who kindly got involved and did an incredible job filming me after only knowing of me and my quest for the better part of a day..! Ben Hume- Paton who patently and brilliantly did the edit and whom i have yet to meet. James Downham, one of my hairdressing customers whom i roped in last minute to take over the sound part of the video ( free haircuts for you too James ;)) and Teddy Lamb, Lucy Frost and Nika Obydzinsky , the 3 volunteers who i was allowed to physically label in public ;P

Teddy specifically because he helped me getting over my nerves and assisted all day with the filming!!!

Not to mention ( tho i will on my website ) the awesome folks that did the subtitle translations for my script so that more people get the message,...literally!! 

You see people are amazing!!!!

The other surprise on this project is, that some of my artist friends have actually offered to get involved with the rewards ( imagine that..they believe in me and my drive so much that they give their time and work for free <3)

So there is Anne 'Blondie' Bengard, an incredibly talented artist who will blow you away with her water-colour skills!! She not only offered 4 limited edition signed and numbered giclee prints of her popular piece 'Sweet Tooth' ( below)...(all gone now)

but if that wasn't enough, she added custom A2 watercolour portraits for £450 each.You provide a photo of yourself or anyone you want painted, from the bust up, and Anne will create an original art work in her unmistakable style!!! AAAAAND she added:

 'Who's Your Master?' limited edition A3 giclee print.at £60 

This print which is limited to 50 has not even been released yet and this is your chance to snap one up before it becomes available to everyone else, at a price that's lower than it will be once they go on sale! They are now added to the rewards section on the page, so if it's gone, it's gone! 


Next up is the wonderful HarlotteVonCharlotte. Another incredible artist friend of mine who produced the A5 piece below, of which the original will be available as well as signed and numbered geclee prints that come as part of the Stopjectify pack that includes several prints of contributing artists!



 


 Glenn Fitzy Fitzpatrick 's pencil skills and never ending creativity blow me away on a regular basis, so needless to say that i am massively grateful that he picked up his pencil weapon and drew not 1 but 3 A5 panels for STOPJECTIFY of which each comes at a price of £100 and the limited and signed prints will be also part of the pack! 

Another wonderful artist and contributor to the rewards is my good friend Jane Moore. She is supporting my campaign by giving me some of her original drawings from her own 'sketch a day project' as well as one print! .

Mr Hugo von Hugo also kindly gave another generous donation to the ‪#‎STOPJECTIFY‬ cause!
'Art Needs You' 
60 x 80 cm (A1)
£90 unframed
Limited edition Single colour silk Screen Print (Edition 25). Printed on 300gsm art paper.
Numbered and signed.



And of course this wouldn't be my project if i didn't create something for it myself. So below is my embroidery "understand that you are so much more than just parts" , of which prints will also be available in the pack as well as a limited number of A4 art prints aaaand the embroideries below too!!

 


As you can see in the reward section on the right, 

i will also be stitching a limited number of custom embroidery portraits of you that will be mounted on n A4 board for £350 each. That is special as i have otherwise decided to not do custom work anymore as it just takes to much time away from my quest to change the world. So if custom is what you are after, here is your pop! 

The other custom options created by me and at a greater cost due to obvious reasons, are my custom Retex Portraits at an A2 size for £1500 like the ones you see below 


Other ( and less costly) rewards include STOPJECTIFY t-sirts, tote bags, Sticker-packs, A4 art prints , Patches, Badges  AND 'Cats against Cat calling' T-shirts ;)


Furthermore, my bestie Anja Moehler , who is responsible for crafting the awesome Big swinging Ovaries necklaces and bracelets, has kindly given 2 of them for the campaign, one of which has already been snapped up ;) 




And then of course there is always the option of just donating money and saving me from the taxman ;) 


So all in all you see that i will make this happen no matter what! 

It would just be so much more powerful if you would be a part of it!!


Lots of Love and thanks for taking the time to read!!

Forever yours 


Jess de Wahls
story_txt:
A crowd-funding campaign, raising money to organise and put on, an extraordinary  inspiring central London based group exhibition, exploring the damaging effects of objectification through art,- imagining an alternative more compassionate reality for all.Wonderful people of the crowd-funding sphere, my name is Jess, i am London based Berliner Artist, Feminist and after this i guess you can call me curator too.
( you can always call me a badass ninja tho!!)
I talk regularly with people about topics such as Feminism, gender inequalities, sexism and the constant objectification many of us face day in and day out.
After yet another defeatist comment like ' Nothing you can do about it' and 'i see your point, but we all know that's not going to change in your life-time' i figured, like Michael Jackson already sung ...... 


If you wanna make the world a better place
TAKE A LOOK AT YOURSELF AND MAKE A CHANGE! And then STOPJECTIFY was born.... So here i go, MAKING CHANGE HAPPEN. 
But being an artist and having run a successful crowd-funding campaign for my last solo show #bigswingingovaries once before, i know that without YOU and YOUR HELP, it's pretty difficult, if not impossible.
Change can happen, and it can happen quick. And anybody that tries to convince you otherwise is generally just to afraid to dream big.....not me. 
STOPJECTIFY is going to be a central London based group exhibition. 
This is something much bigger than myself, that i feel will leave much greater impact if many creative thinkers and visionaries  get together and produce an artistic expression of just how damaging objectification and the often directly related self-hate is.
Some sort of benchmark for all of us, to stop the unsolicited judgement of others and ourself,constantly happening in our head without any challenge,
- and turn it into an internal conversation each time it occurs, because realisation is the first step to actually create change. 
The other and hopefully even bigger part of the show, will be art which dares to imagine an alternative reality. One where we are much more conscious about what we say and do to each other and the impact that it has. 
To get people involved from all over the globe ( because this is something we ALL have to deal with) i want the submission process to be as accessible as possible. 
What many of you are not aware of, but all of my artistic fellows know far to well, is that to get our work in front of an audience, we already have to pay frequently and not small amounts of money either, which often doesn't even guarantee that the work will be exhibited, which leaves us artists with a tricky loop to overcome.
To sell art you need to establish yourself, to establish yourself, you need to get your work seen as much as possible, to do that you need money, to make money you have to sell art, or get another job to support your art-making, which sadly often means that artists haven't got enough time to actually make art....
you see what i am getting at. 
SO to fund this show, I NEED YOUR HELP!
This is also the point in the campaign where i am asking YOU to submit work! 

If you are an artist and you want to submit your work  resonating with the project and points below, please head over to www.bigswingingovaries.com/stopjectify   
and fill out the submission form. To me it is irrelevant when the work was produced as i believe that a lot of art is made before it's time and don't want to limit this exhibition by silly time-restrictions.
What i am looking for in this exhibition is art that :



 • defines objectification as one of our universal root problems
• Addresses gender inequalities and social taboos
with regards to objectification
• Explores the difference between consensual roleplay
and everyday misogyny and objectification





• Imagines an alternative, more compassionate
reality where people are more conscious of their
behaviours towards others


Objectification isn't exclusively a gender Problem, it is THE problem, or more to the point- the cause of most of the problems we have in the world today.
The hate and violence against refugees and migrants is also the result of objectifying people.
If we had more empathy and  "humanisation" towards people from other cultures and countries, we wouldn't have a refugee crisis. In other words, we wouldn't have refugees, because there wouldn't be poverty, misery and war in the world. ( the last part is a direct quote from my brother and had to be added due to it's poignance!)


Please do understand that of course not all art submitted can be accepted, as i am expecting a high attendance and above all the show needs to work as a whole message. 
So if your work doesn't get selected, PLEASE don't take that as a comment on your artistic ability, our friendship or let it stop you from submitting works in the future. It might just mean that somebody submitted work similar to yours already or that in the big picture it just didn't fit with this particular show. ( i know everybody is sensitive about their art ;) 
I have secured the ground-floor space of  central London Gallery, which means the exhibition will be easily accessible ( because trust me, accessibility is a major factor for people to go and see art), it also means that it's not cheap...



In order to allow artists to purely concentrate on creating and submitting work which will fit the brief and inspire you, me and all of us in the process, i need your collective help to pay for this project because if everybody puts in a little, we will all get a lot out of this!
Other costs will be for setting up,taking down and marketing of the exhibit, as well as for the general assistance i will need to pull this off! 
The gallery has a downstairs too, which i want to hire as well, but to not lay all the financial burden on you, i  will also submit an application to the arts council to match-fund my,... our project, as soon as the campaign is up and running because,
I REALLY BELIEVE IN THIS!! 
THE REWARDS AND THE HELPERS
One of the many reasons i am massively excited about this project, is that already so many beautiful people have been helping to get it of the ground. 
From Mr Nick Smith, my forever trusted friend  and web-designer who makes all my design dreams come true in exchange for haircuts :)  .
Mr David Hay who is a producer and pulled in favours left right and center to help me make the video! Richard Topping who kindly got involved and did an incredible job filming me after only knowing of me and my quest for the better part of a day..! Ben Hume- Paton who patently and brilliantly did the edit and whom i have yet to meet. James Downham, one of my hairdressing customers whom i roped in last minute to take over the sound part of the video ( free haircuts for you too James ;)) and Teddy Lamb, Lucy Frost and Nika Obydzinsky , the 3 volunteers who i was allowed to physically label in public ;P
Teddy specifically because he helped me getting over my nerves and assisted all day with the filming!!!
Not to mention ( tho i will on my website ) the awesome folks that did the subtitle translations for my script so that more people get the message,...literally!! 
You see people are amazing!!!!
The other surprise on this project is, that some of my artist friends have actually offered to get involved with the rewards ( imagine that..they believe in me and my drive so much that they give their time and work for free <3)
So there is Anne 'Blondie' Bengard, an incredibly talented artist who will blow you away with her water-colour skills!! She not only offered 4 limited edition signed and numbered giclee prints of her popular piece 'Sweet Tooth' ( below)...(all gone now)

but if that wasn't enough, she added custom A2 watercolour portraits for £450 each.You provide a photo of yourself or anyone you want painted, from the bust up, and Anne will create an original art work in her unmistakable style!!! AAAAAND she added: 'Who's Your Master?' limited edition A3 giclee print.at £60 
This print which is limited to 50 has not even been released yet and this is your chance to snap one up before it becomes available to everyone else, at a price that's lower than it will be once they go on sale! They are now added to the rewards section on the page, so if it's gone, it's gone! 



Next up is the wonderful HarlotteVonCharlotte. Another incredible artist friend of mine who produced the A5 piece below, of which the original will be available as well as signed and numbered geclee prints that come as part of the Stopjectify pack that includes several prints of contributing artists!


 

 Glenn Fitzy Fitzpatrick 's pencil skills and never ending creativity blow me away on a regular basis, so needless to say that i am massively grateful that he picked up his pencil weapon and drew not 1 but 3 A5 panels for STOPJECTIFY of which each comes at a price of £100 and the limited and signed prints will be also part of the pack! 

Another wonderful artist and contributor to the rewards is my good friend Jane Moore. She is supporting my campaign by giving me some of her original drawings from her own 'sketch a day project' as well as one print! .




Mr Hugo von Hugo also kindly gave another generous donation to the ‪#‎STOPJECTIFY‬ cause!'Art Needs You' 60 x 80 cm (A1)£90 unframedLimited edition Single colour silk Screen Print (Edition 25). Printed on 300gsm art paper.Numbered and signed.


And of course this wouldn't be my project if i didn't create something for it myself. So below is my embroidery "understand that you are so much more than just parts" , of which prints will also be available in the pack as well as a limited number of A4 art prints aaaand the embroideries below too!!
 





As you can see in the reward section on the right, 

 i will also be stitching a limited number of custom embroidery portraits of you that will be mounted on n A4 board for £350 each. That is special as i have otherwise decided to not do custom work anymore as it just takes to much time away from my quest to change the world. So if custom is what you are after, here is your pop! 
The other custom options created by me and at a greater cost due to obvious reasons, are my custom Retex Portraits at an A2 size for £1500 like the ones you see below 




Other ( and less costly) rewards include STOPJECTIFY t-sirts, tote bags, Sticker-packs, A4 art prints , Patches, Badges  AND 'Cats against Cat calling' T-shirts ;)





Furthermore, my bestie Anja Moehler , who is responsible for crafting the awesome Big swinging Ovaries necklaces and bracelets, has kindly given 2 of them for the campaign, one of which has already been snapped up ;) 



And then of course there is always the option of just donating money and saving me from the taxman ;) 

So all in all you see that i will make this happen no matter what! 
It would just be so much more powerful if you would be a part of it!!

Lots of Love and thanks for taking the time to read!!
Forever yours 

Jess de Wahls

story:
Short Summary

I'm Thea Gahr, an artist & educator with a history of using art as a medium to engage in social movements. Printmaking is a proven agent of social change, and I want to bring this opportunity to Haiti. I have been invited to teach screen-printing as a tool for advocacy to health educators in Mirebalais, Haiti during the Social Medicine Consortium. I hope to empower the educators with hands-on skill-building so that they can teach others in the future, including leaving supplies to start the print studio.

What We Need

  • Funding to fly to Haiti with supplies ($1000)
  • Funding for silkscreen supplies: Screens, transparencies, squeegies, inks, spatulas, paper, sharpies, fabric, blank t-shirts, cutting tools, tape, poster paper, emulsion, glass, power washers, light bulbs, spray bottles, etc. ($1000)
  • Funding to set up the art workshop classroom: tables, chairs, fans, general school supplies ($2000)

What You Get

  • Recieve a one-of-a-kind print handmade by me
  • Even if the full amount isn't raised, what we do raise, we will buy the supplies we can
  • If we raise beyond our goal, it will fund continuing education & resources for the community printmaking workshop.

The Impact

  • Printmaking is a proven agent of social change
  • Member of Justseeds social justice printmaking radical artist cooperative for seven years
  • I have many years experience educating about art, including being the drawing & printmaking teacher at Linfield College
  • I have a lot of experience teaching in non-traditional and unorthodox environments.

Risks & Challenges

  • I'm going to Haiti no matter what because the need is so great and because I believe in this project. I need you to help me by providing the resources I need to have the greatest impact possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help me spread the word! Share on your social media networks. Spread the love!
  • Contact me if you are interested in an in-kind contribution of art supplies.

story:
Bonjour,

Je m'appelle Joad, j'ai 22ans et je suis étudiant au Centre National des Arts du Cirque à Châlons-en-Champagne. Je travaille au mât chinois depuis presque 5ans. C'est grâce au mât que je peux vous raconter des histoires et vous laisser plonger dans mon univers, et c'est pour pouvoir vous proposer de voyager avec mon mât et moi que j'ai besoin de votre soutient.

Pour le moment je travaille avec un matériel qui n'est pas le mien mais qui appartient à l'école, sans quoi il me serait bien difficile d'avancer. Mais d'ici peu mon cursus va prendre fin et je vais rapidement avoir besoin de mon propre matériel pour faire mon chemin dans le monde du spectacle vivant.

Alors voilà, c'est un mât de 6m de haut, du revêtement en néoprène, des mètres de câbles en acier, des mètres de sangle, des maillons rapides, des cliquets, des manilles, des deltas... En bref de quoi le faire tenir suffisamment bien, parce que si ça ne tient pas moi non plus je ne tiens pas.

De ce fait, aujourd'hui j'en ai pour 850€ pour le mât et 150€ pour les accroches.
Je me permet donc de faire appel à votre générosité pour soutenir de nouveaux artistes comme moi qui essaient de vous faire rêver et de vous partager leurs idées à travers de nombreuses formes.

Merci du fond du cœur et n'hésitez pas à parler de ce projet autour de vous !

-----------------------------------------

I'm Joad, Im 22 and I'm a student at the National Circus Art Center in France. I practice chinese pole for almost 5 years. With my chinese pole, I can tell you stories and make you dive into my universe, and it's to be able to travel with me that I need your help.

I'm currently working with some material that is not mine but the one of the school, and without this it will be hard to work. In few months I'll finish my last year in school and I'll quickly need to have my own material to act out there.

So it's a 6m pole with neoprene, meters of cable, meters of strap, quick links, ratchets, deltas... Let's say that it has to hold in place, because if not, I'll fall with.

The pole costs 850€ and the fittings cost 150€. So I ask for your generosity to help new circus artists like me who trie to make you dream and share their ideas acting.

A huge thanks and don't hesitate to share this project !

Our Story

I need a haircut.  I also like people to send me money.  Also this will be the greatest most amazing piece of art ever created.   yeah....also i like when people send me free money without ever expecting it back.  


The Impact

Our initial goal is just a start.  I could do this again, like in 6 weeks?


What We Need & What You Get

You get to know that you have helped create this work of art.

Other Ways You Can Help

by sending me free stuff

story:
Please help us raise funds to build Trinity del Fuego for Apogaea Colorado June 4-9, 2014!

Trinity del Fuego consists of three 16 ft. sculptures which represent the triple Goddesses Inanna, Hekate, and Medusa. They are all akin to the three aspects of the Celtic Fire Goddess Brigid. Therefore, all will contain their own fire effects systems and be united by the central eternal flame of Brigid. Three serious faces peer down and out at the observers who approach them. Within the circle of these fabulous deities one will feel the power and the essence of the moon in its three phases: crescent, full, and dark; the three stages of woman's life: as Artemis the virgin huntress, Persephone the nymph, and Hekate the crone. They look three ways at once: past, present, and future, and offer their gifts of inspiration, vision, magic, and regeneration to humanity.

Visitors will be invited to learn blacksmithing at the forge of Medusa's tentacles, or push a button to produce a huge blast of fire from the heads of Hekate and Inanna. Medusa's snakes will spit fire as on lookers warm themselves by all the fires. Participants may also make offerings or deposit written wishes into the central "womb" / eternal flame in honor of the triple goddess Brigid and her compatriots Hekate, Medusa & Inanna. These deities are fertile ground and the keepers of the seed that is held in the darkness, until we ignite those fires and introduce and produce transformation...

The symbol for this installation is 333
(Triple Goddess x 3) = Goddess Manifest

All stand at the gateway between shadow and light — Between the underworld and the upper world.


TRINITY IMAGES

The Impact

The plan is to build at the Mission Road Warehouse in San Antonio where community will be created through art despite any obstacles. Through collaboration, creativity, and instruction people will have the opportunity to learn new metal working skills and techniques while forging new friendships and alliances.

At Apogaea attendees will have several opportunities to interact with Trinity del Fuego:

1) There is the open invitation for everyone to experience the excitement and the heat of forging metal with the fires of Medusa.

2) There is the button pushing invitation to make large bursts of flame gush out of both Hekate's and Inanna's heads.

3) There is the central dish containing the eternal flame (with a surrounding wood fire) in which participants can cast their written dreams or wishes into.

4) And then there's just the pure pleasure of stopping and enjoying the warmth of an open fire on a chilly night as one makes one's way about the event.

What We Need

Each structure will need fresh steel to create their understructures; sheet metal, scrap metal, and found objects to create their outer skins. All will need pyro-technic components.

We need approximately $7500 to build each of the three individual sculptures, and
an additional $750 to create the central hearth. That's approximately $21,500 Total to create and transport this project to Apogaea in Colorado June 4-9, 2014.

This is how your donations will help us build this project:

Steel for Understructure:
1/2" round
3/4"round
3" square tubing
3/16" x 3" flat
Salvaged/Scrap Steel: various
Nuts & Bolts: multi

Materials for Exteriors:
Plate & Perforated Steel
Copper Sheets
Casting Supplies
55-gal Steel Drums

Pyrotechnic Components:
Hoses & Clamps various
1/2" round Copper and/or Steel Pipe
Selonoid Valve
90/T Fittings

Tools/Machinery:
Welding Wire .025
Argon Gas
Grinding discs, Cut off wheels: multi

Blacksmithing Tools:
Gas Forge (kit)
Anvils

Other:
Wood 1-2 cords
Propane

Other Ways You Can Help

DONATE SCRAP METAL! Or donate your time as a VOLUNTEER.

Thanks in advance!
