story:
Short Summary

Art For Life is a community of single parents who are trying to better their lives through art, and artists who are bring the art world to the lives of the less fortunate. We've found that bringing art to the lives of those in need allows those who participate to dream, hope, express, and create. It is imperative to their well-being to be able to reflect on their life-aspirations, rather than dwell on their life-obstacles. Often times the art is donated to other organizations to help fund their causes as well. Please help us raise funds to help those in need - progress in life, and have faith in themselves and in the humanity of others.

My name is Sonny Luca. I am a single father of three children. After many years of life-obstacles, trials, and tribulations - I have returned to art. I had never forgotten about my love for art, and the way it affects people. Even through losing a spouse, being an instant single-father, and being homeless - I have remembered the joy that art always brought to my family, my community, and myself. I have been extremely lucky, and grateful, to have had the opportunity to bring art to others in situations similar to mine.

I have found that bringing art to the lives of those in need allows those who participate to dream, hope, express, and create. It is imperative to their well-being to be able to reflect on their life-aspirations, rather than dwell on their life-obstacles. Often times the art is donated to other organizations to help fund their causes as well. This, in turn, brings a sense of community, service, and self-worth to the artists.

Please help us raise funds to help those in need - progress in life, and have faith in themselves and in the humanity of others.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

The some of the funds will go to help pay for resources - not only for the art. We will be purchasing the supplies for art projects, and we will be helping the artists with their life needs as we can; i.e. help with housing, food, toiletries, clothing, et cetera.

Contributors will be recognized with the following rewards:

  1. For contributions of $50 - set of 4 postcards with limited edition prints of original artwork. 
  2. For contributions of $100 - set of 4 postcards with prints of original artwork; and one (1) 8 x 10 limited edition print of original artwork.
  3. For contributions of $200 - set of 4 postcards with prints of original artwork; two (2) 8 x 10 limited edition prints of two original artworks; 
  4. For contributions of $500 - set of 4 postcards with limited edition prints of original artwork; one (1) exclusive original 8x10 custom artwork. 
  5. For contributions of $1000 or more - set of 4 postcards with limited edition prints of original artwork; one (1) exclusive original 11x14 custom artwork. 

NEW!!! Most Referral Award - The visitor with the most referrals will be awarded one (1) 8 x 10 limited edition print of original artwork.

 

The Impact

Being a single parent is a hard reality for both the child (who is usually confused and full of questions) and the parent (who is usually in the same devastating confusion with the added stress of the responsibility of another life as well). The impact of being homeless and losing your world and resources as well makes it unbearable. When you are a single parent who works multiple jobs to try to make ends meet and the state resources deny you aid for being the good guy and maintaining work... well, where do you turn to then? 

Our community of artists believe that with just a little assistance; hope can inspire and motivate good people to accomplish greatness. I have seen this very principle work before.

In the past, we have raised funds for Brock Stock 2011; which directly assisted the family of a volunteer fire-fighter who lost his young infant after Brock fought for life for more than 21 days. 

In addition to this, we have assisted several community charities such as: the Shriner's Hospital for Children, the Boy Scouts of America's Scouting for Food project, and many more. 

It is our sincere belief that through service to our community, each of us can make a difference in the lives of everyone. Each of us can do our part to help someone stand again. It is a fundamental belief of ours that we can do greater by offering someone help up, rather than a hand out; that each single parent can stand up again and regain some piece of the life they once lived. The impact of this campaign essentially gives control out of the wake of loss to single-parent families. 

Other Ways You Can Help

City to City. Nation to Nation... Be our voice. Tell a friend. Tell your neighbor. Tell your family. Your cousins... Tell a stranger. Tell everyone! Share this campaign. Get involved. Post it. Repost it and Repost it again. Help us and get involved in... Art for Life!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Art For Life is a community of single parents who are trying to better their lives through art, and artists who are bring the art world to the lives of the less fortunate. We've found that bringing art to the lives of those in need allows those who participate to dream, hope, express, and create. It is imperative to their well-being to be able to reflect on their life-aspirations, rather than dwell on their life-obstacles. Often times the art is donated to other organizations to help fund their causes as well. Please help us raise funds to help those in need - progress in life, and have faith in themselves and in the humanity of others.
My name is Sonny Luca. I am a single father of three children. After many years of life-obstacles, trials, and tribulations - I have returned to art. I had never forgotten about my love for art, and the way it affects people. Even through losing a spouse, being an instant single-father, and being homeless - I have remembered the joy that art always brought to my family, my community, and myself. I have been extremely lucky, and grateful, to have had the opportunity to bring art to others in situations similar to mine.
I have found that bringing art to the lives of those in need allows those who participate to dream, hope, express, and create. It is imperative to their well-being to be able to reflect on their life-aspirations, rather than dwell on their life-obstacles. Often times the art is donated to other organizations to help fund their causes as well. This, in turn, brings a sense of community, service, and self-worth to the artists.
Please help us raise funds to help those in need - progress in life, and have faith in themselves and in the humanity of others.
 


What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:
The some of the funds will go to help pay for resources - not only for the art. We will be purchasing the supplies for art projects, and we will be helping the artists with their life needs as we can; i.e. help with housing, food, toiletries, clothing, et cetera.
Contributors will be recognized with the following rewards:

For contributions of $50 - set of 4 postcards with limited edition prints of original artwork. 
For contributions of $100 - set of 4 postcards with prints of original artwork; and one (1) 8 x 10 limited edition print of original artwork.
For contributions of $200 - set of 4 postcards with prints of original artwork; two (2) 8 x 10 limited edition prints of two original artworks; 
For contributions of $500 - set of 4 postcards with limited edition prints of original artwork; one (1) exclusive original 8x10 custom artwork. 
For contributions of $1000 or more - set of 4 postcards with limited edition prints of original artwork; one (1) exclusive original 11x14 custom artwork. 

NEW!!! Most Referral Award - The visitor with the most referrals will be awarded one (1) 8 x 10 limited edition print of original artwork.
 


The Impact
Being a single parent is a hard reality for both the child (who is usually confused and full of questions) and the parent (who is usually in the same devastating confusion with the added stress of the responsibility of another life as well). The impact of being homeless and losing your world and resources as well makes it unbearable. When you are a single parent who works multiple jobs to try to make ends meet and the state resources deny you aid for being the good guy and maintaining work... well, where do you turn to then? 
Our community of artists believe that with just a little assistance; hope can inspire and motivate good people to accomplish greatness. I have seen this very principle work before.
In the past, we have raised funds for Brock Stock 2011; which directly assisted the family of a volunteer fire-fighter who lost his young infant after Brock fought for life for more than 21 days. 
In addition to this, we have assisted several community charities such as: the Shriner's Hospital for Children, the Boy Scouts of America's Scouting for Food project, and many more. 
It is our sincere belief that through service to our community, each of us can make a difference in the lives of everyone. Each of us can do our part to help someone stand again. It is a fundamental belief of ours that we can do greater by offering someone help up, rather than a hand out; that each single parent can stand up again and regain some piece of the life they once lived. The impact of this campaign essentially gives control out of the wake of loss to single-parent families. 


Other Ways You Can Help
City to City. Nation to Nation... Be our voice. Tell a friend. Tell your neighbor. Tell your family. Your cousins... Tell a stranger. Tell everyone! Share this campaign. Get involved. Post it. Repost it and Repost it again. Help us and get involved in... Art for Life!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my loves. My name is Sarah Myles Spencer. I know I'm supposed to be brief here, but I don't know how I can sum all of this up in just a few words. Please bare with me!

For those of you who don't know me, I'm a singing, writing, poeming, hard loving, mama from California who recently moved to Norman, Oklahoma. The move was the culmination of a long and challenging past couple of years. I was diagnosed with a chronic illness, my father was diagnosed with terminal cancer, I was his primary caretaker, and he eventually passed away. After his passing, my husband and I were in severe debt from all the medical bills and long term care. We were unexpectedly forced to move with our children, from our home and later that year we became homeless. It was a devastating time for us, but thanks to community and grace and love and our own courageous spirits, we are still here and thriving.

After my father died, I made a vow that I was going to come out of my shell and do things I hadn't yet had the courage to do; things that I had allowed my my own fears and insecurities to get in the way of. I had been a writer and performer for a long time, but in the face of tragedy, my art had become stagnent. So, one of the things I did was road-tripping hundreds of miles with two friends last year, to volunteer at The Women of the World National Poetry Slam (WoWps).

WoWps is one of three National Poetry Slam events headed by Poetry Slam Incorporated (PSI). Each year, it takes place in a different city and state, and hundreds of women come together from all over to share their poems and their hearts at this four day festival. Roughly 80 women compete every year.

I enjoyed the experience of volunteering very much, but my heart longed for the experience of sharing in this community as an artist. Well, it's amazing what you can manifest without even realizing it, and this year in March, I have the privilege and the opportunity to represent my venue, Red Dirt Poetry, at WoWps.

This is where you come in.

This year, WoWps is being held in Minneapolis, Minnesota. My venue covers the cost of my registration for the competition, but I must cover the cost of travel, room, and meals. I don't drive due to health reasons, which means I must either fly or carpool with another person. This is my first national event and a huge step outside of my comfort zone, and I need community to help me make it happen. I humbly ask you, to join me, in this chapter of my journey to step into my personal truth, to live with my heart open, and free.

What We Need & What You Get

I spent a lot of time on this part! In fact, I agnoized over it a great deal. Asking for help can be hard sometimes, especially with so little time, and I really wanted to give something special back in return. Now it's finally put together, so here's the deal: 

-The cost of a hotel room for the four days I need to be there is $540 including tax

-The cost of parking is $65

-The cost of gas will be roughly $300

Other expenses I haven't added up yet include:

-Meals for four days plus during travel

-emergency funds

-funds for printing and mailing merch

As you can see, this totals over the amount I am aiming for. My plan is to split costs with other participants, but in a worse case scenario, I will have to cover all of this myself. In the worst of worse case scenarios, I would have to get a plane ticket last minute, which would put me well over a thousand dollars. I don't foresee that happening. I'm feeling pretty optimistic despite my nerves! On the flipside, if I am driving with a companion who is splitting costs with me, this hopefully gives me room to cover any car maintenance issues or anything else that might arise. It also enables me to use funds for printing and mailing merchandise.

Like I said, I know I may be low balling it, but I would rather ask for a solid minimum amount, than to ask for too much. I would be so grateful to meet my minimum goal; I would be over the moon if I some how raised more. That being said, if I do happen to have have any excess above the cost of travel, hotel, and parking, it will go towards any of the above mentioned remaining expenses like meals, vehicle care, printing, shipping, etc. In the event that there is a large excess, this money will be put into holding and will go towards my next book/album. And I will communicate those details wholly, if for some amazing reason that occurs. In contrast, if for some reason I don't reach my goal, the money will still go towards these things. I will simply have to find a way to get it done. I want to be as transparent here as possible. If we hit any bumps in the road or if I don't make enough for some reason or have any sort of emergency that I am having trouble working through, I will be here, communicating about it. I DO NOT FORESEE ANY OF THAT. But I know it's important for everyone donating to know what would happen if, if, if. I believe my needs will be met though. I believe I will be taken care of. I believe in this; in community.

Now that we've covered that, I am offering some really fun incentives to those who donate that I am feeling super excited about. I am glad to be able to offer you something awesome in return; a real part of me, my art, and craft, and some from those who are close to me.

Some things that are on the table: There is plenty of merchandise - some new and even some unreleased. There are poem commissions, singing voicemails, videos, and personalized songs. There are even personal portraits, beauty products, tarot readings, and nutritional consultations from some incredibly talented friends of mine. And above everything, there is gratitude; SO MUCH GRATITUDE. Anyone who donates is acknowledged, no matter how big or small your contribution. Because IT ALL MAKES A DIFFERENCE. It really does.

Note: Estimated delivery date for items is set for April and May. While more detailed packages may need this extension, I expect chapbooks, e-downloads, and notes to be delivered anytime between the end of March and middle of April. As for the unrecorded and unreleased items, poem comissions, and portraits, I will personally correspond with those donors and recipients of those items to work out personalized delivery dates as is agreed upon by both parties and in a timely manner.

ALSO: You can donate ANY AMOUNT - the amounts I have listed are directely related to the perks. You can donate any other amount you would like and I will personally thank you! 

The Impact

We all have one life to do with as much as we possibly can. But really, what we have is today. And every day I wake up, whether it's a good day or a rough day, I try to make it count in some way. And the best way I know how to do that is to love, and my poems and my voice are one of the many ways in which I love. And I believe that my voice has meaning and value and I deeply desire the experience of co-mingling that voice with so many other significant voices all telling our truths, all coming together, all loving hard. I believe that this is what's in store for me on this adventure.

The difference you make here is enormous to me; inside me, it is something I will take with me forever, and in turn this affects my family, and the people around me. We never know who we will affect in this lifetime. Know, that by contributing here, you are affecting someone in the most wonderful ways.

Words will never be able to express what all of this really means to me, nor the gratitude I have for each one of you that assists in it, but goodness knows I will try.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone can donate money, but that doesn't mean you can't help. EVERYONE CAN HELP. Please, just take a moment and donate your TIME by sharing my campaign - my story - and a little extra love. Indiegogo provides easy sharing tools to do this, so please, share share SHARE away. I am getting this up and running with just enough time to make an impact so anything you can do to spread the word helps me so immensely.

If you have any questions please feel free to contact me. So much gratitude. So much love. So much.

-Sarah

P.S. ALSO: *Nova Sol Holistic Studios will donate 25% of their sales to me for anybody I refer who purchases additional items for Valentine's Day or dry winter skin through Feb 14th! Just mention me when buying!

story:
Every year, Loser Slam sends a team to a national competition and they face off against the best talent the nation, and sometimes the world, has to offer. The team is composed of four individuals who write, edit, and polish poems, and then perform them in preliminary slam competitions through out the year to make one final Grand Slam. The top four poets in that final grand slam go to nationals. 

We are those four poets.


But we need our community to back us. 
The competition costs money to enter, to stay in the host hotel, and to travel to the host city. This year it is in Charlotte, North Carolina.
We have come up with some ways to raise money ourselves:
We'll be selling t-shirts and CD's, putting on team showcases, auctioning off our personal effects, selling our souls and ourselves, all for the love of poetry.
But even with all of this, it is still not going to be enough to get us there. So we need your help. Every donation will help. 
And we've come up with 10 levels to reward you for your generosity.

We thank you immensely for your contribution and your continued support. Come see us at The Green Planet Coffee Company on the Asbury Circle in Ocean, NJ every Wednesday at 7pm.

If you can't contribute financially, please share this link on your facebook wall, a wealthy investors primary email account, or tell the monopoly man about it. Anything.

story:
Camp Craft, Coming to an Eastside, Los Angeles Neighborhood Soon!

Those of you who have known me for many years as a friend, co-worker, or sitter, know that children play a very important role in my life. I am very grateful to have the opportunity to develop a business plan that involves children and provides a valuable service to the community. I believe that there is a need for a do-it-yourself studio for both children and adults to create quality, hand-made crafts. I developed Camp Craft as a creative studio where crafting is readily available during studio hours with a surplus of quality supplies, ample space, and with people like myself who love both children and crafts working there.  

In addition to offering drop-in DIY crafting, Camp Craft will have multiple stations offering age-appropriate options for children and items for adults to create. A few of the craft stations will include: build a terrarium, create a dreamcatcher, make a scented mason jar candle (for adults) or a beeswax candle (for children), and will have a monthly featured craft.

Camp Craft will also play a vital role in the community by offering a space for events and the opportunity to engage in an artful activity to celebrate an occasion. Whether you need a venue for a child's birthday party, a girls' night out, or simply would like to learn to make something new-- Camp Craft will serve as a space for celebration and creativity. 

Camp Craft will have four elements:

• Open craft studio hours with specialized craft stations,

• A venue for birthday parties for children on weekend days and special events for adults in the evenings,

• Workshops to expand a crafting skill set,

• Craft subscriptions will be available for those who may not visit the store, or would like to supplement their crafting by receiving Craft Packs by mail. This option may (and should!) be used for gifting.

 

The Plan

I have developed the concept and taken Camp Craft through the planning stages and am reaching out to my community to ask for support in raising the start-up funds to allow Camp Craft to become a reality. Contributors will not only help in making the store come to fruition, they will enrich the local community by supporting the establishment of a space that fosters creative development.

Camp Craft will open a brick and mortar store in Spring of 2014 and will host pop-up events in boutiques, farmers markets and crafting fairs leading up to its opening. There will also be an online store offering Craft Packs for sale, coming soon. 


What We Need

To make all of this a reality, Camp Craft needs $15,000 in funding to become an independently owned and run business. Start-up costs have been budgeted and include the following:

Legal Costs: 10%
Raw and Marketing Materials: 10%
Materials: 20%
Renovation and Set-Up: 20%
Rental Assistance: 40%

Your support and generosity is essential to raising the funds needed to establish Camp Craft. Thank you for taking the time to learn about Camp Craft and I look forward to creating something with you very soon.

***

A special thanks to those who helped me make the short film. Thanks to Doug Ward for the equipment, Michael Regilio for the music, Ben Montague for editing, and to The Schiller-Petrunia Family, The Nameths, and The Schemel-Soletti family for letting me film their adorable children.

story:
South Side Battle Train Throw Down!


Keep the donations coming! We are over $4,000 out of pocket. Help!

WHO ARE WE?
We are a group of South Minneapolis builders, welders, engineers, neighbors and creators. This is our  6th year of particupating in the Heart of the Beast's May Day Parade and celebration  (http://hobt.org/mayday/parade/).

Every year we push the limit to top our prior creation of human powered trailers and floats. We build a train of four to five floats carrying live music, cooking, shelter and other spectacles. Last year we built a mobile skate ramp this year building a Human Powered Ferris Wheel. This year will include a modified Pedal Bear from the Pedal Bear Art Shanty.  https://www.facebook.com/PedalBearArtShanty

These projects come from our passion to create interactive art spectacles for and by the community. We hold 4 workshops a week at the Carlyle's family "shop". Carlyle functions as our home base, our head conductor and organizer.

WHY DONATE?
This campaign is to raise funds for materials ONLY. All of our  participation is passion based, we do not get paid for our involvement. 

The money you donate will be used to purchase: steel, fix trailers,  propane, electricity and welding consumables and food that will be cooked and passed our for free the day of the parade. You make this possible! Look at the photos.

IT CAN HAPPEN IF:
200 people give $10
100 people give $20
50 people give $40
20 people give $100

PLEASE SUPPORT US!

WORKSHOPS! 
Come by and check us out, get to know us.
Bring ideas, skills, questions, food, time, hands, excitement 
For the most part Workshops are
Wed/Fri/Sat/Sun. 6pm-? 
3100 Portland Ave S in the GARAGE.

Spread the word! 
Let people know about us. We can use all the support financially and hands at the workshops. 

Thank You!
story_txt: South Side Battle Train Throw Down!Keep the donations coming! We are over $4,000 out of pocket. Help!WHO ARE WE?We are a group of South Minneapolis builders, welders, engineers, neighbors and creators. This is our  6th year of particupating in the Heart of the Beast's May Day Parade and celebration  (http://hobt.org/mayday/parade/).Every year we push the limit to top our prior creation of human powered trailers and floats. We build a train of four to five floats carrying live music, cooking, shelter and other spectacles. Last year we built a mobile skate ramp this year building a Human Powered Ferris Wheel. This year will include a modified Pedal Bear from the Pedal Bear Art Shanty.  https://www.facebook.com/PedalBearArtShantyThese projects come from our passion to create interactive art spectacles for and by the community. We hold 4 workshops a week at the Carlyle's family "shop". Carlyle functions as our home base, our head conductor and organizer.WHY DONATE?This campaign is to raise funds for materials ONLY. All of our  participation is passion based, we do not get paid for our involvement. The money you donate will be used to purchase: steel, fix trailers,  propane, electricity and welding consumables and food that will be cooked and passed our for free the day of the parade. You make this possible! Look at the photos.IT CAN HAPPEN IF:200 people give $10100 people give $2050 people give $4020 people give $100PLEASE SUPPORT US!WORKSHOPS! Come by and check us out, get to know us.Bring ideas, skills, questions, food, time, hands, excitement For the most part Workshops areWed/Fri/Sat/Sun. 6pm-? 3100 Portland Ave S in the GARAGE.Spread the word! Let people know about us. We can use all the support financially and hands at the workshops. Thank You!

story:
“Modern Times” is an experimental art film that will focus on the oppression that results from the stubborn presence of gender norms in our society. The title, a nod to Charlie Chaplin's film of the same name, is both ironic in relation to the message of the film and a reference to the themes in Chaplin's film of dehumanization and alienation - as our binary system of categorizing gender can have the same impact on many people today. 

My film requires large-scale sets that will be designed and constructed by myself, as well as many props, nine actors, and a production crew. After constructing a budget of everything that was needed, I determined that I would need:

- $250 for transportation, food and water for the cast and crew (2 days of shooting)

- $750 for set and props (this includes transportation of building materials, construction, paint, seamless backdrops, and dozens of props needed for the film).

This past semester, I was granted the Pratt Internship Merit Award ($400) for the several unpaid internships I have had since beginning school at Pratt. I will be putting all of this toward my film, but that leaves $600 more to be raised for my film to be completed. Even if you can only donate $5 or $10, any amount donated is greatly appreciated and a HUGE help!!

Thank you,

Savannah Magruder

*Image above from a past project.

story:
Hi, I'm Robin and this is my photo project.

I like to travel the world and photograph it. I also spend a lot of my time visiting disadvantaged schools across BC and helping organize free breakfast programs so that our most at-risk children don't have to go to class hungry.

I want to bring these two spheres of my life together for one special evening, and I want you to be part of it. 

All profits from this photo exhibition will support free breakfast programs here in Canada. To learn more about these programs, visit Breakfast Club of Canada.

What's this all for?

Right now, all I need to cover is the basic costs of holding this show so that all funds raised that night can go directly toward school programs. Here's what I'm looking to cover:

  1. Venue: $300
  2. Prints: $500
  3. Frames: $1100
To show my gratitude for your contribution, each donation will receive either entry to the event or a print of your choice.

Impact

The easiest question to answer about this project is: where will my money be going?  It's dead simple. The funds raised here will go to schools currently running breakfast programs that are: free and accessible to all students. 

Each dollar raised is a child fed.

story:
Hello and thank you for placing your eyeballs on this page. We are Emre, Merve and Lisa: recent college graduates, artists, and newlyweds (Emre and Merve) and underpaid teacher (Lisa). We are not trying to save the world; the three of us live modestly in Istanbul and are planning a very low budget road trip to Cappadocia. Since we are of modest means we will not be able to have the experience of seeing all that Cappadocia has to offer. This is obviously not a life or death drama. In fact, we'd encourage you to give money to people and institutions that are saving lives and lessening the suffering of sentient beings. However, if helping us have a kick-ass vacation speaks to you more than doing something socially constructive, who are we to judge?

If you choose to share with us some pocket change, it will go to the following:
1800 TL (600 TL each: balloon ride)
750 TL (250 TL each: on the ground tour guide)
200 TL (petrol)
==============
2750 TL total ($1264 USD)

If we raise nothing, we will still go to Cappadocia.
If we raise a modest amount it will go to our "community pot" for petrol
If we raise enough for one person's balloon ride, Emre (who wants to do it the most) will go. If we raise enough for two balloon rides, Merve will go with Emre, because this is sort of like a honeymoon (with a third wheel along for the ride). If we raise enough money for three balloon rides, Lisa will get to go, too.
The on-the-ground tour guide has come to us with great recommendations. If we have enough funding to cover the cost of the tour guide for one of us, the other two will possibly lurk behind at a respectful distance (that is still within earshot).
On the remote, sci-fi possibility that we raise more than we need, all proceeds will go to Caritas, a charity in Istanbul that is assisting Syrian refuges in our community, and/or Cihangir Cool for Cats, an animal rescue organization in Istanbul that provides medical care and helps find homes for street animals.  We will provide documentation of whatever we receive and PDFs of all receipts for expenditures and donations.

story:
Above image titled: Familia Viajera

Summary

This campaign is about fulfilling two intertwined goals. First, it is about completing a photographic project I started over 30 years ago, a project that has been thwarted time and time again by bizarre events. And, it is also about the goal of being able to make photogravures, the most difficult, elegant and long-lasting form of photograph printing that has ever existed.
(The images shown throughout will be available as rewards for contributions.)

Borracho

History

My name is David Kachel (cockle) and I have been a fine-art B&W, landscape photographer since 1979, with the exception of one brief period during 1980 when I became a street photographer, against my will. My adventure began with the theft of all my photographic equipment at a bus terminal in Lima, Peru in May of 1980. That eventually led to months of wandering the streets of the city of Arequipa, in southern Peru, with a borrowed, antique 35mm camera (the only camera available, and useless for landscape work), a single, uncoated lens and no light meter. It was either street photography, or no photography at all.

An introvert's introvert, I discovered to my astonishment that I loved that sortie into street photography and found it very productive. But, my joy didn't last long.

I could never have replaced my stolen equipment while in Peru and so, after a time was forced to return to the USA. As it turned out, all the film from those months of work on the streets of Arequipa was badly marred by heat-damaged developer acquired in Peru, leaving hundred of tiny marks on every negative and making them all, utterly unprintable. Worse, two darkroom floods over the years damaged a number of negatives further still. Some were destroyed completely. The project languished in my files, untouched and unprinted, for decades. Until the advent of digital photography, they were all thought to be completely unsalvageable.


Entrando a la Iglésia


In the mid-1980s I acquired a strong interest in photogravure, but it was always too expensive to take up, especially for my large landscape work. Only in the last couple of years have advances in technology made it financially feasible to pursue that interest. I started acquiring equipment and experimenting with photogravure printmaking in late 2013.

While contemplating which of my photographs might be suitable to print as photogravures, I remembered the street images from Peru and realized in the same instant that they would be ideal as photogravures and that they might also now be repairable. A move from analog to digital photography begun over six years ago, enabled me over the space of a couple months, to scan and repair those Peru street images... some eighty selected negatives. Thirty-six have been singled out from those eighty. None of these images have ever been exhibited, sold, or even seen publicly before now, save a few web postings made in the last few months, mostly on my new blog:

the transparentphotographer.com

Mujer con Dos Costales


Project to Include Three Classes of Print

  • Carbon & Color Pigment on Stonehenge Natural printmaking paper
  • Polymer Plate Photogravure on Revere Silk-Ivory printmaking paper
  • Polymer Plate Photogravure on Japanese tissue, tipped-in or Chine collé,
    to one of the above mentioned papers
Nota Bene: Perk prints are delivered un-matted. I spent a long time determining that the ideal matting material for these prints is Rising Natural 4-ply museum board (sometimes called Kensington) and suggest you ask your framer for the same. If you prefer that I provide a matte, we can make arrangements privately.

Carbon & Color Pigment on Stonehenge Natural Printmaking paper

This is my own ink set up. It is composed of five dilutions of pure carbon inks from MIS Assoc. (carbon ink will never fade), plus magenta and yellow pigment inks by Hewlett Packard, for the brown tone. These HP inks will also last for centuries. The Stonehenge paper is 100% cotton rag, museum grade paper. Prints are made by me (no one else is ever permitted to print my work) using an adapted Epson Stylus Pro 3800. (Prints are less brown than they probably appear in your web browser.)

Polymer Plate Photogravure on Revere Silk-Ivory Printmaking paper

There are several methods for making photogravure printing plates. The plates I plan to use are made with newer materials than the traditional copper and gelatin photogravure plates; specifically, PETG plastic instead of copper and a photo-polymer instead of gelatin (gelatin is a natural polymer). I believe the result is the same with either method and far less expensive with polymer plates.
You should know that some respected artists who are still using copper plates, disagree. Some of them insist that what I am doing should be called polymer photogravure, or similar. I've used that terminology here for clarity, but I disagree with the distinction and generally just use photogravure. My argument is that a photogravure consists of ink on paper; ink put there by placing a plate carrying ink in incised areas through an etching press, along with that paper. Both methods involve a plate carrying ink in incised areas. The only differences lie in the materials from which the plates are made and the manner and material of the incising.
Gravure prints that I have made thus far use one of the two papers previously mentioned, Stonehenge or Revere. It is possible I will end up using a different paper altogether, if I find one I like even more. Some of the funds raised will go to buying sample papers for further tests, so that I can be sure the perfect paper is selected.

Polymer Plate Photogravure on Japanese Tissue...

In the mid-1980s I was privileged to handle some of the rare and magnificent prints by the brilliant photographer Edward S. Curtis, made on Japanese tissue paper. That was what first interested me in photogravure. I have made a few test gravure prints on Japanese tissue paper, but not as many as on the other papers. This is the only print type I have yet to make enough of to be certain of it being problem-free, though I don't anticipate any game-changing difficulty. This tissue will be either tipped-in or Chine collé mounted to Stonehenge paper. This gives the gravure on tissue print a very subtle two-tone, almost three-dimensional look that is utterly not reproducible by any other means.

Vergüenza


What I Need... 

I have already acquired most of the equipment and a lot of the materials on my own. The etching press needed to make photogravures was by far the greatest expense. It was purchased in November of 2013. These things of course, do not come cheaply. I am out of cash and that is why this campaign is here.

The biggest current need is a plate burner. That link gives just one example. They are expensive, but necessary. Plates of the type I am making can be exposed oudoors with UV from sunlight, but that is quite inconsistent and very time consuming. With as many as I need to make, sunlight is impractical. Plus, I need the precise exposure control of a plate burner for further research. There are many models of plate burners available running from about $2,500-$5,000 and up. Which one I get, new or used, will depend on the amount that gets raised here. No point in picking out a specific model before knowing how much there is to spend. 

Additional materials (all estimates; the more that is raised, the more needed): 

  • R-011 Sekishu Thick Roll Japanese tissue, need 2 ~ total  $1,061.20 + shipping
  • Imagon HD Photopolymer Need 4 rolls 24"x25' ~ total of $480 + shipping 
  • Small lots of paper for testing to be certain of ideal paper for gravures ~ $150
  • Stock of paper for gravure printing ~ $500
  • Additional supplies of gravure ink ~ $200
  • Additional pure carbon + HP color pigment toning inks ~ $300
  • Stonehenge 4-ply "Natural" matte board 100 ~ total approximately $1300
  • A whole bunch of little things that add up to being not so little
Of course, all of this will be scaled back if not enough is raised, and if I am so lucky as to get more, I desperately need a new camera and lens(es). Mine are getting quite long in the tooth. I would then sell off the camera system I currently have and use the proceeds to stock up on even more equipment/supplies.

D'Onofrio


What You Get...

Except for the very smallest donations, supporters will receive gifts of original signed and numbered prints, of the images in this project. Depending on the donation, there will be:
  • carbon & color pigment ink on paper prints (very high end inkjet prints)
  • photogravure on paper prints
  • photogravure on Japanese tissue prints
When looking at perks, know that I have a method for describing print sizes. I will call a print a "5X, 10X, 13X", etc. This means that the short dimension of the paper on which the image is printed is that size. A 5X print is made on a 5"x7" piece of paper, with the actual image itself being somewhat smaller than that. I never print near the edges of the paper, preferring that images have lots of elbow room. An 11X is either 11"x14" or 11"x17" paper, depending on the proportions of the image, the image itself being 8" or 9" on the short side, depending on its length. 

Vieja con Bastón

Risks & Challenges

Devil's advocate...
  • carbon & color pigment ink on paper ~ zero risk, completely perfected
  • photogravure on paper ~ very slight risk, under control, I just want a little more
  • photogravure on Japanese tissue ~ small risk, I've done it, but need finesse
The carbon & color pigment ink on paper prints can all be delivered within a few weeks of the end of the campaign. The paper photogravures, if everything goes terribly wrong, might take as long as four or five months, though I can't imagine why that would happen. The tissue gravures, assuming extreme adversity, by the end of 2015. I really don't expect any of that to happen, but better you are pleasantly surprised than disappointed. Genuine expectations: I believe everyone should have their images in no more than six months at the outside. I will keep everyone up to date.

More Images

The remainder of the 28 images included in the folios offered as perks appear below. There are additional images in the project. Prints have already been made from all of them as carbon & color pigment on paper. So, you may choose your favorite(s) without concern.

Vieja en las Oscuras


Abrigado de Periódico


Vieja con Bolsa de Plástico

Chicos Lustrabotes


El Lavado


Hermanitos


Flautista


Limosna


Madre e Hijo


Palitos


Desayuno con Periódico


Pensadora


Mocosa


Descansando


Pensativa


Sufre del Cerebro


Taza Esmaltada


Tambór de Lata


Tomando Diéz Minutos


Taza y Sonrisa


Último Fotógrafo Callejero

story:
Brief Summary

The 2014 Guelph Poetry Slam Team was selected by the residents of Guelph, ON in January 2014 at the Guelph Poetry Slam FINALS. These five spoken word poets represent the City for the year, performing at community events and competing at regional, provincial and national poetry slams. The pinnacle of their journey together is competing at Canada's National Poetry Slam, at the Canadian Festival of Spoken Word (CFSW) in Victoria, BC. The team has worked hard to craft team pieces and perfect indie poems for this artistic competition. In preparation, they competed at Ontario's Provincial Poetry Slam, placing 2nd - missing first place by only 0.5 points! The team has high hopes for the National Slam competition. 

Meet the team:

The 2014 Guelph Poetry Slam team is a collection of earnest voices influenced by the various arts of the heart; through theater, eclectic music genres and spoken word Beth Anne Ellipsis, Fannon Holland, Nikki Machin, Rafay Ansari and Truth Is ... bring the science of thought-provoking and deep connection to light. Embarking on a year-long poetically profound journey, the team has fresh voice, old souls and the experience to navigate the intricacies of humanity, social, and political in a hand-extending manner. Welcome to the wordly detour; where gregariousness, exuberance, and afroliciousness are common place!

What we need and what you get

Help the 2014 Guelph Poetry Slam Team fundraise $700 to cover the cost of their accommodations in Victoria. The team has already fundraised 80% of their total expenses, including the cost of their flights, through performance bookings. Help the team with this final and crucial piece of their fundraising journey. Your help will ensure that the team has a comfortable place to rest their heads and lay their bodies during the poetry slam competition.

Those who donate, will have an opportunity to contribute to the team's Coming Home Poem by picking a WORD. This WORD will be used by the team to write a poem about their experience in Victoria at the Canadian Festival of Spoken Word. The poem will be performed at the team's Coming Home Show in November and will also be e-mailed to those who donate. How will your word be used?

story:
What this means to the FOX Family.

My name is Ron and i run the FOX Workshop in Edinburgh and i am a full time Artisan who specializes in leather work and bespoke product design. I have been working full time for around 3 years now producing hand made goods with life time warranties made to the highest quality without dye cutting or mass production just 2 skilled hands.

This campaign is me simply a request for help to expand my workshop from a small room inside my house to a larger outdoor workshop in my garden.  The FOX Workshop is a family business and the old workshop room will be becoming my Daughter Runa Fawn's new bedroom.

Buy helping me get my new workshop your not just helping the business grow but your helping my family to become better off with more space and a better future as my business can expand.

Why can i fund this myself? Well anyone with a family will tell u it is now cheap and as the only income for the house hold at the moment it is hard to keep money for a rainy day let alone save up for something like this. So i am man enough to say, i need your help

Funding Goals 

Goals: ALL TOTALS SHOWN FOR MONEY NEEDED AFTER FEES AND REWARD COSTS

Main - New Workshop shed and foundations. - £768.75

Shed - £599.95 - Slabs - £95.00 - Sand - £22.80 - Pebbles - £16.00 - Workbench Tops - £35.00

Stretch Goal 1 - Power, Interior walls and insulation upgrade - £255

Outdoor power extension - £30 - Insulation - £75  - Inner second wall layer - chipboard -  £80 - Shelving & Storage - £40 - Screws & Fittings - £30

Stretch Goal 2 - Keep It Safe - £200

CCTV - £120 - Alarms - £80

Stretch Goal 3 - Knife & Tool Making - £171.99

Sander  - £63.50 - Forge - £20.00 - Smelting gear - £35.00 - File Set - £15.00 -Quenching kit - £19.99 - Tube sander drill bits - £18.50

Stretch Goal 4 - Wood Upgrade - £214.99

Laith - £130 - Pull Saw - £59.99 - Chisel Set - £25.00

Stretch Goal 5 - Finishing Station - £69.99

Polishing wheel - £39.99 - Compounds - £15.00 - Selection of polishing mops and disks - £15.00

Stretch Goal 5 - Brass Stamps - £150

I will create some exclusive founder stamps for ALL leather work perks options added to your order for free.

TOTAL FOR ENTIRE EXPANSION - £1831 AFTER FEES AND PERK MATERIALS

Support & Select Great Rewards

All my work is done with the highest grade of veg tanned leather, milled veg tan and Kodiak oil tan hides. I use only the finest hadn cast brass fittings and pride myself in offering a life time warranty on all my work. All my work is done by hand with traditional tools in the heart of the Scottish capital city of Edinburgh. All rewards with "My Thanks" are geared towrds those who want less in return for there support.

 

The Future

Expanding the business has been something i have wanted for a long time. Havign to wait for the right house with the right garden, then finding it and Runa being born in the same month just kept things on the back burner. Now it is time time to expand time for bigger projects and finally launching my Knives and Tool Workshop. This is a new venture creating my first set of knives 100% my design 100% made by me i have 3 designs for launching with, a Back up blade full tang, A Folder & a Norse Seax "Oath Taker" chopper. 

Risks & Challenges

Well in everything there is always risks but as i already have an established workshop brand i feel the risks are few but the challenges are many. For example gaining the new skills to wire my workshop or even build a shed... i have never built a shed so this is all new.  So there is many skills and hands needed to be lent to get all this done and i have had a crazy amount of messages from people offering there time when the time comes.

My main worry is if i dont get a fully funded and i need to hand build the shed myself as i dont have much experience builkding but this is just another challenge to get passed and i have been offered help if it is needed.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant afford to help me thats is totally fine if you are able to share this campaign it would mean the world if you can help me reach my goal through sharing on social media. Thanks.

story:
What Is BOOM?

BOOM is Charlotte’s first artist and community led annual showcase of contemporary performance and visual art. BOOM will bring together local and national acts through a collaborative weekend of performance in the Plaza Midwood neighborhood, utilizing local business spaces and performance venues.
While Charlotte is the home of several nationally-recognized cultural institutions, there is limited presence for the great wealth of Charlotte-based artists or their work. Neighboring cities like Atlanta and Asheville have established Fringe Festivals (even Greensboro NC, half the size of Charlotte, has had one for 12 years), but Charlotte has no such regular showcase for independent and innovative arts.


Who Is BOOM?

THE ARTISTS
Sarah Emery – independent choreographer/ dancer
On Q Productions - contemporary and original performance work that reflects the black experience
Taproot- physical, devised theater ensemble 
XOXO (formerly Machine Theater)- collective of devised theater artists
Carlos Cruz – physical theater

Featured Artists – Non-Local
Alban Elved, Berlin, Germany/Wilmington, NC – dance/movement
Dasan Ahanu, Durham, NC – theater/spoken word
Kyla Garcia, Los Angeles, CA – theater/movement/poetry
Questionable Acts, New York, NY – physical/interactive theater/puppetry
Cynthia Ling Lee – movement/interdisciplinary performance
Featured Artists – Local
Sinergismo – performance art


BOOM matters to Charlotte because it will:

 
  1. Encourage a confluence of diverse artists and audiences – bringing together Charlotte communities that are estranged culturally, ethnically, or stylistically.
  2. Build an arts & culture buzz outside of Charlotte’s center city, and thus broaden the reach and accessibility of the arts.
  3. Enhance the cultural significance of Plaza Midwood by staging art experiences in its small venues, alleyways, and character-rich “leftover spaces.”
  4. Raise the profile of Charlotte in the national arts community through collaboration of national and local artists.
  5. Attract and retain creative talent in Charlotte by providing an annual professional showcase with large and diverse audiences. 


Make An Impact

By supporting BOOM, you will make a direct investment in the creative future of our city – contributing to the exact factors that make the city an exciting and inspiring place to live, and connecting their brands to the creative economy of Charlotte.


When and Where Will BOOM Happen?

The weekend will kick off with a Pecha Kucha Night on April 7th and the BOOM shows will follow, April 8th, 9th and 10th, Friday – Sunday.

BOOM will be centered in venues along Central Ave. in the Plaza Midwood neighborhood. The core performances will be based at three venues:
Snug Harbor
Open Door Studios
Petra’s


What Will be Happening at BOOM?

There will be 36 shows throughout the weekend. Additionally BOOM will include art installations, street performances and music in surrounding venues and public spaces. The following artists will be performing:


What We Need

BOOM is a grassroots community project whose success depends on financial support from businesses, sponsors and individuals. Our budget is roughly as follows: 

  • Venue Fees = $6,700
  • Artists Expenses = $12,000
  • Photography & Video Recording = $3,700
  • Advertising & Communications = $3,000
  • Technicians & Security = $6,250
  • Audio/Video Rental = $1,500
  • Curatorial Team = $7,500
  • Administration = $5,000


Our Previous Successes

BOOM is a creation of Que-OS, a 501c3 nonprofit organization with a track record of successfully managing large scale cultural projects driven by social capital. In 2012 we created Quasimodo - a showcase of regional talent during the Democratic National Convention involving over 140 artists, cultural leaders and 14 leading organizations from the ASC to the Charlotte Chamber of Commerce. Our ongoing Pecha Kucha Charlotte series (winner of 2 “Best of the Best Awards” from Charlotte Magazine) has become the largest gathering of creatives in the regions. These events have contributed to the broad reach, reputation and community support of Que-OS.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends about us.
Share this crowd-funding page with your friends on Facebook, Twitter and -- better yet -- as a personal email invitation to support BOOM!

Become a sponsor.
If you own a business and would like to be a sponsor for BOOM, we have several levels and options available. Download the Sponsorship Package (PDF)

Learn more about BOOM at our website: boomcharlotte.org/

story:
Pinhole Coffee landed in the "Neighborhood in the Sky" of Bernal Heights, San Francisco on September 12, 2014. Our space is housed at 231 Cortland Avenue, in Max Breithaupt's former butcher shop/grocery store from the 1880's.

We are raising money for a mural designed by SF artist Amos Goldbaum. The design is an ode to the original space juxtaposed with modern Bernal Heights. We look forward to working with Amos Goldbaum who was born, raised and currently resides in Bernal Heights.

www.pinholecoffee.com

www.amosgoldbaum.com

story:
U-20 Poetry Slam 2016

Der U-20 Slam 2016 ist die diesjährige große Poetry Slam Meisterschaft der besten Jungpoet*innen aus deutschsprachigen Ländern. Ein Jahr lang qualifizieren sich junge Poetinnen und Poeten unter 20 Jahren bei lokalen Poetry Slams für dieses Ereignis. 

Vom 18.-23. Oktober 2016 kämpfen dann die besten Jungdichter*innen und Jungdichter in Magdeburg um den Titel des deutschsprachigen U20-Slamchampions.

Die U-20-Meisterschaften gelten als eines der wichtigsten europäischen Literaturfestivals für junge Nachwuchspoet*innen. 

Wer sind wir?

Organisiert und ausgerichtet wird die diesjährige Meisterschaft vom HALternativ Verein. 

Den Halternativ e.V. gibt es seit dem 21. November 2006. Ursprünglich wurde der Verein gegründet, um Arbeitslosen Rockmusikfestivals und Lesungen anzubieten. Mit der Zeit weitete sich das Spektrum des gemeinnützigen Vereins immer weiter auf Kultur- und Literaturveranstaltungen aus. Ab April 2007 kam dann auch der Poetry Slam dazu und ab 2009 folgten weitere Projekte wie 'Kunst Gegen Bares', Lesebühnen, Song Slams oder Science Slams. Neben großen Veranstaltungen mit bis zu 300 Besuchern, bietet der Halternativ e.V. auch kleine Projekte und Workshops an, dies immer mit dem Fokus auf regionaler Künstler*innenförderung. 

Wohin fließt das Geld?

Die U-20 Poetry Slam Meisterschaft mischt das kulturelle Leben in der sachsen-anhaltinischen Landeshauptstadt Magdeburg auf und soll besonders deshalb gefördert werden. Dieses Ereignis wird außerdem dazu beitragen, Magdeburg dem Titel der Kulturhauptstadt 2025 einen großen Schritt näher zu bringen.

Die Organisation der 5-tägigen U-20 Poetry Slam Meisterschaft und deren Durchführung erfordert Kraft, Engagement, Ausdauer und, wie ihr euch sicherlich vorstellen könnt, finanzielle Mittel.  Das durch die Kampagne eingenommene Geld fließt ausschließlich in die Vorbereitung und Durchführung der U-20 Poetry Slam Meisterschaft 2016 und dabei vor allem in die Fahrtkosten und Verpflegung der 70 teilnehmenden Slammer*innen, die aus dem gesamten deutschsprachigen Raum angereist kommen.

Welche Bedeutung hat eine Spende?

Die U-20 Poetry Slam Meisterschaft 2016 steht vor der Tür. Im Oktober verwandelt sich die sachsen-anhaltinische Landeshauptstadt Magdeburg für fünf Tage in DIE Poetry Slam Metropole überhaupt. Gegen eine Spende könnt ihr spannende und einzigartige Preise rund ums Thema U-20 Slam 2016 und HALternativ e.V. erwerben. Das Geld, was wir durch diese Kampagne einnehmen fließt ausschließlich in die Vorbereitung und Durchführung der U-20 Poetry Slam Meisterschaften 2016 und dabei vor allem in die Fahrtkosten und Verpflegung der 70 teilnehmenden Slammer*innen. Diese kommen aus dem gesamten deutschsprachigen Raum angereist. Durch das Erwerben eines Preises unterstützt ihr unser großes Vorhaben, die Meisterschaft unvergesslich zu gestalten!

Das Interesse und die Beteiligung an Kultur und Literatur tut gut und lohnt sich immer. Ganz besonders das literarische Format des Poetry Slams schafft es auf einzigartige Art und Weise Literatur, Kultur und Alltag lebendig und unterhaltsam miteinander zu verbinden und dadurch tausende Menschen zu begeistern. Jede einzelne Spende für unsere Crowdfunding-Kampagne bedeutet gleichzeitig eine Unterstützung der Meisterschaft und daher eine direkte Beteiligung am kulturellen Leben Magdeburgs und der Region. Mit Eurer Hilfe kann der große U20 Poetry Slam 2016 ein riesen Erfolg werden.

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

Unser Fundingziel beträgt 4999 Euro. Um das mit der geballten Hilfe von Poetry Slam Begeisterten, haben wir für euch eine ganze Menge aufregender Preise zusammengestellt.

Hier möchten wir euch kurz ein paar unserer Preise vorstellen.

U-20 Slam Kugelschreiber


HALternativ und U-20 Slam Beutel


HALternativ Kaffeebecher


U-20 Slam Feuerzeug und Trinkflasche


Sticker U-20 Slam

Überraschungsselfie eines Slammers oder einer Slammerin


U-20 Slam Poster mit Unterschriften der Slammer*innen

(Bitte beachte, dass alle vorläufigen Preisbilder von den tatsächlichen Preisen abweichen können. Das liegt daran, dass wir die Preise extra nach Bedarf für euch anfertigen lassen. Die Bilder dienen lediglich dazu, euch eine ungefähre Vorstellung zu geben.)

Diese Preise und noch viel mehr erwartet euch also in dieser Crowdfunding-Kampagne. Wir freuen uns unheimlich doll über jede einzelne Spende und auch darüber, euch mit großartigen Preisen zu überraschen!

Warum ist unser Projekt so wichtig?

Poetry Slam ist ein junges Format. Slammer*innen bekommen die Chance eigene Gedanken in Texte zu verpacken und dadurch ihr Publikum zu bewegen,
aufzuregen und zu begeistern. Poetry Slam sind keine Grenzen gesetzt. Nicht nur die Slammer*innen haben die Chance sich auf der Bühne zu verwirklichen, sondern auch das Publikum verlässt einen Poetry Slam für gewöhnlich verzaubert. 

Literatur kann so viel Magisches bewirken, wenn sie den Weg in die Köpfe der Menschen findet.

Andere Wege, wie ihr helfen könnt

Je mehr Menschen sich für die U-20 Poetry Slam Meisterschaften 2016 interessieren, desto erfolgreicher werden sie. 
Das gilt auch für unsere U-20 Poetry Slam Crowdfunding-Kampagne. Auch wenn du keinen Preis erweben möchtest oder kannst, aber trotzdem ein Poetry Slam Fan bist, dann hilft es uns sehr, wenn du deinen Freund*innen, Bekannten, Verwandten oder Kolleg*innen von uns und unserer Kampagne erzählst. Dadurch kann sich das Publikum was wir ansprechen möchten vergrößern.
Indiegogo verfügt über ein Social Media Tool, mit dessen Hilfe du andere Menschen in deinem Umfeld ganz einfach an dieser Kampagne und den Preisen teilhaben lassen kannst.

Vielen Dank :)

Dieses Ereignis wird außerdem dazu beitragen, Magdeburg dem Titel der Kulturhauptstadt 2025 einen großen Schritt näher zu bringen.Die Organisation der 5-tägigen U-20 Poetry Slam Meisterschaft und deren Durchführung erfordert Kraft, Engagement, Ausdauer und, wie ihr euch sicherlich vorstellen könnt, finanzielle Mittel.  Das durch die Kampagne eingenommene Geld fließt ausschließlich in die Vorbereitung und Durchführung der U-20 Poetry Slam Meisterschaft 2016 und dabei vor allem in die Fahrtkosten und Verpflegung der 70 teilnehmenden Slammer*innen, die aus dem gesamten deutschsprachigen Raum angereist kommen.

Welche Bedeutung hat eine Spende?

Die U-20 Poetry Slam Meisterschaft 2016 steht vor der Tür. Im Oktober verwandelt sich die sachsen-anhaltinische Landeshauptstadt Magdeburg für fünf Tage in DIE Poetry Slam Metropole überhaupt. Gegen eine Spende könnt ihr spannende und einzigartige Preise rund ums Thema U-20 Slam 2016 und HALternativ e.V. erwerben. Das Geld, was wir durch diese Kampagne einnehmen fließt ausschließlich in die Vorbereitung und Durchführung der U-20 Poetry Slam Meisterschaften 2016 und dabei vor allem in die Fahrtkosten und Verpflegung der 70 teilnehmenden Slammer*innen. Diese kommen aus dem gesamten deutschsprachigen Raum angereist. Durch das Erwerben eines Preises unterstützt ihr unser großes Vorhaben, die Meisterschaft unvergesslich zu gestalten!
Das Interesse und die Beteiligung an Kultur und Literatur tut gut und lohnt sich immer. Ganz besonders das literarische Format des Poetry Slams schafft es auf einzigartige Art und Weise Literatur, Kultur und Alltag lebendig und unterhaltsam miteinander zu verbinden und dadurch tausende Menschen zu begeistern. Jede einzelne Spende für unsere Crowdfunding-Kampagne bedeutet gleichzeitig eine Unterstützung der Meisterschaft und daher eine direkte Beteiligung am kulturellen Leben Magdeburgs und der Region. Mit Eurer Hilfe kann der große U20 Poetry Slam 2016 ein riesen Erfolg werden.

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst
Unser Fundingziel beträgt 4999 Euro. Um das mit der geballten Hilfe von Poetry Slam Begeisterten, haben wir für euch eine ganze Menge aufregender Preise zusammengestellt.
Hier möchten wir euch kurz ein paar unserer Preise vorstellen.
U-20 Slam Kugelschreiber


HALternativ und U-20 Slam Beutel
HALternativ Kaffeebecher

U-20 Slam Feuerzeug und Trinkflasche

Sticker U-20 Slam
Überraschungsselfie eines Slammers oder einer Slammerin

U-20 Slam Poster mit Unterschriften der Slammer*innen



(Bitte beachte, dass alle vorläufigen Preisbilder von den tatsächlichen Preisen abweichen können. Das liegt daran, dass wir die Preise extra nach Bedarf für euch anfertigen lassen. Die Bilder dienen lediglich dazu, euch eine ungefähre Vorstellung zu geben.)
Diese Preise und noch viel mehr erwartet euch also in dieser Crowdfunding-Kampagne. Wir freuen uns unheimlich doll über jede einzelne Spende und auch darüber, euch mit großartigen Preisen zu überraschen!

Warum ist unser Projekt so wichtig?
Poetry Slam ist ein junges Format. Slammer*innen bekommen die Chance eigene Gedanken in Texte zu verpacken und dadurch ihr Publikum zu bewegen, aufzuregen und zu begeistern. Poetry Slam sind keine Grenzen gesetzt. Nicht nur die Slammer*innen haben die Chance sich auf der Bühne zu verwirklichen, sondern auch das Publikum verlässt einen Poetry Slam für gewöhnlich verzaubert. 
Literatur kann so viel Magisches bewirken, wenn sie den Weg in die Köpfe der Menschen findet.

Andere Wege, wie ihr helfen könntJe mehr Menschen sich für die U-20 Poetry Slam Meisterschaften 2016 interessieren, desto erfolgreicher werden sie. Das gilt auch für unsere U-20 Poetry Slam Crowdfunding-Kampagne. Auch wenn du keinen Preis erweben möchtest oder kannst, aber trotzdem ein Poetry Slam Fan bist, dann hilft es uns sehr, wenn du deinen Freund*innen, Bekannten, Verwandten oder Kolleg*innen von uns und unserer Kampagne erzählst. Dadurch kann sich das Publikum was wir ansprechen möchten vergrößern.Indiegogo verfügt über ein Social Media Tool, mit dessen Hilfe du andere Menschen in deinem Umfeld ganz einfach an dieser Kampagne und den Preisen teilhaben lassen kannst.Vielen Dank :)

story:
Hi! this is AREA35 a newborn contemporary art gallery that focuses on emerging artists. We are based in Milan since 2010 and we have worked with Italian and international Artists. This year we go out of our country and we we are going to host Australian Aboriginal Art, Chinese Calligraphy Artists, and our friend June Jin, a danish artist born in Korea.

And it's how we met her, during a reunion Trip in Seoul for Korean Adoptees from all over the world! we care about human relations and so we decided to have her hosted in our gallery since she's part of a bigger meaning to our life.

And her works are really beautiful, she's a talented artist too!


But we need your help, she's got HUGE paintings and costs for Bringing them from Copenhagen to Milan is pretty expensive, see them on the video please, aren't they big AND beautiful?

WE need your help to help this exposition being done, it is a monumental witness to the meaning of frendship and what it can be achieved to restore human "belonging" and care for those who had no chance to have it once they were born.


Your help counts, it is not just a matter of money, it is a gift that you can contribute to give for when it is time to assess that no matter how alone we are in this world, there's people that CARE about human relations.


What we need:

ticket from Copenhagen and back 100 EU (we found fares from 96 to 130 eu)

Transport of the paintings via special carrier (wood box being made for it) 950 EU

Catalogue (from concept to printing) 3.5 EU each 200 pieces 700 EU

Vernissage ( drinks 150 EU food 150 EU waiters 200 EU) 500 EU

Grand total 2250 EU (around 2911 USD with current change)

 

 

The Impact

We dont' do "simple" art exposition, we care about how what we do and what we show impacts on the life of people. We don't use art as a commercial item, art is a revelation, a way to enrich our lives and if friendship comes with it, it is  just a natural way of doing it.

This is what we bring around the world, this time June Jin is visiting us from Denmark but we have already done Expos and created links with Canada, with artist Neil Snape and we are doing it in China with Artist Luo Qi.

Help us unite the world!

 

Other Ways You Can Help


Please, share these vibes with all your friends and family, all around the world,  we look forward to meet people with similar mindviews, join us! and please do contact us for sharing vibes, ideas, works and friendship, you never know what can come out of a simple smile ^_^

hugs

story:
About Us

We are a diverse global community centered on trust and family, supporting passion, creativity, sexiness, love, uniting together.  Campmates from Australia, England, Costa Rica, and the United States, provide a fun, light hearted, loving experience.  A wide variety of professionals, artists, and dreamers make it possible to organize such a camp.

Obstacle

Our bar, lounge, and dance floor was shaded with a parachute in the previous years.  The trying 50mph winds made it a cumbersome task to keep it tight and out of the way.  The parachute ripped daily at the tie down points.  It was a constant battle to keep it from sagging.  We researched domes and found that they’re very expensive to purchase or build.  The biggest drawback, they’re uninviting.  We also looked into prefabbed shade structures, but they were also expensive and bland.

The Kaleidoshade

The Idea is born!  The Kaleidoshade is a large scale art shade structure.  It will provide a place to dance, perform, and climb in an inviting ambiance. This art piece will cover approximately 1300 sq ft, creating a visual stimulating experience.  Beauty and functionality will collide creating a harmonious experience.  It will be available for the residents of Black Rock City anytime they need.  The Kaleidoshade will be built from industrial grade materials, which will stand the test of time, making the yearly pilgrimage.  Not only does the community benefit, but Happy Hour as well.  Working together on a large scale project will bring us closer as a family and experience for future projects for Black Rock City.

Details

Our target goal is $17,400.  This will cover materials needed for the build.  The project will consist of:

  • 800ft of aluminum
  • 1500 square feet of industrial grade shade canvas
  • 500ft of 3/8” cable strapping
  • 350 pieces of misc. hardware (bolts, nuts washers,  turnbuckles)

*It is important to us to use our local suppliers when purchasing all our materials and hardware!

Our fundraising goal will cover only materials.  Happy Hour will cover the transportation and storage costs.  From start to finish, all efforts and talents are pulled from within the camp.  It will take over 1000 Happy Hours to build and 3 months’ time. Majority of these hours will go into intricately sewing patterns to achieve the kaleidoscope effect.  The structure will take 1000’s of precise welds to build its frame and foundation.  There has already been many hours spent in the creative process, from conception, engineering, graphics, creating models, heart, and soul.

Thank You

With your support, you can help build “The Kaleidoshade”!

story:
My name is Nate Kapnicky, also known as "Nate Kap". I'm a caricature artist who moved from Columbus, OH to draw at Sea World, San Diego and explore my talents.

I started to really grow a passion for caricatures about 7 years ago. Working live has really given me a perspective of how to be honest with myself as well as the customer to get the ultimate hilarious result. Over the years I developed a fearless artistic nature in which anyone is a challenge and everyone will get equal treatment!  I'm never afraid of hurting feelings because my intentions are to make people laugh at themselves or enjoy a unique exaggerated perspective of their image.

After 3 years of drawing live at a theme parks, I decided to make a caricature book in order to further improve my craft.

BEASTED

...is, on the surface, a book of extremely exaggerated, surreal takes on some of the most recognizable faces in the world.

But BEASTED is more than just a book of my artwork or crazy caricatures of famous figures. It's about taking a different approach to the traditional ways of looking at a face and body. It's about opening minds to explore the uniqueness of every face. It's about inspiring others to take risks and be courageous in their artwork.

BEASTED is a movement about challenging people to evaluate themselves and to laugh at their own unique features!

So What is the Goal?

In order to get the BEASTED message out, we need to spread the word! The way I would like to do that is by launching a new blog full of tutorials and my thoughts on art. I hope for it to be a valuable resource for artists everywhere and to inspire a generation of fearless artists. And also, I need to keep creating more art!

But the first thing I need is a studio space. I'm working from my dining room/kitchen at the moment! Building up a studio is really important to me because it keeps my dreams high and drives me to keep my heart and soul in what I enjoy. And I want to pay that forward to all of you to keep the artistic and FUN energy going.

What We Need

The goal is to reach $9,861. First and foremeost, this goes towards rent on a studio space for a year. In order to use money wisely, it would only be a second bedroom in addition to the one bedroom space I currently share with my girlfriend who is an artist as well and who helped BEASTED come together. The studio must also act as an office and storage area.

I also need several little things to keep efficient. In order to set up my tutorials and blog, I need:

  • a tripod for my camera for photographing work
  • a better microphone for videos
  • more RAM for my computer, in order to edit large video files

I will need items to better create artwork, such as:

  • better lighting 
  • an air purifier
  • fixing my drafting table (it can no longer prop up)
  • new paint brushes (most of mine are several years old)

Some of the money raised must go towards shipping, taxes, and fees, and will also help with the cost it took to make the books.

Get BEASTED!

By helping me reach my goal, you can get a piece of BEASTED with every perk! And in addition to the amazing perks, all contributors will get sneak peaks of tutorials and posts that will go on my blog! You can even have your input on what you want to see on there. The following is a description of the things you will find in the perk packages.

PERKS

BEASTED book: Beasted itself is a 128 page, 10" x 10", full color, hardback, Beasted caricature art book.

BEASTED mini: All perks will include the BEASTED mini, a 3" x 3", full color, 40 page, bonus caricature book of friends, famous people, animals, and live sketches. Let it serve you as artistic inspiration in your pocket!

BEASTED sticker: You will also get a BEASTED sticker that you can stick anywhere! (Cooler if it's on a "B" word)

 

Sketch of Yourself (left): If you get a perk with a BEASTED "idea" sketch of yourself or a friend, this is what you can expect!

This sketch is done loose, fun, exaggerated and drawn in pencil.

Original Sketch from the book: This is one of the original progression "idea" sketches (as seen in the book) that helped develop the idea for one of the final pieces.

Limited Edition Beasted Poster(right): A limited edition 10" x 10" print filled with all the finished pieces seen in the book.

 

 

Now if you REALLY want to get BEASTED, check out these perks! V V V V V

Every dollar helps! Even if I don't reach the goal to get everything I need, I can at least pick things up little by little. Whatever I get will also help to pay for the overall cost of BEASTED. Either way, you get a ton of cool stuff out of it!

The Impact

What you are contributing to is not just a personal studio space for me; It is to fund an inspirational dream that feeds right back into you and today's world of art.

I know there are many artists out there who are amazing and want to go far with what they create, and I want to reach out to them through my art, posts, and tutorials. 

Also, there are "other projects" with other artists on the horizon and this space will be a huge part of that as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount contributed will be most appreciated and well spent--but if you can't, you can still definitely help by getting the word out about BEASTED and about this campaign!

Share this campain with family and friends, on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, or even blog about BEASTED! Get the word out to artists everywhere who would like to invest in something that will pay them back wholly, with unique art and eventually, tips on how you can BEAST IT!

story:
This summer, I worked with the most resilient and inspiring young women that I have ever met. I interned with an organization that empowers girl survivors of human trafficking with the direct services they need to heal and become independent, healthy, happy individuals. From court advocacy, to group therapy, to job and housing searches, girls are offered resources to create the lives that they envision for themselves. All funds that are raised will directly enhance a jewelry-making program that inspires both creativity and entrepreneurship in these young women. 


The Impact

When girls escape situations of trafficking, they leave with barely any knowledge of how to take care of themselves. Most often, they are homeless and have little more than the clothe on their back. For years, traffickers have told them what to eat, what to wear, and have isolated them from the outside world. They've been made to believe that their trafficker is the only person who actually cares about them, and that sex is all that they are good for. 
With this program, girls learn to make jewelry, which is then sold online and at small sales parties. Girls get 50% of the profit, and the other half is reinvested in the program. Through this, survivors get a creative outlet while learning a valuable skill, which teaches them that they are capable of more than what their traffickers have forced them to think. They also gain a positive and safe method of making money, which encourages the idea that sex isn't the only way that they can do this. Workshops also provide an open space for girls to discuss their feelings, thus creating a supportive network of peers who work together toward success. 

What We Need

So far, this program has been extremely successful, offering more than 50 survivors per year the opportunity to express themselves. But, as the program grow, supplies have to grow too. Beads, end-pieces, wire, clasps, pliers, wire cutters, and beading boards are all needed to make valuable pieces of jewelry. Since half of all profits are reinvested into the program, these funds will be a necessary boost toward further sustainability. If the entirety of this goal isn't raised, all money will still be donated to this program. But, the more money raise, the better this program can be!

$10 = 100 Beads: Provide these girls with some beads!

$20 = 100 Beads, Wire, End-pieces: Beads, wire, and end-pieces are the basic parts of any piece of jewelry. With this gift, you'll be providing a few girls with all of the parts they need to make fabulous works of art!

$50 = 300 Beads, Wire, & End-pieces: Provide several more girls with supplies to make jewelry!

$100 = 500 Beads, Wire, End-pieces, & Tools: While providing girls with all of the pieces to make jewelry, this donation also encourages the long-term sustainability of the program... Tools are recyclable!


Other Ways You Can Help!

If you can't contribute, there are other ways that you can help! Share this page with others; each person who sees it may not always raise funds, but it will raise AWARENESS!

story:
Yanks Illustrated

In 1918 France, the official newspaper of the American Expeditionary Forces, Stars and Stripes, printed a pocket book of poetry written by service people, for service people, during the Great War. The poetry is sometimes sad, sometimes funny, and always inspiring.   It has, to my knowledge never been reprinted. it is called Yanks

My name is Joey Mauk, I'm an illustrator working on my thesis at the California College of the Arts. If you're interested in me, you can check out some of my other work at http://www.maukillustration.com/

 I discovered my very badly damaged copy of Yanks with my Great grandfather's inscription last year in my Grandmother's attic. For my thesis, I have taken it upon myself to republish these works, complete with my modest additions in the form of illustrations based on select poems.

This campaign is deeply personal, but it is also important in preserving this piece of history.  In addition to helping me produce something profound for my thesis and my family, your donations will help me to share this piece of art and history with you, and many others; a greater audience than this material has reached in a very, very long time.

Perks

In exchange for your donations, i will be able to send you any number of thankyous, from bookmarks and postcards for small donations, to prints and the finished copies of the coffee table book, for bigger donations. Signed, of course. Donations of $1000 or more get you the right to pick one of the poems to be illustrated and printed in the final book.

In Other News

if we can't reach our goal, that's OK too, you'll still get perks, since your donation basically pays for the perk anyway.

These donations are based on the on the costs of the first run printing, mailing and whatnot associated with getting the book out there. The number of books printed is entirely dependent on you, so please be generous! While this is technically a for profit project, almost all funds from this campaign will print books. the more funds, the more books. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know you can't all donate, so please consider sharing this project. I truly believe this book deserves to be seen by a new audience, and i hope you can help me get the word out.
