story:
Why Autumn Hands

I've been an Artist all my life—and so have many of my friends. As we sail into our golden years (What the heck does that mean anyway?)  all of us want to keep producing and creating, because:

  • We simply  are “Creatives” 
  • Some of us need to financially
  • And all of us want to pass down what we have learned to the next generations

Autumn Hands will be an online marketplace for all of us Artists, Artisans and DIY folks who create beautifully crafted work.

Our goal is to create a robust marketplace with Artisans from every state in the union.  (Yep the territories are included also.)

A site that folks will want to buy from because the work is amazing. And they love knowing each piece was lovingly made by an older Artisan, perhaps in their community.

Autumn Hands is registered as a benefits corporation. A relatively new  business status for a “social enterprise,” meaning we have dual bottom lines: make a profit and meet a need(s) in the community.

Impact

What needs would Autumn Hands meet?

Let me throw some numbers at you. And I do NOT want you to be distressed by this. Because you can help:

a. Over 40 million  older Americans (65+) in 2010.

b. Over 11 million live alone.

c. 87% of those 65+ rely on Social Security as their source of income.

d. Almost 4.5 million older folks live below the poverty level.

What do these numbers have to do with our dream to build an online marketplace for older Artisans?

a. There are a LOT of us (yay parents of all us “Boomers”). And you know, of those millions, many are Artists, Artisans and talented DIY folk.

b. Many, if not all of us, need to connect with others. Again, of those millions, many are Artists, Artisans and talented DIY folk.

c. Many of us need to augment our incomes. Some of those millions are Artists, Artisans and talented DIY folk living on very limited income.

d. Some of us live below the poverty level—especially if we have been earning a living as Artists during our “productive” years.

Inter-generational Sharing:

ALL of us are grateful for the talents we inherited and nurtured. 

We’d like to pass down our skills and knowledge: how to knit, make homemade soap, build  a cabinet, create a mosaic, etc. Every Artisan who creates a shop on the Autumn Hands site will be encouraged to partner with a younger person, at least one generation younger (20+ years younger). Imagine the exchange of skills and knowledge between an older Artisan and a younger person eager to learn. Imagine the younger person advising the Ageless Artisan on what is trending in accessories, how to use social media to promote their shop, take better pictures of the work, etc.


I said you’d be able to help, and here is how you can:

  • Spread the word. Send folks to the Indiegogo site for Autumn Hands.
  • Sign up yourself, or gift your talented grandmom/grandad with a membership. During this campaign, Artisans who sign up to create a shop on the Autumn Hands site will given a two-year membership for the one-year price ($50)
  • If you live near Lancaster, PA—stop by Roaring Brook Market and Café at 155 East King Street, to check out the crafts, art & domestic arts that demonstrate the quality and creativity of the works you will find on Autumn Hands. The show will be ever changing during the next 60 days.

By contributing and choosing a perk, you help to make this dream happen.

  • A $5 contribution rewards you with awesome Karma and one hand-felted heart

 

  • A $25 contribution earns you your choice of a felted leaf or round fruit accessory. You choose which felted accessory you want and if you want the back finished off as a hair barrette or a brooch pin back.Later in the campaign, each image will be posted and you select your favorite. To be fair, we will go in order of contribution date.


  • The "Incorrigible Woman" print below is offered to those contributing $ 50
  • The "Joy" print below is offered to those contributing $40



  • A $1,000 contribution to our effort earns you a personalized mosaic mirror. Approx 400 sq inches. Your mirror comes framed. Here are two examples:


This is what your contributions will be paying for:

  • Software & development of online marketplace
  • Hosting & maintenance
  • Artisan Coaching & Customer Assistance
  • Reaching out to younger generations

What you are really getting for your hard-earned investment is a wonderful marketplace for shoppers to choose hand-crafted works by Ageless American Artisans. And an opportunity for our Artisans to augment their income and to connect with younger generations, collaborating and sharing.

Because what we leave behind are the works and people we create.


From the bottom of my heart, thank you for helping make this dream come true.

Blessings on your own journey, Deirdre



(The above stats were compiled in the report: “A Profile of the Older American” based on 2010  US Census. These stats reference 65+. Our Artisans will be 55+, so the numbers are even higher.)

story:
Short Summary

On September 27, 2014, Redskin, a pop-up solo art exhibition including paintings/installations and an 8 hour long performance art by Indigenous artist Gregg Deal (Pyramid Lake Paiute) will premiere during the annual Washington DC event Art All Night: Nuit Blanche. During the course of Art All Night, Gregg Deal will subject himself to a variety of abuses  -- mental, verbal and even physical -- routinely endured by Indigenous people. These interactions will be documented and translated into a short film of the same name. Your support of this campaign is key to the ongoing Indigenous art/activism that grounds Gregg's work, particularly within the context of the issues surrounding the Washington DC NFL franchise.

What Is Needed 

This campaign is purely donation and/or sponsorship driven. Donations or Sponsorship can come from individuals or businesses.  Incentives will be provided in the form of pure hearted thanks in the film, and in the case of more substantial donations and/or sponsorship, prominent acknowledgement will be made on all collateral media such as the website, posters, printed materials at the exhibition, or even written pieces by the artist. 

Funds are needed to cover a variety of expenses. In conjunction with the performance piece, Deal will have paintings that coincide with the performative work. Additionally, collateral printed materials are essential, and funds are required to obtain props, items of clothing for volunteers, food, materials for art installation, and various other vendors such as photographer, videographer, et cetera. The breakdown is as follows:

Printed Materials: $500

Materials (for performance props, etc.): $600

Materials (for art installation, paint, ect.): $900

Clothing for volunteers (uniforms): $300

Photographer (includes rental equipment, etc.): $700

Videographer (includes rental equipment, etc.): $700

Editing: $650

Food (for volunteers): $300

Travel: $350

You can help in one of four ways: 

Donation

You can make your donation to this project at a price decided by you, the donor. Your donation will be acknowledged in all collateral materials (printed, online and otherwise), and will be credited in the short film. 

Sponsor

Sponsors can donate to a specific part(s) of the project as dictated above. Sponsor will be acknowledged in all collateral materials (printed, online or otherwise) and will be credited in the short film.

Title Sponsor

The Title Sponsor would sponsor the entire event which includes the performance piece and coinciding art installation. The Title Sponsor’s name will be prominently displayed in every piece of collateral material (printed, online or otherwise) as well as credited in the short film as a supporter of the work. 

Other

Any other support proposed outside of the aforementioned options is welcomed, and may be discussed with Gregg Deal.

The Impact

This performance examines identity, stereotype, and microaggression as experienced by Indigenous people in America. The following is a synopsis of the performance piece, a cornerstone to this project:

Synopsis

In his performance piece during Art All Night, Gregg Deal will subject himself to abuse mirroring the various types of injury routinely endured by Indigenous people. Executing this piece within the Nation’s capitol is especially provocative as it is part of an ongoing conversation about the problematic and racially charged name and imagery associated with the Washington Football Team, The Redskins. While Deal’s performance stands as an illustration of the racism directed towards Indigenous people (including Deal), it is part of a greater statement about the incredible amount of inequality, bigotry, and misunderstanding experienced by Indigenous people, often expressed through both covert and overt hostility. As an indigenous person, Deal will exhaustively endure abuse, a taxing effort mentally, physically and spiritually. 

Examples of scenarios within the performance

At least 3 non-Indian participants will work as antagonists for this piece, subjecting Deal to the aforementioned abuse. Here are a few scenarios:

Red Face: Non-Indians dressed with “Indian war paint” and “fake headdress” try to convince Deal their actions honor him.

"You’re just not Indian enough": Antagonists will evaluate Deal's identity, speaking critically about his conformity to stereotype (e.g., "you don’t look Indian to me," explaining the ways they perceive his identity as a Native person). 

Redskins: Singing the team song “Hail To The Redskins”, preaching about honor, listing off other arguments and "Facts."

Purpose

The truth of microagression towards the Indigenous in America is overlooked at best and supported warmly at worst. This piece is meant to interrogate the experience of the Indigenous in America and the way others engage with them. Additionally, this piece is very personal and reflects the artist’s own experience, specifically the lack of control Deal has felt throughout his lifetime with regard to his identity. Of course all of this becomes even more provocative within the context of the “Redskin” debate, which will be explicitly referenced throughout the performance piece. 

End Result

This interactive performance will be thoroughly document through photography and film, and will ultimately comprise the subsequent short film. Reactions from the crowd, interviews, and the many social and philosophical aspects of this piece will drive the content, using art as a vehicle through which the inequality experienced by Indigenous people is made clear.

Risks & Challenges

Your donation supports art and its use as a powerful tool of activism and education. Your donation makes the statement that you support the continued grass roots effort to change the problematic attitudes and perceptions American Culture holds about Indigenous people, that you support changing the name of the Washington Redskins, and that you support the art of Gregg Deal, an important Indigenous voice in contemporary art. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share, Share, Share. Sharing this campaign is helpful as well. The more this gets out there, the more chance donations come in to support this effort. 
  • Volunteer! Gregg needs help on this effort. Lots of it.

story:
My name is Megan Lara and I'm a 26 year-old illustrator currently living in Chicago with my boyfriend--another artist named Omega Man 5000 (Harry)--and my corgi. Harley.  Most of you who know my work probably found me through Teefury or various other tee-a-day sites.  I do a lot of pop culture inspired design, specifically work in the art nouveau style.   I am so thankful that I have been able to live my dream life and create art for a living, and with your help I can continue to do so!  :D You can see some of my work here:  


Simply put, I decided to start this campaign because we are in a little bit of a jam right now. This year has been rough for us;  several health and personal issues--along with poor timing have depleted the money we had set aside to move into our new home/studio in June (as well as money set aside to purchase inventory for convention season and pay taxes).  

At the moment we live with three other roommates, but our lease is up June 1st.  We absolutely must move by June 1st, and with the aforementioned heath and monetary issues we've faced this year, we don't have enough money to make the move and all of our prior commitments (cons and such).  

We want to use this campaign to escape this predicament quickly, while offering you exclusive art, commissions, prints, and stickers in return.  I'd been wanting to open up commission spots anyway, so this will kill two birds with one stone! :D This is also the first time I'll be offering exclusives, which I'm excited about. 

We are asking for $7500 in order to cover our move and build back up our funds.  Here's a breakdown:

  • Fees from IndieGogo (9% if we don't meet our goal, 4% if we do), Paypal (3%) and Credit Cards (3%) 
  • Cost of fulfilling perks (prints, stickers, shipping, packaging, etc. costs are a large portion of the amount were asking)
  • First and last month's rent, deposit, pet deposit, application fees for our apartment, Uhaul, any other misc. moving expenses   
  • Prints for upcoming conventions and restocking Etsy prints
  • The rest of our taxes
If we meet our goal, anything extra will be used to get back to where we were before this year sideswiped us. If we meet our goal, we will definitely be adding a few extra goodies to everyone's rewards, as well.  

This is why you're here!  I tried to put together an assortment of things for those interested in either custom artwork,  wall art and exclusives.  I hope something here strikes your fancy! 

A couple notes about perks:  

Regarding Add-Ons:  Unfortunately Indiegogo doesn't allow add-ons or combining perks, so you will have to make separate contributions for each perk you would like.  Very sorry about the inconvenience!  

Choosing Postcard Sets:  You can either email me (info@meganlara.com) with which postcard set you would like, message me on here, or wait for me to contact you after the campaign is over! :)  



Surprise sticker! I will randomly choose a sticker for you--or if you'd rather it not be a TOTAL surprise, you can let me know a specific piece that you want (check out my Redbubble store to see all the designs I have currently).  I will also be including a surprise postcard that will be exclusive to this campaign!

Ideal for smooth flat surfaces like laptops, journals, windows etc. They are easy to remove and made from waterproof vinyl. Should last 18 months outdoors 

 U.S. shipping included in price - add $3 for outside the U.S.

Estimated Shipping Date:  September 2015


4"x6" glossy postcards of my very first designs -- Peach, Samus and Zelda nouveau (Plus two bonus postcards)!  All postcards  are 4"x6" with about a 1/8" white border, In addition to the two bonus cards, I will also  be including a surprise postcard that will be exclusive to this campaign!

U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $5 for outside the U.S.

Estimated Shipping Date: September 2015

Five Dark Tower inspired 4"x6" glossy postcards.  My favourite series of books :) 

Set includes "He Followed," "There are Other Worlds Than These," "Nineteen," "The Ka-Tet of Nineteen," "Come, Come, Commala" and surprise bonus card! 


p.s. These are $2 more than the other set of five cards because I was a goofball and forgot to add the base shipping to that set. Y'all lucked out on that one, haha ;)


U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $5 for outside the U.S.

Estimated Shipping Date: September 2015

More 4"x6" glossy Who-inspired postcards + "Science of Deduction" because I needed one more to round out the set, and I think a good portion of people who like Who also like Sherlock. :D   Also comes with surprise bonus postcard that is an Indiegogo exclusive! 


U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $5 for outside the U.S.

Estimated Shipping Date: September 2015

Five 2"x6" glossy bookmarks!  I kept them literature themed, as I felt that was appropriate!  I will also be including the surprise postcard that will be exclusive to this campaign. :D


U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $5 for outside the U.S.

Estimated Shipping Date: September 2015


Choose between sets of seven 4x6 glossy postcards!  Let me know whether you want Set A, B, or C!    I will also be including a surprise postcard that will be exclusive to this campaign!


  • Set A - My Super Sweet Postcard Pack

One set of seven 4x6 glossy postcards. This set is comprised of several of my most popular original art pieces.  Set  includes "Leah," "Caira," "Laura," "Sweet Release," "Facade," and "Last Piece" and "Delilah." 

  • Set B - Campanion Postcard Pack

One set of seven 4x6 glossy postcards. This set is comprised of mine and Omega Man 5000's companion designs, plus an extra Who-related design!  

  • Set C - Princess Postcard Pack

One set of seven 4x6 glossy postcards of all the art nouveau princesses I have created thus far! 
U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $5 for outside the U.S.
Estimated Shipping Date: September 2015

This tier is for an 8x12 (with one inch white border) lustre print of my exclusive-to-this-campaign "Mad Love" print,  I know some people prefer smaller prints so I am also offering this for yall :)   This version will also be signed and numbered (as a separate edition from the larger fine art giclee print--the number of prints in this edition will be determined by the number of orders placed) on the front. 

If you would like a larger, fine art print (a giclee on Somerset Velvet paper) of this, please see the $60 tier, which is limited to 100 pieces.  

U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $5 for outside the U.S.

Estimated Delivery: Before December 2015


An easier way to grab two of the above postcard sets (A, B or C)!  If we meet our goal,  I will also be including a surprise postcard that will be exclusive to this campaign.
U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $5 for outside the U.S
Estimated Shipping Date: September 2015


My digital portrait sketches are basically like a slightly stylized, less-detailed version of my normal digitally painted portraits.  This is for the digital file only.

For these, I'll be sketching/drawing in one main colour.  These will be more stylized and loose than my fully-painted portraits.  I will need a reference photo and what colour you'd like me to use!  Since these are pretty simple, no edits will be included--basically these pieces will be my interpretation (in the above style) of whatever reference photo you send me! :D  

I will be collecting photos and other information after the campaign is over.

For full-colour, digitally painted portraits, see the "Custom Digital Portrait" tier.

Estimated delivery:  Before December 2015

A 12"x18" giclee art print on Somerset Velvet paper (with a one inch white border all the way around, so the image size will be 10"x16").  It will only be available for backers of this campaign.  Once the campaign is over, it will be retired!  

This is the first limited edition print I've ever done.  These will be signed and numbered on the front in the white border--this edition is limited to 100 pieces. Fancy!  :D

U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $5 for outside the U.S.

Estimated delivery:  Before December 2015


Custom digital portraits!  You do not receive a physical print with this order--this is for the DIGITAL FILE only!

This type of portrait is ideal for Facebook profile pictures, website avatars, business cards, framed prints, etc. It would make a great gift for birthdays, anniversaries and holidays! :D  I would greatly prefer for these to be portraits from the waist up to keep it as more of a portrait style commission :)

What you will receive from me:

  • A portrait painted in my personal style with minimal background. 
  •  These will be based off of whatever photo you send me—no “draw me as *specific character*” please. 
  •  You will receive an 11”x14” print-ready digital file (JPEG) along with print release.  
  •  I will only do one round of edits, because otherwise the back-and-forth between everyone would keep me from getting them all done in a timely manner.  However, you can trust that I will do my best to make sure you love your portrait! :)  

What I need from you:  

  •  After the campaign is over, I will send out emails and such asking for your photo/name/colour preferences.  If you have a specific date you'd like it completed by, I will do my very best to accommodate it, but I cannot guarantee it for sure.  But I will certainly try!

The Process:  

  • When the portrait is complete, I will send you a small version for your approval. 
  • After your approval, I will email you full-sized file and print release. 

Photo Specifics

  • It is EXTREMELY hard to draw a portrait based on a tiny, dark, or blurry photo. Please try to only send me images that are over 500px wide/tall, clear and with decent lighting. 
  • Please make sure the photo is mostly focused on the face/upper body. I do much better work with faces than I do with full body portraits. :) 
  • The best portraits are based on photos that aren't heavily edited or overexposed.
  • I'd love to have multiple photos that I can use, if you can--just let me know which one you would prefer I base it mostly on.
Please add an additional $80 per person including babies (they are actually hard to draw!) and $60 per pet--up to three total individuals in the portrait.  
Estimated delivery:  Before December 2015

BAD WOLF  9"x12"  CHARCOAL AND PENCIL SKETCH  - $125

Those who order only postcards/other print items will receive their rewards before those who order commissions, so keep that in mind.  :)  So while it may seem like it will be a while before you get your perks (before December 2015), I promise that:

  • We will keep you guys updated every step along the way

  • And most importantly, you will get your rewards no matter what--so this campaign has no risk for you all whatsoever.  We will make it happen :D

  • If you want multiple rewards, you will have to complete the process for each reward you want, as IndieGogo doesn't let you combine them.  Sorry about that!
  • I'll follow up with everyone for specifying which postcard sets you want, commission info, etc., after the end of the campaign! :D  I will begin fulfilling perks the week or two after we make the move!
  • For any other questions or info or perk choices, email me at info@meganlara.com! :D


If you can't contribute right now, I would really appreciate any and all shares on social media.  Getting the word out about this is half the battle!  I would be so grateful for any help in that regard!  Tell your friends/followers/mom--whoever you feel might be interested in some of the perks, or who would just wanna help out :D

At the top of this page you can find Indiegogo's share tools and use them to share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, etc.!  Here is the link to this campaign if you just want to copy and paste it from here:  http://igg.me/at/meganlara

  • Thanks to Anna-Maria Jung for the awesome illustration of me, dressed as a a sheep, riding a corgi while fighting Cthulhu.  :D
  • Thanks to Kelly McKernan for your advice and the inspiration to make this campaign.  
  • And a HUGE thanks to all of you guys who follows me on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and Tumblr.  Thanks to everyone who has come to see me and/or buy prints from me at conventions, on  Etsy or my various other online stores.    Thanks for reading this far! :)  Even if I don't make my goal, I am so thankful for all of you who comment on, like, fave, reblog, retweet or buy my art.  At the risk of being sappy, it means the world to me that I get to do something I love for a living, and I hope to continue to be able to for a long while!
story_txt:
My name is Megan Lara and I'm a 26 year-old illustrator currently living in Chicago with my boyfriend--another artist named Omega Man 5000 (Harry)--and my corgi. Harley.  Most of you who know my work probably found me through Teefury or various other tee-a-day sites.  I do a lot of pop culture inspired design, specifically work in the art nouveau style.   I am so thankful that I have been able to live my dream life and create art for a living, and with your help I can continue to do so!  :D You can see some of my work here:  













Simply put, I decided to start this campaign because we are in a little bit of a jam right now. This year has been rough for us;  several health and personal issues--along with poor timing have depleted the money we had set aside to move into our new home/studio in June (as well as money set aside to purchase inventory for convention season and pay taxes).  



At the moment we live with three other roommates, but our lease is up June 1st.  We absolutely must move by June 1st, and with the aforementioned heath and monetary issues we've faced this year, we don't have enough money to make the move and all of our prior commitments (cons and such).  


We want to use this campaign to escape this predicament quickly, while offering you exclusive art, commissions, prints, and stickers in return.  I'd been wanting to open up commission spots anyway, so this will kill two birds with one stone! :D This is also the first time I'll be offering exclusives, which I'm excited about. 

 
We are asking for $7500 in order to cover our move and build back up our funds.  Here's a breakdown:
Fees from IndieGogo (9% if we don't meet our goal, 4% if we do), Paypal (3%) and Credit Cards (3%) 
Cost of fulfilling perks (prints, stickers, shipping, packaging, etc. costs are a large portion of the amount were asking)
First and last month's rent, deposit, pet deposit, application fees for our apartment, Uhaul, any other misc. moving expenses   
Prints for upcoming conventions and restocking Etsy prints
The rest of our taxes

If we meet our goal, anything extra will be used to get back to where we were before this year sideswiped us. If we meet our goal, we will definitely be adding a few extra goodies to everyone's rewards, as well.  





This is why you're here!  I tried to put together an assortment of things for those interested in either custom artwork,  wall art and exclusives.  I hope something here strikes your fancy! 

A couple notes about perks:  


Regarding Add-Ons:  Unfortunately Indiegogo doesn't allow add-ons or combining perks, so you will have to make separate contributions for each perk you would like.  Very sorry about the inconvenience!  


Choosing Postcard Sets:  You can either email me (info@meganlara.com) with which postcard set you would like, message me on here, or wait for me to contact you after the campaign is over! :)  





Surprise sticker! I will randomly choose a sticker for you--or if you'd rather it not be a TOTAL surprise, you can let me know a specific piece that you want (check out my Redbubble store to see all the designs I have currently).  I will also be including a surprise postcard that will be exclusive to this campaign!Ideal for smooth flat surfaces like laptops, journals, windows etc. They are easy to remove and made from waterproof vinyl. Should last 18 months outdoors 
 U.S. shipping included in price - add $3 for outside the U.S.

4"x6" glossy postcards of my very first designs -- Peach, Samus and Zelda nouveau (Plus two bonus postcards)!  All postcards  are 4"x6" with about a 1/8" white border, In addition to the two bonus cards, I will also  be including a surprise postcard that will be exclusive to this campaign!U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $5 for outside the U.S.

Five Dark Tower inspired 4"x6" glossy postcards.  My favourite series of books :) 
Set includes "He Followed," "There are Other Worlds Than These," "Nineteen," "The Ka-Tet of Nineteen," "Come, Come, Commala" and surprise bonus card! 

p.s. These are $2 more than the other set of five cards because I was a goofball and forgot to add the base shipping to that set. Y'all lucked out on that one, haha ;)

U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $5 for outside the U.S.

One set of seven 4x6 glossy postcards. This set is comprised of mine and Omega Man 5000's companion designs, plus an extra Who-related design!

One set of seven 4x6 glossy postcards of all the art nouveau princesses I have created thus far! 


U.S. shipping included in price - Please add $5 for outside the U.S.

story:
Check out Paradise Magazine's official website and Facebook page!

THE DREAM:
Nearly one year ago, I took on the enormous task of creating a beautiful 200-page magazine as I saw an opportunity to reshape the medium's traditional formula and breathe originality into its values and aesthetics.  By curating a varied group of over 45 artists, musicians, actors, writers, and photographers (all of which donated 100% of their time, energy, and work), I believe Paradise Magazine succeeds in providing original, thoughtful, and intriguing content in a rare style.  As of right now, Paradise is an annual publication, with the goal of becoming bi-annual in time, hiring paid employees, and producing related short-run printed projects and art books.

THE PRODUCT:
The theme for Paradise Magazine’s debut issue is ‘A Bicoastal View’ and features a wide range of artists and cultural aspects pertaining to San Francisco, CA, and New York, NY.  Because of Paradise’s independence from any corporate sponsorship, the 200 pages of content are free to explore vast dualities by stretching out all extremes, be that old & young age, high & low class, or heteronormative & genderfucked representations of style and sexuality.  There are no rules to Paradise, other than the content must remain entertaining and sincere.

The REALITY:
Becoming a printed object is vital to the Paradise Magazine aesthetic and philosophy. Each custom layout (templates be damed) would never transfer to the computer screen as effectively as they would from paper in your own hands.  Removed from digital distractions, a printed magazine holds your attention far longer than any blog post or tweet, allowing the in-depth interviews, articles, and fashion editorials to truly sit, resonate, and stick with you. This experience comes at a cost however (as printing fees are never as cheap as compressing a digital PDF), due in part to the magazine’s print quantity, page count, and high quality construction, which features vivid colors, soft matte paper, and sturdy covers.  Your donation will turn Paradise into something that exists in the real world; a physical object, an art piece.

AFTER PUBLICATION: 
Paradise Magazine is poised to sell online and in a variety of bookstores, boutiques, and contemporary museums in various cities throughout California and New York. By the end of Spring 2014, an online store will premiere on the Paradise website, selling original t-shirts and artwork related to the publication. 100% of the profits will go towards funding Issue 2.
Along with the Paradise merchandise, various contributors from Issue 1 will be invited to sell their own artwork, music, and designs. 100% of those profits will go directly to the contributing artists. 

CONTRIBUTORS:
These 45+ artists are tomorrow’s movers and shakers; get to know them before fame and fortune blows their minds. One of the best and brightest aspects of creativity is that initial spark of creation.  Paradise Magazine is the spark before the inferno.
Vain Hein of Daddies Plastik, Lusties of The Lusty Lady, artist Lindsay Laven,Cassandra Sechler and Craig Jacobson of Dreams For Dead Cats, artist JxMarie, Linda Martinez the muse, JJ Brine and Lena Marquise of The Labiancas, Miss Coney Island 2011 Lefty Lucy, documentarian Quintessa Matranga, stage actor Alex Nee of American Idiot & Once, photographer Antonio De Lucci, artist Quinn Corey, Voz CEOJasmine Aarons, Mark Rosen of Museum Hack, the band mates of Bitter Fruit, Meow Mix founder Ferosha Titties, author Rhianna Jones, choreographer Lauren Lasorda, actor Dylan Wittrock, photographer Spencer Kohn, jewelry designer Sammi-Jo Rocco,Sextronixxx Entertainment, photographer Joseph Dwyer, musician Shawn Barry, clothing designer Shelby Grochowski, SF socialite Erica Overold, poet Willie G., comedian Dana Robie, stage actress Hannah Bear, performance artist Efferfesence Jackson, clothing designer Renee Torres, artist Eli McNally, actress Tess Bellomo, jet-setter Adrian Bellomo, documentarian Lucas Waldron, writer Zack Powers, Neon Music of YouthQuake, performance artist Rey Alejandro, photographer Manual SoakedinSoul, and Paradise Magazine editor B.B. Gunn.

IN CONCLUSION:
An entire year will have passed by the completion of this project, from studying vintage magazines in my bedroom, to interviewing dozens of artists from SF to NY, to spending the hours and hours and hours it takes to record, transcribe, edit, collect imagery, and layout just one interview.  Paradise Magazine has surpassed becoming a labor of love or a crazed obsession, but a seemingly endless way of life….and I couldn’t be happier with the experience.

-B.B. Gunn
Editor-in-Chief
ParadiseMagazine.com
facebook.com/TheMagazineOfParadise

Each custom layout (templates be damed) would never transfer to the computer screen as effectively as they would from paper in your own hands.  Removed from digital distractions, a printed magazine holds your attention far longer than any blog post or tweet, allowing the in-depth interviews, articles, and fashion editorials to truly sit, resonate, and stick with you. This experience comes at a cost however (as printing fees are never as cheap as compressing a digital PDF), due in part to the magazine’s print quantity, page count, and high quality construction, which features vivid colors, soft matte paper, and sturdy covers.  Your donation will turn Paradise into something that exists in the real world; a physical object, an art piece.AFTER PUBLICATION: Paradise Magazine is poised to sell online and in a variety of bookstores, boutiques, and contemporary museums in various cities throughout California and New York. By the end of Spring 2014, an online store will premiere on the Paradise website, selling original t-shirts and artwork related to the publication. 100% of the profits will go towards funding Issue 2.Along with the Paradise merchandise, various contributors from Issue 1 will be invited to sell their own artwork, music, and designs. 100% of those profits will go directly to the contributing artists. 
CONTRIBUTORS:These 45+ artists are tomorrow’s movers and shakers; get to know them before fame and fortune blows their minds. One of the best and brightest aspects of creativity is that initial spark of creation.  Paradise Magazine is the spark before the inferno.Vain Hein of Daddies Plastik, Lusties of The Lusty Lady, artist Lindsay Laven,Cassandra Sechler and Craig Jacobson of Dreams For Dead Cats, artist JxMarie, Linda Martinez the muse, JJ Brine and Lena Marquise of The Labiancas, Miss Coney Island 2011 Lefty Lucy, documentarian Quintessa Matranga, stage actor Alex Nee of American Idiot & Once, photographer Antonio De Lucci, artist Quinn Corey, Voz CEOJasmine Aarons, Mark Rosen of Museum Hack, the band mates of Bitter Fruit, Meow Mix founder Ferosha Titties, author Rhianna Jones, choreographer Lauren Lasorda, actor Dylan Wittrock, photographer Spencer Kohn, jewelry designer Sammi-Jo Rocco,Sextronixxx Entertainment, photographer Joseph Dwyer, musician Shawn Barry, clothing designer Shelby Grochowski, SF socialite Erica Overold, poet Willie G., comedian Dana Robie, stage actress Hannah Bear, performance artist Efferfesence Jackson, clothing designer Renee Torres, artist Eli McNally, actress Tess Bellomo, jet-setter Adrian Bellomo, documentarian Lucas Waldron, writer Zack Powers, Neon Music of YouthQuake, performance artist Rey Alejandro, photographer Manual SoakedinSoul, and Paradise Magazine editor B.B. Gunn.
IN CONCLUSION:An entire year will have passed by the completion of this project, from studying vintage magazines in my bedroom, to interviewing dozens of artists from SF to NY, to spending the hours and hours and hours it takes to record, transcribe, edit, collect imagery, and layout just one interview.  Paradise Magazine has surpassed becoming a labor of love or a crazed obsession, but a seemingly endless way of life….and I couldn’t be happier with the experience.-B.B. GunnEditor-in-ChiefParadiseMagazine.comfacebook.com/TheMagazineOfParadise

story: Hi, I'm David. I am a welder by trade without a welding machine. I mainly work with metal in artistic ways but also do structural and ornamental fabrication. I have worked on multiple large scale art projects for the Burning Man project and Burning Flipside in central Texas. I am currently saving for a Miller multi-process welder but at my current income rate that could take up to 3 years. I saw a friend open a crowd funding site for tools and he got more than his goal. So here I am.. asking the community for help.. It never hurts to ask..

story:
Our Story: Love, Family and Beats

Camp Zazen was founded in 2012 in an old Brady Bunch sort of way.  Two veteran burners and lovers brought their "adult" children to Burning Man.These offspring in turn, brought their lovers, friends, and fellow adventure seekers to the playa to radiate all things sparkly & magical. Over the years, as the family grew, DJ's blossomed, our muscles aged and the vision of a Mutant Vehicle was born.  The Bus was bought in 2016 and outfitted as the Zennaissance Mover, a Renaissance Wagon for daVinci’s Workshop. In 2017, it morphed into The Zen Express.  For both tours, a team of rag tag welders, builders, electricians, seamstress and moral supporters collaborated to bring music, friendship, bum rushes and shady naps to hundreds of inspired and tired burners…but not without intense heat, exhaustion, weary bodies and quarrels.  For 2018, the bus returns as The Pariah Express; sexier, brighter, more mutated, street legal and purring better thanever!

What We Need 

In 2018, our first official fundraiser, is necessary to make the following improvements to our magic school bus:  

      Engine Maintenance - she didn't make it home in 2017 without seeing a few doctors

      Stabilizing Airbags - if you danced on her, you've seen the lean 

      Steel Hair and Makeup - mama needs more Pariah locomotive and less school bus

      Tires - very necessary for rollin' rollin' rollin'

      2000 Additional LED's - lite'erup, so you can find her when feeling alone and lost 

      Street Licensing & Insurance-  realities that aren’t supposed to exist on the playa (but do)

The Impact

The Pariah Express exists for one reason...to bring joy!  Consider your donation as an investment in happiness, and a contribution to belly laughs, booty shakes, love connections and memories!  What pays a better dividend. The Pariah Express, like many Mutant Vehicles, is made possible because people give their time and resources to make Burning Man this unique experience.  If you are unable to contribute with dollars; we welcome welders, mechanics, seamstress and carpenters to our shop in Park City, Utah.  If you see us on the playa, our drivers can always use a hug and an expression of gratitude.

Thank you for your contribution, for reading, for believing, for paying it forward.  Love and Community are our most valuable resources.  We hope that they are for you as well.

Thank you, Thank you, Thank you.

Now, let’s go make memories…”All Aboard”

story:
What is REMEMBER?

Jessica Ashleigh Pomeroy and Michelle Cage, co-producers of REMEMBER, are emerging artists themselves. Hailing from Connecticut and Colorado, they transplanted to New York City while still in their teens to work as teaching artists, servers, and office assistants while earning their BFA degrees from The New School of Drama. In 2019 they received their degrees, then came 2020. 

Sustaining their early artistic careers during the COVID-19 pandemic and quarentine instilled in them a desire to amplify the voices of those artistic peers that were facing the same shortage of paid work, or opportunities to present work at all. Throughout all of the uncertainty of this year, they were still determined to fight for the opportunities that they dreamed of. 

Anyone taking the time to read this campaign has an innate understanding that a young artist exists in everyone, and helping emerging artists shine freely makes the world a better place. Jessica and Michelle created this festival to do just that: help these eleven teams of artists shine freely. 
 

Our Goals AND Where Do You Come In? 

Our two goals are simple:

Give emerging artists a platform to create and present work that they created based on their experiences of the year 2020, by creating a unique online venue, selling tickets, and advertising for the event.  

To support artists financially during a time when so many artists and creators have lost their ability to work in an artistic capacity, or at all. 

THIS is where you come in!

We are looking to raise funds to support artists during this time, and all donations will be split evenly among the artists and creators involved, as we hope this will be an equitable way to support artists as much as we can as young, independent theatre producers. 

If you enjoy the shows this weekend, we hope you will feel inclined to give to this campaign and further support the work of these incredible emerging artists!

 

Who Are These Artists? What is this work?

This festival will feature 5 works of theatre, 3 musical acts, and 3 visual art collections, and a series of interviews, all curated, conducted and created by early-career artists selected by Jessica and Michelle because of their unique perspectives on 2020 and artmaking. 

The work will be released on a schedule, as follows:

Friday, April 9th:

10:00 am EST: A Quarantined EP: Two musicians tell a story of their experiences with relationships, culture, and life during quarantine through original song. Created and performed by Hailey Brinnel (www.haileybrinnel.com) and Andrew Carson.

10:30 am EST: the lone sessions: Two friends meditate on loneliness as they explore its collaborative relationship to social media and performance. Co-created by Lizz Mangan (www.lizzmangan.com) and Emma Joy Hill (www.emmajoyhill.com).

11:30 am EST: Eulogies for Elena: While writing her mother's eulogy, Elena begins to discover things about her own life and feelings towards herself, while trying to escape the pain and unstoppable heartbreak that comes with losing someone you love and not knowing if you ever made them proud. Written by Cris Eli Blak (IG: @criseliblak), Directed by Bradley Cordero (IG: @bradleyscordero), Scenic design by Sasha Schwartz (www.sashaschwartzscenic.com), featuring Maria Müller (www.marialuizamuller.com).

12:00 pm EST: The Remember Fest Sessions: A showcase of two original songs written and performed by musician Calvin Rezen (calvinrezen.com), filmed by Jillian Rezen of Segno Studios (segnoproductions.com).


Saturday, April 10th

11:00 am EST: Sudden Changes: A performance of two original songs by guitarist and songwriter Sam Rocca (IG: @samroccamusic), reflecting on the emotional impact of 2020. Featuring lyrics and vocals by Jessica Pomeroy (jessicaashleighpomeroy.com).

11:30 am EST: Cannot Accept New Messages: The story of one person’s crappy year, told through the voicemails filling up her inbox. Written and directed by Sophia Costanzi (www.smcdesigner.com), music by Doug Berns (www.dougbernsbass.com), music by Doug Berns (www.dougbernsbass.com), filmed and edited by Julian Weller, featuring Molly Dillon (www.mollydillonacting.com), Daniel Froot, Ariel Kaye (IG: @lilmerms), Monte Marshall (IG: @montelligence), and Isabella Jane Schiller (www.isabellajaneschiller.com).

12:30 pm EST: The Self, Destroyed: Reflecting on experiences and expectations changed and shattered from 2020, creator and solo performer Bailey Macejak (IG: @baileytheconformist) endeavors to explore what it means to really be yourself - even when no one's watching.

1:00 pm EST: Top Five Answers: After a year in quarantine together, an episode of Family Feud causes a mother and her adult daughter to reach their breaking point. Written by Alison Vincitore (IG: @alivincitore), Directed by Maria Palacio (IG: @wanderlustfilmmaker), featuring Patricia M. Lawrence (https://www.patriciamlawrence.com) and Michelle Cage.


Sunday, April 11th:

All works will be available for the full day!


Available All Weekend:


Art in the Time of Corona: A short video with a photo showcase. A play on “El amor en los tiempos del cólera” (or “Love in the Time of Cholera”) by Gabriel Garcia Márquez. Created by Jherlin Nuñez (Twitter: @Jherlinpn), Illustrations and Digital Art by Stephanie Balbuena, featuring architect/model Ahmed Aoughali and Valeria Diaz.

iM noT A JoRNalist <3 I dOnT KnOW HOW I FEeL <3 mY tRiviAl LittLE LiFe <3: A stream of consciousness comic that flounders on a year of unprocessed trauma. The Barbie Diaries © if barbie had to reckon with death and being transgender. Written and Illustrated by Milo O’Connell (IG: @crazyjaunji), Edited by Luna Alatorre.

Remember, Reflect, Reinvent: Experimental multimedia designer Alessandra Cronin (alessandracronin.squarespace.com) worked on REMEMBER as the Art Director, as well as the curator of the virtual venue. Her work is being presented in gallery form and is also represented as the entire virtual venue being accessed by audiences.

The Quarantine Recordings: Conducted by REMEMBER Fest 2020 co-producer, Michelle Cage (IG: @michellelaurencage), this series of interviews features a range of artists reflecting on their experiences of 2020. Some of the most emotional and poignant snippets from these open, honest conversations will be presented.

The Impact

Early 20th-century painter Georges Braque said it best, “ Art is a wound turned into light." In times of sickness and war, artists have always been there to soothe the soul of our societies and let in the light. Therefore, the impact of any contribution to this festival is too significant to be stated in plain words. Even if your contribution is simply purchasing a $5 ticket or donating $5 on this campaign, contributing to an artist's creation as they turn wounds to light will have been worth it.

Jessica and Michelle are so passionate in their belief of this concept, and so firm in their support of emerging artists this year, that they took part in creating and running a Weekend Zoom Festival in early 2020. It featured more than 70 early-career artists, 6 elementary artists, and 6 teaching artists; reaching more than 3,000 audience members who tuned in on those broadcasts. They look forward to continuing to create a strong impact with REMEMBER.

Other Ways To Support!

We know that this is a financially difficult time for everyone, not just artists! That is why we are asking that if you are unable to support us at this time, you please share about the event on social media! 

Our Instagram handle is @remember.fest.2020 and our website is www.rememberfest2020.com.

story:
UPDATE 5:

Thank you so much for the overwhelming response especially in the last days of our campaign- we've raised enough to document endangered rock art in one country (!!!!). 

Lots of traffic is still coming from TARA's feature in the Independent and we'd like to give you a way to participate in our mission still. Please visit our website http://africanrockart.org/donations/if you would like to donate. 

UPDATE 4: NEW PERK, ROCK ART SAFARI

For $5000 you can go on a rock art safari with photographer and TARA founder David Coulson! 

UPDATE 3: INDEPENDENT FEATURE

The campaign and TARA/British Museum African Rock Art image project were featured in the Independent. The British Museum is uploading 25,000 rock art and contextual images that will be available open source. Read more

UPDATE 2: NEW PERKS!

With a week to go on our campaign we're changing up some of the perks: we've introduced a new $5 perk: receive a digital account of the missions written by David Coulson after mission completion. 

For $10, in addition to the shout out on our social media you will also receive a digital account of the missions delivered to your inbox! And for $25 we will send you a pack of 2 rock art gift cards in addition to the digital mission account and the handwritten thank you card.

UPDATE: NEW PERK! REDUCED PERK!

With 10 days left to the campaign, we're offering a 5*7 image below of warriors on horseback, taken near the mouth of a cave in Southern Mauritania for $35. We've also lowered the 'Dine in rock art style' 4 dinner table mats from $250 to $150 - only 22 sets available so catch them while they're here!!!


Soundbite!

We’re raising funds to document previously undocumented and endangered rock art sites in the Sahara

Rock art? Paintings and carvings on rock done thousands of years ago. They provide the oldest evidence of human creativity and thought

Why? Because rock art in the Sahara is threatened by vandalism, extremists, theft and mineral exploitation

AND because rock art is an important heritage, educational resource, and can provide a livelihood for communities living near it

The Sahara? The Sahara Desert is the most diverse rock art gallery in Africa! And the art there is in peril.

How much? $60,000

Why? $20,000 is approximately what we need to record in one country. We’d like to do 3.

Who are you? We’re glad you asked: the Trust for African Rock Art. We record, disseminate and preserve (alongside communities) Africa’s rich rock art heritage.

What do I need to do? DONATE and tell your friends why they should too.

                                                                                                          The Dabous Giraffes, Niger
Rock art and the Sahara

Larger than the United States, the Sahara Desert traverses 10 African countries and is the greatest treasury of ancient art on earth. A lot of this art is however severely endangered by mineral extraction, vandalism, extremists and theft. In the central Sahara there are life-size carvings of crocodiles, giraffes, hippo and elephants, evidence of the thousands of years when the Sahara was fertile, before the pyramids of ancient Egypt. Little is known about the cultures that gave birth to this art, and the images that are left behind are often our only source of information on who the artists were and what was important to them. 

Rock art represents the dawn of imagination of humankind. Nowhere on earth is the art so diverse as in Africa, yet so little known. The Nairobi-based non-profit TARA, Trust for African Rock Art, works to change this reality by illuminating the rich heritage represented by rock art in Africa. As former South African president Nelson Mandela stated, “Africa’s rock art is the common heritage of all Africans, but it is more than that; it is the common heritage of humanity.”

                                                                             Warriors on horseback, southern Mauritania

We need your help!

Time is running out for one of the greatest art galleries on earth. The majority of the central Sahara, where TARA has previously worked, is now flagged as a Red Zone, an area where travel is discouraged or forbidden. Other human threats to rock art include vandalism, theft and large scale projects such as mineral prospecting and extraction as well as dams and roads.

                                     Vandalised rock art, Akakus Mountains, Libya (l) and Morocco (r)

What can we do?

TARA has set a goal to raise a minimum of $60,000 in support of the exploration and documentation of around 100 rock art sites in at least 3 of 6 Saharan countries (see map below) by the end of 2016, and we NEED your help to achieve this goal.

$20,000 will help cover the costs of survey missions to sites in one country which will include airfares and on the ground transport to the sites; permissions, licences and security costs; plus the costs of image and data processing after the survey missions have been completed.

Any amount we raise above our target will be used to document rock art in more countries (see map below), so please keep donating!

Survey and documentation missions are a crucial first step in enabling TARA to carry out its mission goals. If we do not know where important rock art exists, we cannot inform people about it, or work alongside communities in order to develop conservation projects that also benefit them economically as we have done in the past.

Finding and documenting the remaining sites before they disappear or are destroyed is critical!


Where will we be going?

TARA plans to survey and document new rock art sites in 3 out of the Saharan countries of Mauritania, Mali, Niger, Chad, Sudan and Egypt (shown below) before some of them are damaged or destroyed.

The Atar region in central Mauritania is a volcanic region whose rock art relates to wetter and more fertile times.

The cliffs of Bandiagara in Mali are a UNESCO World Heritage Site with the rock art of the Dogon people who’ve lived here for 500 years and regularly repaint their totemic rock paintings thus maintaining a living attachment to it.  

The Air Mountains region of northern Niger is home to the 6,000 year old life-size giraffe carvings of Dabous as well as hundreds more rock engravings yet to be discovered.

The Ennedi Mountains of northern Chad are an eroded wilderness of canyons, rock towers and broken plateaus where different styles and periods of art are found ranging from 1000 to 10,000 years old.

In the northern Sudan, there are important rock engraving sites between the 3rd and 4th cataracts on the River Nile, as well as on an ancient tributary of the Nile in the Western Desert.

In the Gilf Kebir in South West Egypt, not far from the Libyan border, TARA has yet to document a major new site with 8000 year old painting.

Who/What is TARA?

TARA is a Nairobi-based international non-profit organization that over the last 20 years has documented hundreds of important sites across the continent creating an international awareness of this heritage. It has also often worked alongside local communities to conserve their sites. During these years we have probably established the most comprehensive digital archive of the Sahara's rock art in existence.A large part of this archive is now accessible online (open access) through the British Museum's global online collections.

Donate NOW to support our mission

and

Share THIS campaign with your friends and networks!

Other Ways You Can Help

TARA also welcomes in kind support and other forms of collaboration. Send us an email on tara@africanrockart.org if you have ideas on how we can collaborate and let's see how we can work together.

“The rock art of Africa makes up one of the oldest and most extensive records on earth of human thought. It shows the very emergence of the human imagination. It is a priceless treasure. And it is irreplaceable. But Africa’s rock art is not just about the distant past. It is about today and tomorrow as well.”

Kofi Annan, Secretary General, UN (2005)


The Impact

Thanks to your support of this campaign, we'll have a permanent record of new rock art sites in at least 3 countries!!

The images and accompanying data from our survey trips will be added to TARA’s existing archive and be freely available for posterity for research and educational purposes. 

Documentation and photography of these sites will spark new research and reinforce existing research on the fascinating archaeology and anthropology of these Saharan countries. 

Documentation will allow this rich repository of knowledge about OUR past to be of benefit to all humankind even after it is gone in its physical form.

HELP us make certain that the rich and priceless heritage of the Sahara does not disappear without a trace!

What You Get

To thank you for your support of this campaign we are offering perks featuring rock art images taken by international photographer and TARA co-founder and executive chairman, David Coulson.
story_txt:
UPDATE 5:Thank you so much for the overwhelming response especially in the last days of our campaign- we've raised enough to document endangered rock art in one country (!!!!). Lots of traffic is still coming from TARA's feature in the Independent and we'd like to give you a way to participate in our mission still. Please visit our website http://africanrockart.org/donations/if you would like to donate. UPDATE 4: NEW PERK, ROCK ART SAFARIFor $5000 you can go on a rock art safari with photographer and TARA founder David Coulson! UPDATE 3: INDEPENDENT FEATUREThe campaign and TARA/British Museum African Rock Art image project were featured in the Independent. The British Museum is uploading 25,000 rock art and contextual images that will be available open source. Read moreUPDATE 2: NEW PERKS!With a week to go on our campaign we're changing up some of the perks: we've introduced a new $5 perk: receive a digital account of the missions written by David Coulson after mission completion. For $10, in addition to the shout out on our social media you will also receive a digital account of the missions delivered to your inbox! And for $25 we will send you a pack of 2 rock art gift cards in addition to the digital mission account and the handwritten thank you card.UPDATE: NEW PERK! REDUCED PERK!With 10 days left to the campaign, we're offering a 5*7 image below of warriors on horseback, taken near the mouth of a cave in Southern Mauritania for $35. We've also lowered the 'Dine in rock art style' 4 dinner table mats from $250 to $150 - only 22 sets available so catch them while they're here!!!Soundbite!
We’re raising
funds to document previously undocumented and endangered rock art sites in the Sahara
Rock art? Paintings
and carvings on rock done thousands of years ago. They provide the oldest evidence of human creativity and thought
Why? Because rock
art in the Sahara is threatened by vandalism, extremists, theft and mineral exploitationAND because rock art is an important heritage, educational resource, and can provide a livelihood for communities living near it
The Sahara? The Sahara
Desert is the most diverse rock art gallery in Africa! And the art there is in peril.
How much? $60,000
Why? $20,000 is
approximately what we need to record in one country. We’d like to do 3.
Who are you? We’re
glad you asked: the Trust for African Rock Art. We record, disseminate and
preserve (alongside communities) Africa’s rich rock art heritage.
What do I need to do?
DONATE and tell your friends why they should too.                                                                                                          The Dabous Giraffes, NigerRock art and the SaharaLarger than the United States, the Sahara Desert traverses 10 African countries and is the greatest treasury of ancient art on earth. A lot of this art is however severely endangered by mineral extraction, vandalism, extremists and theft. In the central Sahara there are life-size carvings of crocodiles, giraffes, hippo and elephants, evidence of the thousands of years when the Sahara was fertile, before the pyramids of ancient Egypt. Little is known about the cultures that gave birth to this art, and the images that are left behind are often our only source of information on who the artists were and what was important to them. Rock
art represents the dawn of imagination of humankind. Nowhere
on earth is the art so diverse as in Africa, yet so little known. The Nairobi-based non-profit
TARA, Trust for African Rock Art, works to change this reality by illuminating
the rich heritage represented by rock art in Africa. As former South African
president Nelson Mandela stated, “Africa’s
rock art is the common heritage of all Africans, but it is more than that; it
is the common heritage of humanity.”                                                                             Warriors on horseback, southern MauritaniaWe need your help!Time is running out for one of the greatest art galleries on earth. The majority of 
the central Sahara, where TARA has previously worked, is now
 flagged as a Red Zone, an area where travel is discouraged or forbidden. Other human threats to rock art include vandalism, theft
 and large scale projects such as mineral prospecting and extraction as well as dams and roads.                                     Vandalised rock art, Akakus Mountains, Libya (l) and Morocco (r)What can we do?TARA has set a goal to raise a minimum of $60,000 in support of the exploration and documentation of around 100 rock art sites in at least 3 of 6 Saharan countries (see map below) by the end of 2016, and we NEED your help to achieve this goal.

$20,000 will help cover the costs of survey missions to sites in one country
which will include airfares and on the ground transport to the sites;
permissions, licences and security costs; plus the costs of image and data
processing after the survey missions have been completed.
Any amount we raise above our target will be
used to document rock art in more countries (see map below), so please keep
donating!
Survey and documentation missions are a
crucial first step in enabling TARA to carry out its mission goals. If we do
not know where important rock art exists, we cannot inform people about it, or
work alongside communities in order to develop conservation projects that also
benefit them economically as we have done in the past.
Finding and documenting the remaining sites
before they disappear or are destroyed is critical!





Where will we be going?
TARA plans to survey and document new rock art sites in 3 
out of the Saharan countries of Mauritania, Mali, Niger, Chad, Sudan and
 Egypt (shown below) before some of them are damaged or destroyed.



The Atar region in central Mauritania is a volcanic region whose rock art relates to wetter and more fertile times.
The cliffs of Bandiagara in Mali are a UNESCO World Heritage Site with the rock art of the Dogon people who’ve lived here for 500 years and regularly repaint their totemic rock paintings thus maintaining a living attachment to it.  
The Air Mountains region of northern Niger is home to the 6,000 year old life-size giraffe carvings of Dabous as well as hundreds more rock engravings yet to be discovered.
The Ennedi Mountains of northern Chad are an eroded wilderness of canyons, rock towers and broken plateaus where different styles and periods of art are found ranging from 1000 to 10,000 years old.

In the northern Sudan, there are important rock engraving
sites between the 3rd and 4th cataracts on the River Nile, as well as on an
ancient tributary of the Nile in the Western Desert.
In the Gilf Kebir in South West Egypt, not far from the Libyan border, TARA has yet to document a major new site with 8000 year old painting.
Who/What is TARA?
TARA is a Nairobi-based international non-profit organization that over the last 20 years has documented hundreds of important sites across the continent creating an international awareness of this heritage. It has also often worked alongside local communities to conserve their sites. During these years we have probably established the most comprehensive digital archive of the Sahara's rock art in existence.A large part of this archive is now accessible online (open access) through the British Museum's global online collections.

Donate NOW to support our mission
and
Share THIS campaign with your friends and networks!
Other Ways You Can Help
TARA also welcomes in kind support and other forms of collaboration. Send us an email on tara@africanrockart.org if you have ideas on how we can collaborate and let's see how we can work together.
“The rock art of Africa makes up one of the oldest and most extensive records on earth of human thought. It shows the very emergence of the human imagination. It is a priceless treasure. And it is irreplaceable. But Africa’s rock art is not just about the distant past. It is about today and tomorrow as well.”Kofi Annan, Secretary General, UN (2005)


The Impact
Thanks to your support of this campaign, we'll have a permanent record of new rock art sites in at least 3 countries!!
The images and accompanying data from our survey trips will be added to TARA’s existing archive and be freely available for posterity for research and educational purposes. 
Documentation and photography of these sites will spark new research and reinforce existing research on the fascinating archaeology and anthropology of these Saharan countries. 
Documentation will allow this rich repository of knowledge about OUR past to be of benefit to all humankind even after it is gone in its physical form.
HELP us make certain that the rich and priceless heritage of the Sahara does not disappear without a trace!
What You Get
To thank you for your support of this campaign we are offering perks featuring rock art images taken by international photographer and TARA co-founder and executive chairman, David Coulson.

story:
Short Summary

Marin County’s Día de los Muertos Committee, led by local non-profit Canal Welcome Center,  is happy to present San Rafael's 2015 Day of the Dead Community Celebration. Our goal is to unite the diverse communities of San Rafael through a multi-disciplinary event that brings residents together to share a grateful acknowledgement of the continuing ebb and flow of Life. 

This event will support over 2,000 children and families in celebrating, honoring, and grieving their loved ones and ancestors. Through altar making, arts workshops, educational opportunities, and impactful cultural celebrations, we will create a festive community environment where Marin County residents of all neighborhoods and walks of life can come together to celebrate Life. Our event will counteract the commercialization of this Latino tradition by providing traditional activities and performances that capture the authentic emotional impact of Day of the Dead.

As a supporter of this event, you will contribute to providing audiences of all backgrounds with creative outlets for emotional relief and group healing. With your help, we can foster social cohesion and increase cultural representation of and participation in Latino traditions within the diverse Marin County.


What It Is  

Your contributions will support local art and artists, public school tours, and local entrepreneurship. Under the guidance of artists from the area, we invite over 2,000 children and families from all over Marin County to:
1) Create their own Día de los Muertos altars: creative testaments to the life and times of loved ones
2) Attend all-ages arts workshops, such as Face-painting and papel picado. Traditionally, people paint their faces like skulls as a powerful symbol of humans’ ability to get in touch with their dark, chaotic side. It represents the opportunity to overcome the fear of death for one night.
3) Attend a Community Procession (Parade) and Traditional Arts Performances from a mariachi band and local performers such as Ballet Folkorico Netzualcoyotl, a local, multicultural, mixed ages troupe that has performed at venues like The Annual San Francisco Ethnic Dance Festival, the Mixcoalt Aztec Dancers, and Enriching Lives through Music (ELM).
4) Attend School Tours. 1000+ students from local public schools will attend our Educational Tours, which include: an introduction to to the origins and significance of Day of the Dead, cultural performance, presentation and discussion of the altars, and storytelling.  Storytelling is a vital part of Día de los Muertos, and is used by many Latino cultures as a means of education, entertainment, cultural preservation, and instilling moral values. Our event uses moving, memorable, authentic stories to transmit a sense of connectedness between the self, the community, and the Universe.
5) Support local entrepreneurs. Local entrepreneurs from the neighborhood will be at the event to sell traditional Día de los Muertos foods, such as pozole, tamales, pan de muertos, and more. Proceeds support local groups and schools. Food is a crucial element of the celebration; friends and family of deceased loved ones make their favorite foods and offer it to the spirits as a gift.
For more information, please visit our website at: www.dayofthedeadsr.org

 How You Can Help

We seek your support in 3 specific areas:
1) To support 500 families and children to attend art workshops-$2,500
2) To rent stage, sound, and light equipment that will support us in showcasing local talent, and to enhance the celebration of Life and Diversity in Marin County-$2,500
3) To rent school buses and compensate educators and performers for Día de los Muertos Educational Field trips for local San Rafael K-12 school children on November 9th from 9am-3pm at The Albert Boro Community Center-$2,500 

Other Ways You Can Support

If you don't have the cash, don't stress! We'd love your help volunteering at the event. Sign up at: www.dayofthedeadsr.org

You can also support the cause by tweeting and promoting us on Facebook with the hashtag: #SanRafaelDoD. See you on Saturday, November 7th!

story:
About this project

“＃Share Your Last Minute” is the first public art project presented by Mo+ CA Projects, it is one of the creative events in ArtWeek Boston this year. The original concept is  from the simple belief that people could be reconnected outside of the virtual world by sharing the moments of our life. Meanwhile, we will exam the need for social interaction and the push-and-pull of situating “me” in a “we” world by this project.
Further inspired by the idea of "deduction photography" that developed by the Japanese Photographer Takuma Nakahira, which underlines the aesthetic subjectivity of our eyes.Through documenting things indiscriminately with a camera, Takuma demonstrates the aesthetic subjectivity of human’s eye.
We are hoping this project will create aspiration for all participants through the artistic talent that born with each of us.

Who we are?

Mo+CA Projects is an artist-founded organization in San Francisco 2014. Our mission is to be the catalyst for inspiration and innovation by curating exhibitions and practicing public art projects to connect with artists and communities.

How to participate?

 It is not an Artists-Only event but a chance for everyone to engage and enjoy.

Follow our topic and post your photo and hashtag ＃shareyourlastminute on Instagram between April 25th to May 5th, your photo will be printed and designed for a one-page zine based on the each day topic and shared with all participants. The series of zines will be turned into an art book（limited edition) and applied for the Kala Art Institutes exhibition Fermata. your name will be included in the book as the photographer!   

Please follow our event page by click Facebook  to get more details.

If you happened to be in Boston, come to meet Mo+CA Projects' members at Jaho Coffee Roaster & Wine Bar at 6pm, April 29 for an artist talk and a zine-making demo.

How will we present our project?

You are super welcome to sort the posts on Instagram by#shareyourlastminute after 5th May. This project will encourage people to upload lots of interesting photos share same dates or subject matters.

We are making one-page artist book series “Share Your Last Minute”. These books contain 5 IG posts which share same time spot, but come from the different areas, even cross the world. The idea of “Share Your Last minute” comes from this bookmaking idea. We would like to share a little piece of our visual research by sending this small gift to you, our donors and participants!

After the on-line campaign is over, we will make a limited edition hand-made artist book. It will be an accordion book and represent all the images we collected from the online campaign. One of the founders, Yishu Wang, is a book artist. Her works have been  awarded and shown internationally. 


How to help us to make it happen?

- All donations will contribute towards the project.

Paper Material - $100

Photo Printing - $350

Promotional material - $150

Shipping Cost - $150

Venue Cost - $250
Total cost - $1000

We create 5 perks for our donors:

$5    Hello from Boston ！（artist-made and hand-wrote "thank you" note）

$10 Share our 4:30 pm 04/17/2016 with you!

This is our first one-page book with 5 Instagram images.It is the very first try to make our art concept becoming a real thing.  Most of them photographed by 4:30 pm 04/17/2016, and the photos come from San Francisco, Boston, Shanghai, across the world!  We would like to share our visual experience at 4:30pm with you!

$25  We will mail you one of our cute sketchbooks. 

$45  Making your selection of two zines!

$65  Three zines! Yes, captain! We also will thank you by posting on Instagram with your name. 

$ 250  A "thank you" note, a sketchbook, three zines of "Share your last minute", and big "thank you" post on Instagram!

- All donations will contribute to this project and all donors will be invited to the artist talk and listed as contributors to the art book.

Other Ways You Can Help

·  Spread the word and share this project with your friends!

   Or invite your friend to check our Facebook page: Mo+CA Projects

·  Check our daily topic and share your photo on Instagram (Don’t forget to hashtag “#shareyourlastminute”)

·  Come to meet us for the artist talk @Jaho Coffee on April 29, Boston!

Together we can make this happen！Support art and our community simple as it should be!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Welcome to the Nimbus campaign!

Hello everyone!

I am Dalton Bissell of DB-Tops and I want you to see my newest air powered spinning top, The Nimbus. This thing is very cool. My favorite thing about it is its cloud-like silhouette. It does such a great job of artfully concealing its true function of a speedy little turbine. After you give it a spin, a swift breath of air will cause this top to accelerate. It can go really fast! 

Since spinning the Nimbus is addicting fun, I decided to include a spin station in my campaign to corral those wilder spins. (It's easy to get a little overzealous as the Nimbus gets up to speed.) This station is a real trooper and is armored up in 550 paracord! It's ready to adventure so you can spin your tops anywhere you like. It's damn near drop-proof, fits in your pocket, and comes in some sweet color patterns (more details below).

Making spinning tops is my passion and it's more work than you might think. I have some colleagues that offer  great critique, but mostly I do all the work you see myself. I am the Concept Artist, 3D Modeler, Machinist, Photographer, Videographer, Actor, Video Editor, Director, Marketing Director, and Customer Support Representative. I am really grateful for you, the audience, and I need your support in order to chase this wild dream. With more support I can go farther with this passion of mine and turn it into something that I can support my family with. If you can't contribute to the campaign but still want to help out, share my story with your friends and on your social media pages. It helps a lot!

More about the Nimbus

The Nimbus is made of stainless steel, it's 1 ⅛ inches wide, weighs about 27g, and spins for about 4 minutes. It comes with your choice of bearing: Ruby (red), Silicon Nitride (black ceramic), or Tungsten Carbide (silver). 

The Nimbus Mini is made of brass, it's 3/4 of an inch wide, weighs about 8g, and spins for about 2 ½ minutes. It also comes with your choice of bearing: Ruby (red), Silicon Nitride (black ceramic), or Tungsten Carbide (silver). 

Both spinning tops are 3d printed and then turned on a lathe to ensure accuracy. The bearing is then pressed into the top with a vice. Lastly, they are spin tested and packed with care.

The air powered function of these tops works best if you aim straight down, perpendicular to the top. With 4 or 5 swift breaths you could be hitting the maximum speed! Using a straw can help supply strong, accurate air power to the Nimbus. It's normal (and safe) for a little condensation to leave the straw or collect on the glass lens. Have fun!

More about the Spin Stations

The spinning glass is a 75mm double concave lens with a focal length of 200mm. It's our favorite everyday lens, being affordable to replace and durable enough for your pocket. The silicone band does a nice job of keeping your tops safe from the glass edge if a spin gets out of control, while the Paracord Armor makes these lenses almost drop proof. Need to see it to believe it? Here's a video!

After the campaign is over you can still get a replacement glass at www.DB-Tops.com for about $7, or a whole new station for about $12.

Stretch Goal!

I have always wanted to attempt breaking the world record for the longest assisted spin with a spinning top. If this campaign can reach a funding of %1000, I will try my hardest to break the record this year with the Guinness World Book of Records. This requires a Guinness World Book judge to travel to me to witness my attempt, so I can't mess up even once. The goal? One long continuous spin using just the power of my own breath for a target of over 8 hours. I'll stream it live so you can watch me huff and puff all day long. I'll also show you all some of my other tops in the down time. Wish me luck!

Risks & Challenges

After launching several other top designs I'm very familiar with the risks and challenges. The biggest problem faced when making tops is getting them well-balanced. There are always going to be one or two tops in a batch that wobble for one reason or another. To handle this issue, I make extra stock of the tops and personally test each one before they are packaged. 

The other main challenge to overcome is shipping. I plan to ship with USPS first class, tracking numbers included. This is the very same method I use for my website, www.DB-Tops.com, and it has proven to be very effective. My domestic shipping customers generally receive their items in 3-5 days. I am confidant in my shipping abilities and will deliver these tops in a timely manner because I have the experience to do so.

More Photos!
