This station is a real trooper and is armored up in 550 paracord! It's ready to adventure so you can spin your tops anywhere you like. It's damn near drop-proof, fits in your pocket, and comes in some sweet color patterns (more details below).

Making spinning tops is my passion and it's more work than you might think. I have some colleagues that offer  great critique, but mostly I do all the work you see myself. I am the Concept Artist, 3D Modeler, Machinist, Photographer, Videographer, Actor, Video Editor, Director, Marketing Director, and Customer Support Representative. I am really grateful for you, the audience, and I need your support in order to chase this wild dream. With more support I can go farther with this passion of mine and turn it into something that I can support my family with. If you can't contribute to the campaign but still want to help out, share my story with your friends and on your social media pages. It helps a lot!

More about the Nimbus

The Nimbus is made of stainless steel, it's 1 ⅛ inches wide, weighs about 27g, and spins for about 4 minutes. It comes with your choice of bearing: Ruby (red), Silicon Nitride (black ceramic), or Tungsten Carbide (silver). 
The Nimbus Mini is made of brass, it's 3/4 of an inch wide, weighs about 8g, and spins for about 2 ½ minutes. It also comes with your choice of bearing: Ruby (red), Silicon Nitride (black ceramic), or Tungsten Carbide (silver). 

Both spinning tops are 3d printed and then turned on a lathe to ensure accuracy. The bearing is then pressed into the top with a vice. Lastly, they are spin tested and packed with care.
The air powered function of these tops works best if you aim straight down, perpendicular to the top. With 4 or 5 swift breaths you could be hitting the maximum speed! Using a straw can help supply strong, accurate air power to the Nimbus. It's normal (and safe) for a little condensation to leave the straw or collect on the glass lens. Have fun!
More about the Spin Stations
The spinning glass is a 75mm double concave lens with a focal length of 200mm. It's our favorite everyday lens, being affordable to replace and durable enough for your pocket. The silicone band does a nice job of keeping your tops safe from the glass edge if a spin gets out of control, while the Paracord Armor makes these lenses almost drop proof. Need to see it to believe it? Here's a video!

After the campaign is over you can still get a replacement glass at www.DB-Tops.com for about $7, or a whole new station for about $12.
Stretch Goal!
I have always wanted to attempt breaking the world record for the longest assisted spin with a spinning top. If this campaign can reach a funding of %1000, I will try my hardest to break the record this year with the Guinness World Book of Records. This requires a Guinness World Book judge to travel to me to witness my attempt, so I can't mess up even once. The goal? One long continuous spin using just the power of my own breath for a target of over 8 hours. I'll stream it live so you can watch me huff and puff all day long. I'll also show you all some of my other tops in the down time. Wish me luck!

Risks & Challenges
After launching several other top designs I'm very familiar with the risks and challenges. The biggest problem faced when making tops is getting them well-balanced. There are always going to be one or two tops in a batch that wobble for one reason or another. To handle this issue, I make extra stock of the tops and personally test each one before they are packaged. 
The other main challenge to overcome is shipping. I plan to ship with USPS first class, tracking numbers included. This is the very same method I use for my website, www.DB-Tops.com, and it has proven to be very effective. My domestic shipping customers generally receive their items in 3-5 days. I am confidant in my shipping abilities and will deliver these tops in a timely manner because I have the experience to do so.
More Photos!

story:
27metricubi in London

10 days, 5 artists, a public art residency & art project

in Granary Square

24 April -> 04 May

'27metricubi' will be a 10-day public art residency featuring 5 local artists selected from an open call and working in a variety of media, from sculpture and performances to projection and installation.

The residency will take place in a steel cube installed in Granary Square, Kings Cross.

Take a look at the open call! ***IMPORTANT*** non-british artists ARE ACCEPTED, the perk description for the open call was a draft. 

The residency is part of a series of public art interventions that started in 2015 in Venice, and has involved more than 40 artists to date.27metricubi is a project by the AAAcollective, an art collective born in Venice in 2015, composed of 3 Italian artists based in London and Brussels: Patrick Gastaldon, Giammarco Cugusi, and Alessio Mazzaro.

27metricubi at the 17th edition of the Mediterranean young artist biennale, Milan, 2016.

 

Granary square, Kings Cross, London.

Kings Cross is a recently redeveloped neighborhood in central London that has gone through a massive change in its landscape and community. Thanks to the proximity of Central Saint Martins college of art we're able to extend our engagement to the wider community in a 10-day creative journey.

The first edition of the cube, Venice 2015

Taking the notion of dwelling, belonging and immigration as its starting point, the residency will experiment with art practices in the public realm establishing a dialogue with the community.

These practices span all art fields and will challenge and highlight the importance of actions of art in the public realm.

Inside the cube during an exhibition

 

Your contribution will help us face the cost of transportation of the cube, production of the event, and will also provide the participating artists with necessary funding.

Installing and artists of the first edition, Venice, 2015

 

What We Need & What You Get:

So this is where you come in….

Bringing the cube to London from Italy, and producing an art residency costs money. With your contribution, we will be able to cover transport and installation costs. Some funding will also be given to artists, for their own expenses. If we don’t reach our goal, the money raised will help to offset our costs.

In return for your generous contribution, we can offer you rewards that are made in line with the core of our project: participation. All the limited edition perks are to be made by artists selected during the 10 days of 27metricubi.

This means that a majority of our rewards will be created live. True limited editions created in front of one of the best art college in the world, Central Saint Martins, made by artists, fashion designers, photographers, and other creators. We will propose an evening event where art students from all around London are invited to unleash their creativity on some selected media, we will record the whole process so that when you receive your reward, you can see it come to life!

Your contribution is not only about funding, it will set in motion a series of events that will ultimately define your reward. Be ready for the unexpected

We will provide artists with the following media:

A 50cm x 50cm blank canvas Sample

4 Blank T-shirts (I mean, CSM ranks first in fashion! Bring it on!) Sample

And for a first time ever, a blank Framebook™ Sample

This is Framebook, just imagine it in the hands of an artist.

We already have our limited edition shopping bags, here is one!

The Impact:

A short quote on 27metricubi by London-based artist Richard Wentworth 

Granary square provides a unique opportunity for artists to experiment in a public space without restrictions. 27metricubi will allow the artists to realize ambitious new work and engage their practice in an environment where feedback is immediate and local visitors are invited to participate in the debate.

The show will be a mixture of emerging and established artists, rich in talent. The open call is available to artists in the London area and beyond, wishing to tackle the very much urgent topics of dwelling, belonging and immigration.

Artists and audience during the event in Padua, 2015

The cube:

The cube is a 3m x 3m x 3m CorTen steel structure made by the masterful Italian artisan Ernesto Sanguanini (a person made of pure generosity) in 2015. The floor is made of wooden panels.

The cube right before dismantling.

Main characteristics:

Weight: 900kg

Composed of: 12 X 3m *1,5m steel modules

The cube is ferromagnetic (we use powerful magnets to hang stuff) 

 

Costs breakdown:

We set a goal of 4000£ to be sure to raise the essential slice of our funding: transportation of the cube from Italy, it’s a long journey!

Here is the Costs breakdown:

Risks & Challenges:

Like all creative ventures, there are hurdles to overcome, some financial and some practical, but we’re committed to delivering a meaningful art project. The AAAcollective is dealing with scarce funds since it’s creation, but we did what seemed impossible dealing with one problem at a time we know no game stopper.

 

While we would like to provide artists with the right funding for this kind of initiative, first we need to make sure that the logistics needs of the projects are satisfied. This is our main goal, to bring the cube to London and to be able to offer it to artists to experiment with. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you like what we’re doing but are not able to contribute, you can still support us by spreading the word. Give us a shout out via social media and send this campaign to anyone you think would like our project.

If you think there’s another way you can help us with our project we’d love to hear from you. Don’t be shy.

See you in London!

story:
Stuccoettes are sculptures made from plaster that you hang on your wall. Stuccoettes come from Paul Griffin’s own unique designs and are made to the highest quality.

Paul has worked with plaster for over 20 years and from developing a keen interest in design during his primary degree in the University of Limerick. He has also completed various courses including sculpturing course in National College of Art and Design (NCAD) in Ireland and a mould making course in Italy. In the past, Paul and his team have completed commissioned work in some of Dublin’s most historical and iconic buildings and he has now decided to bring his own range of Plaster Sculptures called Stuccoettes.

 

Where did the name Stuccoette come from?

During the 18th and 19th century, Dublin was commonly regarded as the second city of the British Empire and during this period Dublin went through a golden age of fine building. Using hand modelling and mould making many of the ceilings and cornices in these prestigious buildings were decorated with beautiful Plaster Sculptures in-situ crafted by Stuccodores and a lot of the enrichments from this period would have “ette” at the end their name such as Flowerette and Rosette.

Paul and his team have worked on numerous buildings from this period including Trinity College Dublin and The National Art Gallery restoring some of this beautiful plasterwork.

Stuccoette combines “Stuccodore” and “Ette” showing respect to the past but also brings the plaster sculptures into the 21st century.

 

What are the Stuccoettes made from?

The Stuccoettes are made from a high quality casting plaster. Mesh is also added to strengthen the Stuccoettes.

 

What colour are the Stuccoettes?

The Stuccoettes are off white in colour which is the natural colour of the plaster. We put a coat of sealer to seal the Stuccoettes before they are shipped.

The Stuccoettes are beautiful in off white but they can also be painted to match the existing décor. However, we recommend that a professional carry’s out the painting. If you are an experienced painter then adding paint would give a nice personal touch to your Stuccoette.  

 

How are the Stuccoettes hung on the wall?

The hanging apparatus consists of two parts. The first part is embedded into the Stuccoette and the second is fixed to the wall. Once the second part is firmly fixed to the wall you just slide the first into it. Both the first and second part will be provided with the Stuccoette.

The hanging device leaves a space of 20mm (nearly an inch) between the wall and the Stuccoette all the way around.

 

Size of the sculptures

The Wave is 450mm X 450mm or 18 inches X 18 inches

Flow is 650mm X 450mm or 26 inches X 18 inches

Ripples is 450mm X 450mm or 18 inches X 18 inches

The Rose is 450mm X 450mm or 18 inches X 18 inches

Croagh Patrick is 650mm X 450mm or 26 inches X 18 inches

Busy is 650mm X 450mm or 26 inches X 18 inches

 

Where do we ship the Stuccoettes to and how much does shipping cost?

We ship to anywhere in the world and the cost of shipping is included in the price.

story:
Short Summary

Over the last 3 years a group of enthusiast cartoon makers have committed to create a musical cartoon - "Anban Huri", based on Hovhannes Tumanyan’s fairy tale.

Ավելի քան երեք տարի է, ինչ մի խումբ նվիրյալ մուլտիպլիկատորներ համախմբվել են՝ Հովհաննես Թումանյանի համանուն հեքիաթի հիման վրա «Անբան Հուռին» երաժշտական մուլտֆիլմը ստեղծելու համար:

The demo version of the cartoon now has more than 700,000 views on Youtube - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lAQlCypbM1A. Currently the devoted team is in an urgent need of financial means to finalize the 14 minutes cartoon. Besides the filmmakers, a group of musicians and composers work on this piece of art daily to provide the musical side of the cartoon. 

Այս պահին մուլտֆիլմի դեմո տարբերակն ունի ավելի քան 700,000 դիտում Youtube-ում  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lAQlCypbM1A: 14 րոպե տևողությամբ մուլտֆիլմը ավարտին հասցնելու համար նկարահանող խումբն ունի ֆինանսական աջակցության շտապ կարիք: Բացի մուլտիպլիկատորներից, աշխատանքներում ներգրավված են նաև մի խումբ երաժիշտներ և կոմպոզիտորներ:

WATCH A DEMO VERSION OF THE CARTOON BELOW AND THEN MEET THE TEAM



MEET OUR TEAM

Artur Mikaelyan is not only the brain and the moving power behind this project, but also an award winning animator in Armenia, who very soon, thanks to your support, will become a world known animator from Armenia.

Geghayr Khlghatyan, author of number of classic musical works who showed himself brightly in a new genre - where classical, folk, pop and national music have been mixed. Every time he listenes to the music of "Anban Huri", he askes very surprised if this is the music written by him :) So, he is also a funny guy. 

Igor Patrin works at the Institute of Theatre and Cinematography as a professor of the Department of Visual Arts and Animation. He has been actively involved in the creation process of many well-known and wonderful Armenian cartoons such as «Գտնված երազը», «Մկների ժողովը», etc. Now, with all his energy he transfers his valuable knowledge to a younger generation and works on  the "Anban Huri" cartoon for the Armenian and International audience. 
Lilia Hakobyan's  each day is full of colours - as working in the field of animation for the last 15 years she simply can not live without all those fantastic and colorful creations she draws daily!

Gayane Babayan, with 7 years experience in animation and cartoon industry adds flavor to the heroes of the cartoon and is capable to draw movements of any difficulty and present it in the cartoon. By the way Gayane is Artur's wife and they have a wonderful son. 
Arevik Avanesyan, after being introduced to the wonders of animation, she can't do stop working, drawing and bringing her background experience in dress modeling into the fascinating cartoon industry. 

Mariam Poghosyan graduated Yerevan State Academy of Fine Arts and is responsible for the creation of backgrounds in the "Anban Huri" cartoon. With a fascinating sense of beauty and kindness she works days and nights to deliver the best and the most accepted version for the cartoon. 

Zabel Babayan, or Belka as we call her, is the colorist of the whole project. Do you see the colors in Anban Huri? If you like those colours and want to watch the movie over and over again - blame it on Zabel and her professionalism!

Eka Horstka has graduated from Yerevan Komitas State Conservatory and has performed concerts in various countries. She has kindly agreed to play on behalf of Huri in the cartoon.
Astrid Eksuzyan's beautiful voice is the voice of Huri's mother. Just check the demo version and see how wonderful she sounds and how attracting Huri's mother sings about Huri! So this is all Astrid and only Astrid :)

Nvard Hovakimyan is performing at the Paronyan State Theatre and has graduated from the Yerevan Komitas State Conservatory. She exactly performed the role of the gossiping neighbor. 
Ani Adilkhanyan has graduated from the Yerevan Komitas State Conservatory and performs another neighbour in the cartoon. 

Arusyak Simonyan and Hasmik Arakelyan are the authors of the texts in this cartoon heroes sing. They have inspired even the small beetle to speak and sing with a very sweet voice. 


DID YOU LIKE OUR TEAM? AREN'T WE WONDERFUL? 

Our team was successful in creating the "Drunk Hens" (Հարբած հավերը - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wlwe0SUPg6w) cartoon, which became kids' favorite and received around 800,000 hits on Youtube.  The "Drunk Hens" cartoon  received also Robert Sahakyants first prize for the best animation movie at the YES EM Festival in in 2008.

Being a new word in the Armenian cartoon industry -  "Anban Huri" will become Armenian kids' favorite, introducing them to the Armenian culture and Literature.

Not less important is the future of this cartoon as it will be presented at various international film festivals and competitions. 
We are sure that after it's release "Anban Huri" will receive a number of local, regional and international prizes - presenting Armenian cartoon industry at it's best.

What We Need & What You Get

Our detailed budget is available in the gallery of the campaign and you will get all the benefits if choosing any of the perks presented on the right side of this page.
All the exciting perks are carefully crafted for you and only you. 
THE PLOT
We have prepared a surprise for all those interested parties who have ever thought about the positive impact of this cartoon in terms of educating younger generation. Without editing Tumanyan's scenario - the ending of the movie will surprise you greatly and will have a very positive impact to the minds and the behavior of your children.

    The Impact

    By finalizing this cartoon.

    ·  Cartoon industry in Armenia will flourish

    ·  Armenian children will have better opportunities to find relevant items on Youtube

    ·  Cartoon industry will be able to turn to self-sustaining business

    ·  Children in Armenia and Diaspora and even beyond will be introduced to Armenian Literature through Tumanyan and the culture of cartoons.

    ·  The cartoon is based on the International standards and current cinematography trends that will develop a culture of cartoon-shooting in Armenia.

    ·  Will cultivate searching and watching Armenian cartoons on Youtube.

    ·  Armenian cartoon makers will have better chances to be visible at the world cartoon industry.

    ·  This cartoon will participate in international cartoon festivals, thus becoming a popular Armenian endeavor.

    Sustainability

    By supporting the "Anban Huri" cartoon, you directly contribute to the advancement of animators team who meet the international standards and will soon be able to establish a self sustainable studio and a brand, thus fostering cartoon industry in Armenia and beyond.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      You are still beloved friend of ours and a extraordinary active citizen even without contributing, because it is equally important also to spread a word about this campaign among your peers via social networks, email lists and real life coffee break, lunch and dinner.

urgent need of financial means to finalize the 14 minutes cartoon. Besides the filmmakers, a group of musicians and composers work on this piece of art daily to provide the musical side of the cartoon. 

Այս պահին մուլտֆիլմի
դեմո տարբերակն ունի ավելի քան 700,000 դիտում Youtube-ում  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lAQlCypbM1A: 14 րոպե տևողությամբ մուլտֆիլմը ավարտին հասցնելու համար նկարահանող խումբն ունի ֆինանսական աջակցության շտապ կարիք: Բացի մուլտիպլիկատորներից, աշխատանքներում
ներգրավված են նաև մի խումբ երաժիշտներ և կոմպոզիտորներ:
WATCH A DEMO VERSION OF THE CARTOON BELOW AND THEN MEET THE TEAM


MEET OUR TEAM




Artur Mikaelyan is not only the brain and the moving power behind this project, but also an award winning animator in Armenia, who very soon, thanks to your support, will become a world known animator from Armenia.
Geghayr Khlghatyan, author of number of classic musical works who showed himself brightly in a new genre - where classical, folk, pop and national music have been mixed. Every time he listenes to the music of "Anban Huri", he askes very surprised if this is the music written by him :) So, he is also a funny guy. 


Igor Patrin works at the Institute of Theatre and Cinematography as a professor of the Department of Visual Arts and Animation. He has been actively involved in the creation process of many well-known and wonderful Armenian cartoons such as «Գտնված երազը», «Մկների ժողովը», etc. Now, with all his energy he transfers his valuable knowledge to a younger generation and works on  the "Anban Huri" cartoon for the Armenian and International audience. 

Lilia Hakobyan's  each day is full of colours - as working in the field of animation for the last 15 years she simply can not live without all those fantastic and colorful creations she draws daily!

Gayane Babayan, with 7 years experience in animation and cartoon industry adds flavor to the heroes of the cartoon and is capable to draw movements of any difficulty and present it in the cartoon. By the way Gayane is Artur's wife and they have a wonderful son. 

Arevik Avanesyan, after being introduced to the wonders of animation, she can't do stop working, drawing and bringing her background experience in dress modeling into the fascinating cartoon industry. 

Mariam Poghosyan graduated Yerevan State Academy of Fine Arts and is responsible for the creation of backgrounds in the "Anban Huri" cartoon. With a fascinating sense of beauty and kindness she works days and nights to deliver the best and the most accepted version for the cartoon. 
Zabel Babayan, or Belka as we call her, is the colorist of the whole project. Do you see the colors in Anban Huri? If you like those colours and want to watch the movie over and over again - blame it on Zabel and her professionalism!

Eka Horstka has graduated from Yerevan Komitas State Conservatory and has performed concerts in various countries. She has kindly agreed to play on behalf of Huri in the cartoon.

Astrid Eksuzyan's beautiful voice is the voice of Huri's mother. Just check the demo version and see how wonderful she sounds and how attracting Huri's mother sings about Huri! So this is all Astrid and only Astrid :)

Nvard Hovakimyan is performing at the Paronyan State Theatre and has graduated from the Yerevan Komitas State Conservatory. She exactly performed the role of the gossiping neighbor. 

Ani Adilkhanyan has graduated from the Yerevan Komitas State Conservatory and performs another neighbour in the cartoon. 



Arusyak Simonyan and Hasmik Arakelyan are the authors of the texts in this cartoon heroes sing. They have inspired even the small beetle to speak and sing with a very sweet voice. 




DID YOU LIKE OUR TEAM? AREN'T WE WONDERFUL? 
Our team was successful in creating the "Drunk Hens" (Հարբած հավերը - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wlwe0SUPg6w) cartoon, which became kids' favorite and received around 800,000 hits on Youtube.  The "Drunk Hens" cartoon  received also Robert Sahakyants first prize for the best animation movie at the YES EM Festival in in 2008.
Being a new word in the Armenian cartoon industry -  "Anban Huri" will become Armenian kids' favorite, introducing them to the Armenian culture and Literature.

Not less important is the future of this cartoon as it will be presented at various international film festivals and competitions. 

We are sure that after it's release "Anban Huri" will receive a number of local, regional and international prizes - presenting Armenian cartoon industry at it's best.   What We Need & What You Get
Our detailed budget is available in the gallery of the campaign and you will get all the benefits if choosing any of the perks presented on the right side of this page. All the exciting perks are carefully crafted for you and only you. 
THE PLOT
We have prepared a surprise for all those interested parties who have ever thought about the positive impact of this cartoon in terms of educating younger generation. Without editing Tumanyan's scenario - the ending of the movie will surprise you greatly and will have a very positive impact to the minds and the behavior of your children.

  The Impact 
By finalizing this cartoon.
· 
Cartoon industry in Armenia
will flourish
· 
Armenian children will have
better opportunities to find relevant items on Youtube
· 
Cartoon industry will be
able to turn to self-sustaining business
· 
Children in Armenia and
Diaspora and even beyond will be introduced to Armenian Literature through
Tumanyan and the culture of cartoons.
·  The cartoon is based on the International standards and current cinematography trends that will develop a culture of cartoon-shooting in Armenia.
· 
Will cultivate searching and watching
Armenian cartoons on Youtube. 
· 
Armenian cartoon makers will have better chances to be visible at the world cartoon industry.
· 
This cartoon will participate in
international cartoon festivals, thus becoming a popular Armenian endeavor.
Sustainability
By supporting the "Anban Huri" cartoon, you directly contribute to the advancement of animators team who meet the international standards and will soon be able to establish a self sustainable studio and a brand, thus fostering cartoon industry in Armenia and beyond.
  Other Ways You Can Help
You are still beloved friend of ours and a extraordinary active citizen even without contributing, because it is equally important also to spread a word about this campaign among your peers via social networks, email lists and real life coffee break, lunch and dinner.

story:
• Madryn Puerto de RISA es una asociación cultural, cuya principal misión es sacar adelante este hermoso Festival cada año. 
  • RISA FEST es un sueño que ya hicimos realidad en 2017, y donde juntamos 15.000 espectadores.
  • Colaborar con este proyecto es ayudar a que muchos Artistas de primer nivel vengan a la Patagonia a traer risas y aplausos para todos y todas. 
  • Esta campaña es importantísima para el Festival. Con este dinero se cubrirá parte de los gastos de merchandising e incontables aspectos de gestión. Tu aporte es básico para nosotros. Lo único que nos metemos en el bolsillo los organizadores es  satisfacción.  Este es un proyecto hecho con amor y con nada más. Sumate! 
  • Si no puedes colaborar con dinero, te entendemos perfectamente. No sabes cuanto! Puedes ayudarnos mucho difundiendo esta campaña en las redes sociales.
story_txt:
Madryn Puerto de RISA es una asociación cultural, cuya principal misión es sacar adelante este hermoso Festival cada año. 

RISA FEST es un sueño que ya hicimos realidad en 2017, y donde juntamos 15.000 espectadores.
Colaborar con este proyecto es ayudar a que muchos Artistas de primer nivel vengan a la Patagonia a traer risas y aplausos para todos y todas. 


Esta campaña es importantísima para el Festival. Con este dinero se cubrirá parte de los gastos de merchandising e incontables aspectos de gestión. Tu aporte es básico para nosotros. Lo único que nos metemos en el bolsillo los organizadores es  satisfacción.  Este es un proyecto hecho con amor y con nada más. Sumate! 
Si no puedes colaborar con dinero, te entendemos perfectamente. No sabes cuanto! Puedes ayudarnos mucho difundiendo esta campaña en las redes sociales.

story:
Campaign Summary

In the summer of 2016 I traveled to Svalbard to take part in the Arctic Circle Artists' Residency. Along with 25 other artists, writers and musicians I sailed on board the barquentine Antigua around the archipelago, eventually making it to the pack ice at 81º 08.3563 north of the equator.

While in the Arctic I took thousands of photographs, and began to develop ideas for art projects. In the Soviet ghost town of Pyramiden I was struck by the sea blue interior paint, peeling in many places to reveal island-like clusters of the white primer beneath. Fascinated, but not knowing what I would do with them, I took dozens of photos. Upon my return I made 100 drawings of these "arctic maps," as though to map their territory.

As I began making the drawings I realised I wanted to produce a limited edition book -- an absurd guide or atlas collecting all 100 drawings. I am appealing to supporters and contributors to help make this possible.

I have researched several printing options, including the mock-up version seen in the images here, and have discovered that I can make a short run of 25-100 high quality books -- with cloth covers, cloth taped spines, embossed foil title, heavy weight paper stock, and colored endpapers -- through Bookmobile in Minneapolis. While it will cost more than the pictured mock-up version, the difference in quality will be worth it.

You can see samples of Bookmobile's short-run work here:
http://www.bookmobile.com/art-book-printing/sho...

The cost per book varies depending on the number of books I print, so this campaign is also a way to ascertain interest and determine the length of the run.

What I Need
In order to go forward with this project I need to raise between $1000-$2000. The more I raise the more copies I will produce. If I can print enough I will have copies to distribute to art libraries and bookstores beyond the online sales.

What You Get
By supporting my campaign you will pre-order a copy of the book at cost. I will send you a signed, personalised, numbered copy as soon as it is done.

If you support the campaign at a higher level you will receive perks of art -- also equal in value to the amount you contribute. (Perks are visible in the gallery section here). 

How You Can Help
If you are unable to buy the book, you can still help by spreading the word, donating, or purchasing a less expensive perk.

story:
Short Summary

Creative Rebellion Youth Studios is a 24/7 artist hub.

What We Need & What You Get

Short $8,000 to start construction. 

Contribute and get a copy of 'Dear Child' or a workshop/performance poetry.

The Impact

Giving young minds options to collaborate without the limitations, hence it's a 24/7 artist hub.

Address: 127b Campbell Street, Collingwood. Feel free to drop by.

story:
Introducing... THE MOXYPACK!

Greetings! For those of you who don't know me, I am Moxy, a NSFW artist who specializes in busty, buff, and (especially in this pack) hung females, many of which are featured in this project. This "MoxyPack" offers a glimpse into the inner workings of MoxyDoxy LLC by introducing some of the people behind the scenes of the company.

Why... THE MOXYPACK?

Admittedly, artistic endeavors are time consuming risks. The MoxyPack is a project that's expanded in scope and finishing it will take a lot of hours. With your help, I can keep the lights on while I work to complete this art pack. Your help enables me to make the best art I possibly can, and hopefully it is worthy of your generosity.

What is... THE MOXYPACK?

The MoxyPack is a very large art pack that will feature 10 different characters in the Moxyverse. There will be plenty of jiggly bits, futa, and naughtiness. It will include:

  • Model sheets of every character: Front & Back/Clothed & Nude (40 pics)
  • Pinup and profile of every character (10 pics)
  • Fun and "fun" scenes of various characters (9 pics)
  • Animations of characters interacting with one another (5 clips)
  • Backer sketches (??? pics)
This is a lot of content, and will take me at least 300 hours to finish, probably more. I will be spreading this work out over the next 4 and a half months.

I can't afford to pledge to... THE MOXYPACK.

It's okay. The MoxyPack will be available on Sellfy for retail starting December 15th. In the meantime, please share this project with everyone!

REST ASSURED, I WILL DELIVER. If not, you will be refunded 100%.

Stretch goals:

$3000: 3D Sculpts of each character.

story:
B*tch Fest is a collaborative vision for an annual exhibition of female art conceived by Terri Lloyd and Monica Marsh, founders of The Haggus Society.

During a conversation last year (2010), Monica and Terri came to the realization that older women are invisible in society, but more specifically in the arts. Even a television show makes reference to the invisibility of people over 40. 

Monica and Terri have discussed and surveyed the issues that postpone or delay women's art careers. There were also the issues of ageism in a youth oriented society (and industry), and the idea that art by women must fit a hygienic mold. Along with these challenges is that there is little to no institutional support for the older female artist.

We seek to change that and the language of the landscape.

Not everyone has a linear art career trajectory. Life happens. Right?

Many women are re-igniting their careers during these highly inflammatory and changing times, and yet we remain under-served.

We have become invisible regardless of our exceptional talent.

We want something, someplace specifically for women like us– multifaceted older women who play hard and work hard; women who are activists, thinkers, and (creative) risk takers; women who get it --AND get what we’re about.

We continue to connect daily with older female artists who push the envelope, don’t conform to polite society or social norms. Women who refuse to compromise, who refuse to compete, and dare to do things their own way.

Our message is resonating with women, young and old, well behaved and not so well behaved.  

B*tch Fest is for artists (30-ish and older) who share a vision of empowerment through the arts by challenging social perceptions about age and gender.

Help give voice to a vibrant demographic that is being ignored.

We are not invisible.

First Annual B*tch Fest March 2012

Pop Up Juried Exhibition 3 days (second weekend, dovetailing with NELAA* art walk) during Women’s History Month.

Location Los Angeles, California USA

Local and national call for art November 1, 2011

http:/www.thehaggussociety.org

*Northeast Los Angeles Art, http://www.nelaart.com/

story:
the story

â€œAmazement awaits us at every cornerâ€ (James Broughton)



      Everyone has a story to tellâ€¦

There are many ways to tell a story....

      Be part of it and help us tell ours!




............................................................................

â€žWonderous Stories - from Xenophobia to Amazementâ€ 

was created for bringing a better understanding on Xenophobia in everyday life.


This project aims at bringing young people together to tell stories beyond formalized techniques, by using Media and Performance Arts as means of expression, with a focus on social and cultural aspects.


We chose to work with Xenophobia because we believe that every one of us experiences it, in one way or another. When we face something new or strange, there is a moment of choice: 

to be amazed or to be fearful...


We want to explore the paths and subtilities that lead to this moment of choice.

We believe that Stories help shape Cultures and the interaction between cultures can create a broad spectrum of experiences, from xenophobia to amazement. This perspective gave us the motivation to reinvest stories with meaning as to deliver a powerful message, where this has been lost through formalized techniques.

 

Together with Olde Vechte Foundation, a non-profit, non-governamental organization in the Netherlands, and 8 International Partners from cultural and art organizations established in Lithuania, France, Denmark, Romania, Slovakia, Greece, Hungary, Ireland and the Netherlands, we will gather 45 young talented people to work with the theme of Xenophobia, by communicating ideas and feelings unpretentiously through storytelling and live performances. 




..................................................................................

the mission

We do not aim at fighting Xenophobia! The first contact with a different culture and behavior of a person is one of the  most distinctive moments of experience and it creates an emotion (energy in motion). The energy is already there, so we are not focusing on fighting it but rather understanding it and giving it a new meaning!


Our mission is to stimulate an intercultural dialogue and to challenge mutual learning, by creating awereness on xenophobia and the exclusion effect it can have in a society and by encouraging the use of universal language of images and sounds, that is a language close to everybody, regardless of education, race, ethnicity, religion etc.


The participants of this project will spend together 15 days in Ommen, the Netherlands, in February 2012, working with concepts like Xenophobia and Amazement, using media (video and photography) and performance arts (dance, theater, music)

The final Outcome of the project will consist of 2 performances in the Netherlands, one in Ommen and one in another city in the Netherlands, which will be live streamed on the internet. 

Once arrived back home, the participants will organize an International Video Production. A series of DVDs and prints will be designed and distributed across Europe with content related to the exchange and the performances presented.

................................................................................




what we need & what you get!


The project has a Basic Fund that can support us in realizing it. We still find ourselves in need for the amount of  5000$ in order to ensure the artistic quality of the project. We have invited Experts that will support the young artists during the for Workshop and Production days that will lead to the Performances.


We have invited experts from the team of choreographers of Random Collision (NL), the Media Specialist Kriszta Zsiday (HU) and the Media Educator & Youth worker Sofia Moudiou (GR).  A team of music composers from CodArts University (NL) will also join for the Production & Performance days. But in order to financially support them, 

we need your contribution!


Evidently, thereâ€™s a return-of-investment for your contribution measured in eternal gratitude and valuable â€žgoodiesâ€.

Hereâ€™s what you get in return:

_Get in the Hall of Fame!

_Supporter's pack!

_Wall Art!

_Wonder2stories Art!

_Perspective T-shirts LIMITED!

_The "Making of" EXTENDED!

_Xenophobia to Amazement Pack!

_Wonderous Box!

...............................................................................................

Other ways to support

You can still support us by pushing Like in our Facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/wonder2stories 

Visit our new Blog: http://wonder2stories.com/

Spread the news about Wonderous Stories and ask other people to join and support us.

If you have an inspiring story related to the subject, please send us an email (wonder2stories@gmail.com)  to share it with us and inspire us in this way to make art.

we need your
contribution! 

Evidently,
thereâ€™s a return-of-investment for your contribution measured in eternal
gratitude and valuable â€žgoodiesâ€.

_Get in the Hall of Fame!

_Wall Art!
_Wonder2stories Art!
_Perspective T-shirts LIMITED!
_The "Making of" EXTENDED!
_Xenophobia to Amazement Pack!
_Wonderous Box!
...............................................................................................





Other ways to support



You can still support us by pushing Like in our Facebook page: 
https://www.facebook.com/wonder2stories 
Visit our new Blog: http://wonder2stories.com/
Spread the news about Wonderous Stories and ask other people to join and support us.
If you have an inspiring story related to the subject, please send us an email (wonder2stories@gmail.com)  to share it with us and inspire us in this way to make art.

story:
My name is Sophie Engel, I am a final year film student at Queen Mary, University of London and I have been freelancing as a photographer for over a year. This December, I have been given the opportunity to exhibit my photos in a gallery near the famous Columbia Road Flower Market in London. The exhibition is entitled ‘Colours of London’ and through it I hope to share some of the beauty of this town as I have tried to capture it in my photographs.

These are exciting times for me, and this campaign is for the simple purpose of enabling me to print and frame my photos in order to hang them up in the gallery. I am not seeking to make any profit out of this; but since I cannot forecast the success of the exhibition, I need funds that will allow me to go ahead with it and fill the space in the gallery with as many colourful photos as I can.

 

What I need:

  • I need $350 (£215) to buy plain, black frames of different sizes for my pictures. Even though I have chosen to use IKEA’s basic RIBBA series, the prices begin to add up when multiplied by the 21 photos I am hoping to exhibit.

  • I need $300 (£180) for the prints. ASDA is my friend, but the 40x50cm prints push the price up.

I will put up as many pictures as I can afford by the end of the campaign. My goal of 21 will give the exhibition a nice balance of colour, black and white, and sepia; noisy streets and calm alleys; tourist attractions and places even Londoners haven’t been to... Have a look at the photos I chose for the exhibition in the ‘gallery’ folder at the top of this page.

 

I take pictures because I believe that they can change the way we perceive the world in a positive way. I believe that photos can draw our attention to details and things of beauty that we weren’t aware of before and which, when noticed, affect us and our understanding of our surroundings. I want to invite you to be part of this by helping me to transform the pictures for my exhibition into a physical reality and as a token of my genuine gratitude I would love to send you some postcard prints of my photography.

 

Last but not least:
If you like my photos, please let others know!

Even if you can’t contribute here, please do spread the word about my photography (www.sophieengel.com), the exhibition at Shipton Street Gallery throughout December 2012 and the need for funding via this website (www.indiegogo.com/sophieengel).

 

Thank you so much for your time and support-- I appreciate it a lot! If you have any thoughts or questions, do get in touch; and I’d be delighted to welcome you at my exhibition!

story:
Let me introduce myself....

I was born and raised in California and have seen so much change to the amazing and diverse ecosystem so many call home. I studied biology, have a masters in art and have been involved in robotics for five years. This project combines my education, interests and passion into one kinetic, educational art piece.

Project Overview:

TE+ND (Terrestrial Exploration + Nurture Designed) Rovers are an interactive art project that explores migratory ecology in an era of climate change. The rovers are robotic fostering environments that care for their own garden of native California plants by interacting with participants and actively seeking out light and water. Each rover is two feet wide by three feet tall and has a hydroponic growing station on top of a mechanically walking base. The hydroponic growing station is made of ceramic material and has been designed to retain the right amount of moisture for root survival. The goal of the project is to illustrate the plight of California’s native habitats, to disperse native plants in a new way, to encourage the general public to participate in conservation and to think about what is ‘native.’ 

The rovers encourage the audience to assist the rovers by providing light, watering plants and helping the rovers to acquire the resources they need to keep their garden healthy. Because the robots navigate using obstacle avoidance technology, bystanders can “herd” them by standing in their way to cause them to move in a particular direction, and thereby encourage them to travel towards resources beyond the range of the robots’ sensors. In an urban setting, rovers will find water in sprinkler systems, drip irrigation, rain, fog, and from participants. In helping the rovers, participants learn about cultivating native California habitat and stretch the limits of human-robotic empathy and engagement.

TE+ND Rovers, designed after space exploration vehicles, are intended to investigate a range of environments, from cityscapes to less urban locales. Primary locations for the first stage of deployment include Golden Gate Park, Mt. Diablo State Park, The Conservatory of Flowers and The Exploratorium.

When will they be built? How and where?

The Rovers will be built during an artist residency at the Exploratorium, a San Francisco interactive museum of art, science and perception, during the month of June 2012. My team and I will work closely with Exploratorium engineers and staff in the final build stages and the first deployment of the TE+ND Rovers. The Exploratorium will provide fabrication equipment and knowledgeable staff to help with construction and logistics. As an interactive museum, The Exploratorium provides an ideal first deployment site. The residency comes with a grant from the James Irvine Foundation but your contributions are needed to enable us to complete the project.

Who can be a participant?

Anyone! The Rovers are part of an interactive project intended for all ages. The TE+ND Rover project audience include anyone who encounters Rovers at a deployment site, including adults and children. Participants will be pedestrians, passers-by, hikers, bikers, joggers, picnickers, children at play, students and anyone who is curious.

The Rovers will also be used in schools and educational environments, helping students to explore ecology, biodiversity, evolution and plant biology. Students will learn about habitat encroachment and endangered species on the move, looking for habitat in which they can thrive. For deployments at schools, lesson plans from the TE+ND program will include handouts and guided discussions, encouraging students to observe, record what they find and to form conclusions about their experience.

This sounds expensive! 

And it is! The wonderful part is that it's already half-funded by a grant from the James Irvine Foundation. The grant goes mostly to the Exploratorium for fabrication costs and being fabulous hosts. What we need to cover are the brains (Linux based ARM platform), eyes (optical sensors for the rovers to find water and avoid obstacles, ears (sonar for secondary obstacle avoidance systems), muscles (motors, gears, drive train to move the legs), food (batteries/solar panels and charger), bones (aluminum, Delrin, ABS spools), plants, ceramic materials and firing fees. All labor and R&D is volunteer. We just need to afford the stuff to build them!

Other Ways You Can Help

There are other ways to help out too. If you are interested in this project but are short on funds, don't worry! The Rovers can still use your help. Tell your friends, family, neighbors, students, drinking buddies, and co-workers about the project and make some noise!

campaign_city: San Francisco Bay Area, United States

story:
The Story

My name is Britt Greenwood, and I am the founder of Tulsa Art Spot, http://www.tulsaartspot.com/ .  Tulsa Art Spot is Tulsa's only active art blog/website.  The site provides 100% FREE promotion for Tulsa area artists - visual and performing. In addition, Tulsa Art Spot also promotes local arts organizations as well.  It is my goal, through the website, to help up-and-coming artists recieve exposure and find opportunities while celebrating established artists as well.  

 

In addition to being the founder and adminstrator to Tulsa Art Spot and an artist myself, I am an Arts Advocacy Captain with Oklahomans for the Arts.  Being an Arts Advocacy Captain, (which is a volunteer position), for Tulsa, Creek, Osage, Rogers and Wagoner County means I am fighting for state, federal and private funding for art organizations which have lost over one million in revenue in the last 3 years; simaltaneously, I am creating a grassroots movement to engage citizens in art advocacy. 

 

I work many unpaid hours to help artists and art organizations because it is my passion.  I enjoy every moment of it and will not allow financial restraits to stop me.  This is why I need your help.

 

The Impact

Tulsa Art Spot will be:

1.  A resource for local area artists with marketing, advertising, tips, etc.

2.  A personal approach to journalism when interviewing artists and events at the location and in the studios

3.  Free publicity for organizations and venues holding art events

4.  A place people seek to find an artists through the online gallery and articles for commissions, projects, etc.

5.  A place people seek for local art events and articles of venues, organziations and events

6.  Bring awareness of Tulsa's thriving arts community

7.  A hub for arts advocacy awareness and advocacy opportunities

 

If the monetary goal is not met, it will mean missing out on art events and art interviews, which are the heart of the website/blog. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am willing to put in the unpaid hours of work and some financial burdern, but I am faced with costs that I frankly can not afford.  I am looking to fund Tulsa Art Spot for only 1 year. 

 

In order to attend 2 to 3 interviews, events or meetings a week, it will cost me at least $30 p/week in fuel.  Additionally, there are events which are not child friendly, and as the mother of two pre-schoolers would require child care and free sitters are not always available.  As in everything, there are miscellaneous fees and costs I will encounter.

 

Here, I have broke down the cost:

 

$30 per week in gas/$120 per month = $1,440 per year

Around 2-3 babysitters per month $80 =  $960 per year

Misc. costs: parking, cover charges, promotional material, website maintenance $50 per month= $600 per year

 

Total= $3000.00


If the goal is not met, I will still attempt to do my best reporting and service to the Tulsa Arts but will be unable to make the impact many artists and organizations need. 

 

If the goal is exceeded, excess funds will go either to a Tulsa Art Spot art event, promotional costs or saved for 2013 expenses. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share through email or social networking on Twitter, Facebook, etc.!    Accepting corporate sponsorship as well!  Please share with your employeer.  Corporate sponsorships of $500 or more will have their logo posted on the website's home page.  Less than $500 will be mentioned on the Sponsorship page

story:
Short Summary

An image can show the power and nuances of who you are, and your experiences, if you are given the right tools to build it.

Wouldn't it be empowering to strengthen those image-making skills in the Arab and Muslim youth community?  Wouldn't it be possible by linking youth who may not have access to those tools with artists who use those skills all the time?

The Arab and Muslim community suffers from stereotyping; and part of the solution is to show- not only to tell-  who we are through the arts.

As an Egyptian American artist and arts educator, I know art can connect people by creating a space for their true voices. I've seen it happen in arts workshops I've facilitated for kids in underserved (labelled "failing") NYC public schools; refugee camps abroad; and summer arts programs.

I created RASMI (Arabic for my drawing/official) to provide a stimulating, structured, and free studio program where youth can create their own self portraits of identity through paint. We will look at art from the Arab and Muslim world and its diasporas- from the streets to the museums- for inspiration. And we will end with a public exhibition in a local gallery.

The four week program will be hosted at the Arab American Association in Brooklyn and has been partly funded by the Brooklyn Arts Council. 

RASMI is a response to the lack of culturally relevant programming in classrooms about immigrant experience; a media saturated with stereotypes; and no clear network of artists who work with these local diaspora and immigrant communities. 

RASMI would not be possible without the seed of an idea, and all the visionaries who help make it grow. So please be part of our network. Donate any amount and/or spread the word. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

RASMI has received $2700 from the Brooklyn Arts Council. We are seeking $900 more. This sum will round out our costs for a 5 day/week, 4 week studio program that is free for participants.  So your donations go towards: art supplies, printing costs for publicity, exhibition space rental, and teacher pay.

...And of course.. the perks!

10 or more gets you a special shout out ! in our exhibition program

40 or more gets you a high rez color RASMI poster plus a shout out !

200 or more gets you a color print of original artwork by K. Toukhy plus a shout out ! Only 4 of these prints are available.

The Impact

With your contributions to RASMI, you're not only providing exciting arts programming to Brooklyn youth, but you are also building a creative dialog among the many ethnic and immigrant communities that exist in this great diverse borough.  Our exhibition is open to the public. We want to provide a space for others to commune with the creative voices of Arab and Muslim youth. Our label for "American" is constantly shifting; and art helps us recreate all its meanings.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Post our campaign link to your facebook, twitter, or other social media networks
  • Tell folks you know, spread the word!
  • Subscribe to our blog: rasmibrooklyn.blogspot.com
  • Be a guest at our final exhibit in August (subscribe to our blog stay tuned in to updates!)
  • For more information, flyers to pass out, etc contact me: kt@katherinetoukhy.com

story:
Short Summary

In my various artistic explorations, I discovered Lumia as an art medium whose presence bespoke of a visceral light that created light images of a very evocative and narrative form. These visuals became a window to a fantastical vista of creatures, landscapes and abstract places whose spaces begged to be visited.

To share this magical light form, I have photographed a stunning collection of Lumia imagery that present a series of compelling Rorschach visuals whose lush metaphorical expression offers the beauty of refracted light as its own art form. The Lumia images will be publishd in a book known as Sacred Destinations and Jouneys Along The Way.

Although discovered in the 1920s, Lumia has, for the most part has been a lost art form, always in the shadow of other more powerful media formats. That shadow is fading and it is time for Lumia to once again grace the walls of art galleries, video screens and the printed page.

        SOULS ASCENDING HEAVEN

       a page from book

This book, Sacred Destinations is an effort to share Lumia with a new generation of art aficionados to appreciate a rare look at light as an ethereal sculptured medium that disappears after the fact. Once photographed it is gone forever. As for the Lumias, gaze once, gaze twice, the Lumia images are never the same with each new look.

         SACRED REALM

         a page from book

 

                           

What We Need & What You Get

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

We are trying to raise $40,000.00 of which your financial contribution will go towards the publishing of the book's first edition print run, to cover its printing and marketing costs. For those who have already seen the book's Lumia imagery from the book-in-development, or its web site (www.sacredlumia.com) there has always been an identical reaction: everybody wants a book. And we aim to please. Our goal is to create a funding campaign to allow a continuous printing of the book for everyone who wants a copy. More donations = more books = more contact with Lumia as a compelling visual art form.

                   HEIRONYMOUS HOMAGE

                  

PERKS

As a gift for donating to this book project, all contributors will receive a Lumia picture in some form, for small donations; a gift card, or a boxed set of Lumia gift cards. Larger donations will be rewarded with Lumia prints and of course for high level donators - a signed copy of the book. And for the lucky contributors who donate at the maximum requested contribution level; a live Lumia recital by appointment. Contribute to publishing this book and you to can own a piece of the light.

                  GUARDIAN OF THE REALM

                 

The Impact

SACRED DESTINATIONS: BEHIND THE CURTAIN

The Blog

an ongoing blog will detail Sacred Destinations pre-production activity and follow the suspense of the Indie GoGO fund raising campaign and its continuation to the book printer for its first edition publishing run.

To get behind the Lumia curtain:

http://www.mediamachinations.com/sacreddestinat...

The Web Site

The book's web site (www.sacredlumia.com) also gives readers a greater familiarity with the author's passion for Lumia art. Here the web site allows Lumia fans to learn more about the book, through the Lumia Mystique section, a segment of the web site that describes the author's early Lumia experiments; his discovery of an illuminated multi-dimensional gateway and what happened when his first Lumia device blew up and caught fire in front of him during its initial testing phase.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have friends that like visionary art, please share this Indie GoGo campaign with them so they may know of the book's forthcoming publication.

         A BUSY DAY IN HEAVEN

 

LOST ART RETURNS

Helping to fund this book publishing campaign will bring Lumia back to life as a resurrected art medium.

                      Lumia is a playground for the mind.

                                       come enjoy it.

As a gift for donating to this book project, all contributors will receive a Lumia picture in some form, for small donations; a gift card, or a boxed set of Lumia gift cards. Larger donations will be rewarded with Lumia prints and of course for high level donators - a signed copy of the book. And for the lucky contributors who donate at the maximum requested contribution level; a live Lumia recital by appointment. Contribute to publishing this book and you to can own a piece of the light.
                  GUARDIAN OF THE REALM
                  


The Impact
SACRED DESTINATIONS: BEHIND THE CURTAIN
The Blog
an ongoing blog will detail Sacred Destinations pre-production activity and follow the suspense of the Indie GoGO fund raising campaign and its continuation to the book printer for its first edition publishing run.
To get behind the Lumia curtain:
http://www.mediamachinations.com/sacreddestinat...
The Web Site
The book's web site (www.sacredlumia.com) also gives readers a greater familiarity with the author's passion for Lumia art. Here the web site allows Lumia fans to learn more about the book, through the Lumia Mystique section, a segment of the web site that describes the author's early Lumia experiments; his discovery of an illuminated multi-dimensional gateway and what happened when his first Lumia device blew up and caught fire in front of him during its initial testing phase.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you have friends that like visionary art, please share this Indie GoGo campaign with them so they may know of the book's forthcoming publication.
         A BUSY DAY IN HEAVEN
 
LOST ART RETURNS
Helping to fund this book publishing campaign will bring Lumia back to life as a resurrected art medium.
                      Lumia is a playground for the mind.
                                       come enjoy it.

story:
The Filmmakers

Emancipation is the brainchild of a young group of modern culture warriors, a hybrid of artists and modern day abolitionists.

Devin Hume directs a cast and crew of Colroado's finest actors and filmmakers interpreting a story by modern day abolitionist, Gualberto Garcia Jones.

The Story

"Emancipation" is a story about friendship, sacrifice, and the intrinsic dignity of all people.

In the early 1860’s, Colorado was deeply divided across economic and social strata and people were enslaved not just because of their race. Our story is set in the very beginnings of the Gold Rush.  Small mining towns sprung up and started swelling. They were magnets for corrupt or violent fortune hunters from all walks of life that took advantage of ordinary people.  A tiny minority of the settlers were women; mining was men's work, so women were often left widowed, abandoned, abused or enslaved.  There was also a great deal of racial tension surrounding territorial disputes between recently settled Mexicans, local Indian tribes and white prospectors and ranchers.  

The difficult circumstances of the times afforded the perfect setting to explore what brings people down or raises them up when they are in trouble. In our story a bad situation builds till it bursts like an abscess. A split-second decision determines the outcome of our hero's life.  It is an uplifting story with a golden ending because the three friends ultimately choose life, at great cost.

Why should you invest in our little film?

Independent film is a difficult venture and those of us who know this project are witnesses to the dedication and sacrifice made by everyone involved.

Independent films rely on the good will and support of our friends and extended family.  We want to make the films that we want to see. We want to make films that promote our values and that serve as incubators for young talent in the film industry.

Most of all we want to make films that make people think without being didactic.  Likely this is why you are considering a donation to "Emancipation."

What We Need & What You Get

We will be shooting this fim in an old Western town located outside of Santa Fe, New Mexico.  John Wayne shot several films at this location and while it is a dream come true for art direction, including original period buildings, it will drive the cost of our production above what we have already raised. 

We need $10,000 to reach our budget and make sure we can pay our extras (around 30), feed and house our crews (including horses and stuntsmen) and make this project a reality.

Shooting is scheduled to begin on Oct. 1 so we need to raise this money quickly!

The Impact

Believe it or not, there are many Christian and Pro-life filmmakers waiting for their chance to shine.  What they need are good projects, with moral and artistic meat to sink their teeth into.  Emancipation is that project.  Your contribution to Emancipation the Film will help us elevate the kind of films we love to see; you know, those films we say, "Hollywood should be making."

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you are broke and can't spare even ten dollars (I know you can) but if you truly can't, then you can help us meet our goal by asking other people to chip in.  If you can't give personally SPREAD THE WORD!

story:
Hack Factory of MN, 501(c)3

We are the Hack Factory, and we are launching a campaign to help fund our three projects that we are creating for Northern Spark 2013.  Northern Spark is an overnight art festival that starts at 8:58pm on June 8th 2013. 

Artists David Bryan, Riley Harrison, Cali Mastny, and Aaron Prust who are part of the Hack Factory have come together to create a hacker pavilion, if you will, at Northern Spark.  Launching throwies, mimicking nature, and welding sculpture in real time.

All of these projects are being designed, created, and backed by The Hack Factory, a 501c3 non-profit organization in the Seward neighborhood. Hack Factory of MN’s goal is have a collaborative shop space where people can come to work on projects, and foster an environment for learning, teaching, and making. The Hack Factory offers classes in diverse subjects such as electronics, woodworking, welding, etc.

The budget for this event and projects can be found in our Google Spreadsheet.

Project 1: Steel, Exquisite Corpse of

Contribute your vision to an evolving metal sculpture. Make a drawing and watch as artists weld it into 3-D form. Come back to see how the work changes over the course of the night.

And for the Exquisite Corpse of Steel project, we’re looking for inspiration for the first section of the sculpture related to the theme Underground (which will be followed by Above Ground, and Sky). Tweet @HackFactoryMN a drawing with the hashtags of #nspk38 and #underground. First 20 people to tweet us before June 8th with photos of their drawings will receive two LED throwies on the night of the event.

Project 2: Strange Attractors

Inspiration for Strange Attractors. Image credit: Alex Weber, http://www.flickr.com/people/8123185@N02/

Strange Attractors is a 6' long x  4' high wall of blinking lights that simulates the behavior of individual fireflies in a large mass. In a natural landscape, fireflies' blinking will synchronize. The blinking is effected by the level of light exposure. Participants can shine flashlights on the wall and get real-time feedback on how their outside influence impacts the fireflies' behavior.

Project 3: Siege Engines

The Foshaybuchet is a large model of the Foshay tower in trebuchet form. It will hurl illuminated objects across the night sky, creating an arc of light and a wall of blinking and glowing participatory art.

Our illuminated projectiles will be water balloons with a magnetic light inside called an LED throwie. We will teach people to make their own throwie balloons. Throughout the night the Foshaybuchet will fire them onto a magnetic wall, where they will accumulate to create a changing glowing work of art.

We are giving away 1,000 LED throwies to the general public.  Each particpant will get the chance to make a throwie to launch, and bring one home. Each person will pull the cord, and launch it at the large steel target on the Union Depot train deck.

One the really cool rewards that we are offereing is a Desktop Trebuchet kit!  Riley has spent countless hours creating laser cut trebuchets, and these will be an awesome reward for anyone who like seige engines.

Lastly, if you don't have the funds to donate, please considering sharing or bloging about our projects.  Any and all support will help this project!

Volunteer!

Also consider volunteering for the festival.  We need people to help make these things happen!  To signup for our projects, fill out this form.  To sign up with Northern Spark visit their volunteer page.

T-Shirt Design!

Cali Mastny and Laura Gerald help co-design the T-Shirt!  Here is the final design.

story:
Short Summary

BIO:

Antron Reshaud Olukayode, born Antron Reshaud Brown April 26th, 1984, has self-published three books; Bohemian Rebel Naked and Exposed Vol.1, The Rising Vol.2 and Fearless Revolution Vol.3. He’s made an appearance on CNN’s World AIDS Day 2008, written two stage plays entitled TRANS-ition, the journey of a teenager transitioning from male to female and the one man show EVICTED, about his years being homeless and HIV Positive to spread awareness of HIV/AIDS while mobilizing initiatives such as AID Atlanta’s Evolution Project and other community based organizations with similar missions to increase the betterment of young people nationally. Antron’s poem entitled Passion Mark/HAART was featured in the 2011 December issue of A&U Magazine in correspondence to Museum of Design Atlanta’s Talking Pictures. He was also the first author to collaborate a book promotion with the Atlanta branch of the Microsoft Store. Olukayode is currently residing in Atlanta as a full time artist/entrepreneur and an contributing author for the upcoming collection of essays, short stories and poems by bestselling author Keith Boykin’s’ “For Colored Boys Who Considered Suicide When The Rainbow Still Isn’t Enuf.   Antron is a ten year survivor of HIV.

THE PROJECT:

Book:

The current release Ayo Lost and Found is a collection entailing the spiritual journey of my experiences as a young HIV positive African American male reflecting the sojourn of rediscovering the ample and striking beauty of joy.  When I began my soul searching I wasn't sure of my future's direction while enduring depression and feeling emotinally nil. The unhealthy cycle I continued to repeat was beginning to take a toll on my wholeperson. I didn't love myself and so I needed a drastic change and began re-examining my perceptions and beliefs about love, spirituality and re-invention. Let me also say this project was completely unplanned and because of that I believe in it ever more and have a deeper appreciation for the organic elements it brings. After growing discouraged from the attempts and results of previous projects I was giving up on Art altogether. Suddenly I found myself writing again. 

The compliment of poems, proses and ruminations provide a self-analysis in which I found myself in a repressed state and began a search for clarification thus  undergoing the necessary changes to better myself individually and spiritually.

The book has now blossomed into an all-around artistic movement ranging from visual to performing artwork, Ayo has branched outside of the pages with a life of its own. Funding is imperative to carry out the mission to giving people my truth in hopes of someone benefiting from the mistakes, the triumphs and everything in between of my personal journey.

I am looking to create a small business to fund not only the supplying of distribution for this project but to also implement a continuum of taking "Ayo" to a brand new level along with producing upcoming projects. My overall goal is to kick start a series of book tours and other events and sell a thousand copies to start in which I intend to donate 30%  of the profits made to support a local art program for youth promoting change within their own communities. Funding is humbly requested for distribution, travel and promotions for the project. This campaign is important to me for Art has saved my life plenty of times and I pray I can give that gift to someone else. I want to inspire thoses who are willing to transform their mindsets and life. As a contributor, you will help me reach audiences in a way I never could do on my own. The vision I've been given is much bigger than myself. I would like to present a legacy that is meaningful and a celebration of the human spirit. 

Visual:

Finding Ayo: The Journey of an Angelic Outcast. A series of visual paintings inspired by nature displays the self-discovery using an angel as the protagonist while venturing multi-dimensions surrounding the setting inspired by seasons of the year.  

Performance:

Finding Ayo: The Missing Pieces is the theatrical adaption of the book. A one man show written in the form of monologues exploring the different phases of transformation according to season of the year.

Film:

This independent film adaptation will bring the book onto the big screen and reinforce the primary purpose of the story, gain visibility and introduce “Ayo” to a broader audience on an entirely different scale. 

The Reward of Giving

The total funding for this project is 15,000 to start. This will allow me to access the proper channels of getting the project out there and keeping it consistently distributed, promoted and marketed. Travel expenses are also needed to speak in different cities nationally and internationally to spread the word. Funding will also be used to bring the small business BO's+ARO's ( BO means Beautiful One's, ARO are my intials) into fruition as the operating business or the umbrella of the "AYO" movement. For the visual I would need funding mainly for supplies, framing and having them delivered to different locations for art shows across the United States. The film and theatrical adaptation will be in need of cameras and other production expenses to bring this story to life. 

In case the goal isn't reach I will use the funding that is earned to carry out this project the best way possible and keep my promise of donating 30% of the profits. This project is not about glorifying myself or making a name, it's a chance for me to create  and maintain new and familair connections through the work I create. I am taking a big step of faith to do this but I cant do it alone. I usually don't ask for outside help however it is impossible for me to properly execute this on-going project without it. 

As a contributor, you will have perks as a thankyou for believing in me and my vision of creating togetherness and giving people the inspiration to begin loving themselves. From your contribution not only am I enabled to entirely focus on creating art in a comfortable and stress-free setting I can continue the work I've already began much more effectively. The book was written to pass along wisdom to someone as a way of simply letting them know life does go on and it doesn't always have to be in a bad light. I have a powerful message that is in need to be spread and whatever you can contribute even if it's just a simple promotion of the book would be humbly appreciated.

I am taking a big step of faith to do this but I cant do it alone. I usually don't ask for outside help however it is impossible for me to properly execute this on-going project without it.

story:
Background:

  • My name is Elishewa Shalom.
    • I became passionate about hemp after discovering the book "The Emperor Wears No Clothes", by Jack Herrer when I was in high school.
    • In 2005, I was taking many nature photographs and upon the positive reactions to family and friends, began making photo greeting cards and selling the cards locally.
    • I switched to using hemp paper for the cards, merging my passions for hemp and business - seeing the company as a vehicle for activism to promote environmental change. 
    • In 2012, out of frustration due to extremely limited sources of hemp paper available amidst an abundance of information on its benefits, I began renting studio time and instruction at a local art studio to learn about hemp paper making. 
    • Guest lecturer on Hemp Paper at Oregon State University College of Forestry WSE 266 Industrial Hemp course.


What We Need & What You Get:

Here is what the money will go towards:

  • Supplies - Hemp Fibers, paper making materials such as felts, molds/ deckles.
  • Studio Time - about 140 hours!
  • Goal is to experiment with 5 different hemp fiber types: Hemp hurds, chopped fibers, degummed fibers, whole fresh stalk, clothing scraps (hemp/organic cotton blend) The beater at the studio has a 2 lb minimum, and pulping takes about 8 hours, including prep and cleanup. The next step is sheet forming, which can take up to 20 hours to finish a batch of pulp, depending on thickness and size of paper. That's 140 hours! I am happy to do this work to help the hemp paper industry move forward. 
  • Greeting Cards printing, including new designs. 
  • I will take scrupulous notes and write a book all about hemp paper making.
  • Natureflections greeting cards feature nature's healing beauty. They are blank inside and can be used for any occasion. They are wonderful to send to family and friends for birthdays, anniversaries, weddings, valentine's Mothers Day, Father's Day and every day, or to frame and hang on a wall or prop on an altar. The healing colors and vibrations of nature is a great way to lift anyone's spirits. The images are inspirational and a reminder that life is beautiful. Original limited edition print will feature a surprise image related to cannabis and will be printed with a hand-press, a beautiful old-school technique. 
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, I will use the funds only for certain hemp fibers and use studio time for only a few types of fiber-  first, hemp hurds, second, chopped fibers, and then textile scraps. and not invest in new molds/deckles, felts, or card printing and use cards that are already in stock to fulfill orders. (New molds and deckles will help make higher quality paper and various sizes and shapes.)
  • If over $10k is raised, I will make even more hemp paper! The goal is to do this full time. If more than $50k is raised, I will begin building a hemp paper making studio. Right now, I rent and have to work around studio hours, classes, and other renters.  I would love to work all day and night. Also, the beater and equipment is shared and used for various fibers- many other artists use dyes and fixers too, which sometimes rub off on my paper, making it difficult to produce purely natural paper. I also intend to experiment with natural plant dyes to make colored paper. Also will invest in automatic production by procuring or building a fourdrinier type belt style machine to be able to produce larger quantities of paper that are of consistent quality.
  • The Impact

As America prepares for the reincarnation of its hemp industry, we need to setup hemp fiber processing facilities. I believe that researching and working with hemp on a small scale will prove invaluable when it is time to establish large scale hemp paper production.

  • Hemp is much better for the environment than tree paper - Hemp cleans the air, earth, and water as it grows. It can be recycled 7-8 times and is archival!
  • Hemp does not require toxic chemicals for pulping, unlike timber which uses dioxins to remove lignins for pulping (which is a reason why the paper industry is one of the largest causes of water pollution on the planet.)
  • Hemp can be grown for seed and the stalk made into paper - a very efficient way to utilize precious farmland. Hemp also does not require much water and can grow very easily.
  • There are so many reasons to support hemp!
  • We are all connected - All One! Let's work together to heal the planet and create a sustainable new Earth for future generations.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Like and share on Facebook, Twitter, Youtube, Google + and More!
  • Get the word out however you can.

Love and Gratitude!
