story:
Ride the Wave!

We are a group of artists bringing awareness to ocean pollution by creating a giant wave sculpture at the 2012 Burning Man festival. 

Drawing our inspiration from the immense destruction of the Japanese Tsunami last year, and the inevitable onslaught of that debris arriving on the West Coast shore.

Take a walk along any beach anywhere in the world and you will see washed up an incredible range of debris. The oceans have been made a dumping ground for our waste.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to transport a lot of wood to the Black Rock Desert. We have multiple sources of drift lumber arriving from along the West Coast of North America.
  • LED lighting, and lots of it, that stuff ain't cheap!
  • All four of our incentives are custom, and very unique, we know you'll love em!

Our Breaking Wave sculpture is a participatory and an interactive project. Every person at Burning Man is encouraged to bring a piece of drift lumber from their local beach. 

The flotsam and jetsam collecting on our beaches reminds us that we are all connected – what happens on the other side of the ocean has an impact on us here on the West Coast.  Collecting drift lumber and burning it symbolizes our collective belonging to each other, and our transitory lives and relationships.


  • Statistics indicate that about 80 percent of ocean pollution is directly caused by humans.
  • Breaking Wave team members have a series of successful projects, between all of them, from building the man at local regional burns, to art shows curation, Decompression Event Production, even Non Profit board leadership. We have the skills to get the job done!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

The Breaking Wave sculpture wants you to be involved with it’s construction. We want random pieces of wood, specifically abandoned lumber that has drifted onto a west coast beach or coastal area. The Breaking Wave will be constructed from scratch on the Playa at Burning Man with drift lumber contributed from all  over the World.

If you or your friends are going to Burning Man this year, please bring your drift lumber to us there. We will post our camp and artwork coordinates here on this website as soon as we are informed of them.



http://breakingwave.ca/

story:
Hi,

My name is Petr, I'm from Czech Republic and I would like to explain what this project is about...

 

Story Of a Poster

So one day I decided I want some nice poster in my home-office. After some browsing I wanted to design it by myself. I spent evenings learning how to combine fonts. What was clear from the begining was the message. I knew I want some Apple-related quote to hang on my wall.

Few weeks later...

Here is the final design! It's one size only (A3 - 29,7x42 cm or 11.69x16,54 inches) and available in black & white and three bold colors. Prints will be made on quality paper and each one will be signed and dated on the back side. Every package includes personal thank you note just for you.

 

 

 

What I Need & What You Get

I need funds to print this beautiful poster on quality paper using offset print. The offset printing technology requires greater quantity but brings smooth and awesome quality of the final prints. You will see yourself when it gets delivered to your address  :)

I prepared interesting perks just for you and I believe there is something interesting for everyone. Here you can see how the wallpapers look like:

Other Ways You Can Help

I will be really grateful if you tell your friends about this campaign. Maybe one of your colleagues at work might be interested. Oh, did you think about Christmas gifts? I guarantee that you receive your print anywhere in the world during October/November.

 

All you wanted to know, in one sentence:

Printed on quality paper, signed and dated on the back side, thoroughly packed (personal thank you card included!) and shipped to your address anywhere in the world for free!

story:
Flootie.com "Kinda like a Dating Service for Art"

The current world of art marketing is a jumbled up mess.  Galleries are closing left and right.  The term "starving artist" has taken on new meaning and private parties that wish to sell their artwork are having to wade through auction sites and lists only to get yard sale prices for their efforts.

  • My name is Dean Cameron and as owner of American Fine Art Company along with my 25 year career in business marketing I have been personally responsible for over $200,000,000.00 in sales in other successful fields.  So that beggged the question...why not art?
  • Flootie.com is designed to utilize the best marketing tools and ideas that are outside the current box of art marketing.  Artwork creates passion in the eyes and mind of the patron it is just a matter of making the right "match" to foster more successful sales.
  • As a contributor, you will have the satisfaction of seeing that there really is hope to selling artwork no matter what people say about "the current economy" (I personally hate that excuse).  You will also recieve super value subscription discounts as well as much sought after artwork gifts from artists Tom Hanson and Marcella Rose (you can see their works on www.americanfineartcompany.com ).

Where will this money go?

  • We are looking to raise $25,000.00 in funding to share in the costs of Website Development and Promotion of Flootie.com.  This is a fraction of the personal investment already made in the development costs.
  • As a contributor you will have the most exposure during our heavy promotional phase with artwork you may want to sell.  You may be a Gallery and/or Artist or just wishing to sell that artwork that has been hanging around in the closet. You will also recieve artwork valued at more that the contribution amount.  Great Deal!!
  • All funds will go to Development costs and promotion of Flootie.com
  • We anticipate Flootie.com will go live by October 30th 2012

What Flootie.com will do to make an impact.

 Can you imagine a fully integrated way to stay current with your favorite art and artists on a real time basis?   

  • Galleries can share current works with past clients and network to fans of that artist while serving their current client base.
  • Artists will have an easy way to stay connected to people they meet at art shows as well as utilize the easy marketing tools to share their current and past works with fans.  They can even help promote their works in their current Gallery shows.  They will also be able to grow their exposure through the organic fan base generated by Flootie.com
  • Private Parties take the biggest hit in the current art marketing world as they have few options to show their product to the right fan base.  They are relegated to huge auction sites and/or lists to only see yardsale prices for their efforts.  This also devalues the artists current works when items are sold at such a low price.

So maybe you cannot contribute right now?

  •  Registration is free on Flootie.com and you can become a "fan" of up to 100 artsts.  When a new work is offered for sale by that artists you will get a notification email for you to view that item on Flootie.com.  Become a free registered user and you will also get free art downloads!
  • Until we have tested Flootie.com through our Beta Site you can "like" our Facebook Page https://www.facebook.com/#!/pages/Flootie/111929222270046

Thank you very much for taking your valuable time to read and learn about Flootie.com. 

 

Best wishes,

Dean Cameron
CEO

 

Keywords: Art Marketing, Art Sales, Oil Painting,Watercolor Painting, Acrylic Painting, Mixed Media, Bronze Sculpture, Limited Edition Print, Lithograph, Serigraph, Art Buyer, Marketing, Networking, Poster, Open Edition, Gallery, Artist, 2nd Market, Art Collector. Emerging Artist, Old Master Painting, Impressionist, Contemporary Art, Abstract Art, Western Art, Modern Art, Wood carving
story_txt:
Flootie.com "Kinda like a Dating Service for Art"
The current world of art marketing is a jumbled up mess.  Galleries are closing left and right.  The term "starving artist" has taken on new meaning and private parties that wish to sell their artwork are having to wade through auction sites and lists only to get yard sale prices for their efforts.

My name is Dean Cameron and as owner of American Fine Art Company along with my 25 year career in business marketing I have been personally responsible for over $200,000,000.00 in sales in other successful fields.  So that beggged the question...why not art?
Flootie.com is designed to utilize the best marketing tools and ideas that are outside the current box of art marketing.  Artwork creates passion in the eyes and mind of the patron it is just a matter of making the right "match" to foster more successful sales.
As a contributor, you will have the satisfaction of seeing that there really is hope to selling artwork no matter what people say about "the current economy" (I personally hate that excuse).  You will also recieve super value subscription discounts as well as much sought after artwork gifts from artists Tom Hanson and Marcella Rose (you can see their works on www.americanfineartcompany.com ).



Where will this money go?

We are looking to raise $25,000.00 in funding to share in the costs of Website Development and Promotion of Flootie.com.  This is a fraction of the personal investment already made in the development costs.

story:
2012 is going to be a LEAP year...?

Before you get lost in the mist of glï¿½hwein and christmas shopping we want to let you know about our fundraiser New Years Eve party

As 2012 is a LEAP year we plan it to be a very special one and as it comes just once in four we are throwing a new years party together with BPIGS.

LEAP NYE trailer http://vimeo.com/33082120

Get your tickets online here by donating or by paying in cash (7 euro pre sale, 12 euro door) by coming by to LEAP between 12:00 and 18:00 Monday to Friday (No physical tickets will be issued your name will be put onto the event list)

The party will be a  MASK ONLY  event. We are telling you now as the tickets are cheaper until December 15th. Ticket pre-sales ends on December 30th. You should start preparing your mask now.
2011 has been a very successful one and we hope with your support to continue our project  at least until the next LEAP year

Dresscode: Doom or Boom ---MASK only!!!?

Come early for a the spectacular terrace view over Alexanderplatz at midnight

on the decks?

Antoni Maiovvi http://antonmaiof.wordpress.com/  
NIHITI ***live***  http://www.nihiti.com/
m.e.s.h. http://soundcloud.com/m-e-s-h
dju dju on crack (Juliette Bonneviot + Cracksmurf) http://soundcloud.com/cracksmurf/
Martin Backes? http://www.martinbackes.com/

Saturday 31. December,  22h - last dance
LEAP (Berlin Carrï¿½ 1. Stock) Karl-Liebknecht-Str. 13 10178 Berlin


more info


LEAP
Lab for Electronic Arts and Performance
(Berlin Carrï¿½, 1. Stock)
Karl-Liebknecht-Str. 13
10178 Berlin

www.leapknecht.de
info@leapknecht.de

How to find LEAP: http://vimeo.com/20384216
LEAP Facebook Page: http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100002324791257

story:
Our Story...

S.A.L.T Art Lounge is the brain child of a small group of friends comprised of: hospitality specialists, fashion and interior designers, teachers, artists and photographers, that all possess a sense of entrepreneurship and desire to impact the lives of others. S.A.L.T Lounge is a venue that transcends ordinary meet- up establishments. The mission of S.A.L.T Lounge is to provide art and music lovers a place to exchange ideas, converse, and experience quality and artistic design by new and upcoming artist. S.A.L.T Lounge is based on a community concept that encompasses individuality while promoting the universal concept that art inspires innovation. We believe in the importance of expression and making the world a better place through the power of visual art. S.A.L.T Lounge breaks the mold of conventional evening socials. S.A.L.T provides a myriad of options such as live music, happy hour drink specials, and featured events such as: art shows and art appreciation instruction, wine tastings, interactive music sessions, cooking classes that promote overall health and wellness, as well as opportunities for private showcases and talent exhibitions. We believe that in a world where chaos and indifference have become social norms, we must strive to establish unity through universal concepts such as music and artistic design. Our team has witnessed the unparallel transformation that music and artistic expression provides. The arts go beyond conventional education and promote creativity through modes of expression. Salt focuses on the intrinsic ability of individuals while appreciating our eccentric differences. With this goal in mind we strive to take a Stand for Art Love and Truth â€“ S.A.L.T

 

"Creativity is the power to connect the seemingly unconnected.â€

 

What We Needâ€¦. Where your funds go..... What You Getâ€¦..

We are asking for 8k and have already put in 18k of our own money. The majority of the money will go to securing the best location as well as developing a great structure so the musicians and artists have the best place to showcase their talent. Not only are we will create a master space for artists to showcase, we will also use the funds to purchase the fixtures and furniture that will go in the space. With a unrelenting dedication to art and in order to stay green and cut costs, we will use your funds to repurpose furniture to create posh artistic lounging areas so that visitors fell comfortable to relax. Also, we will launch two free community events one for the adults the other for youth. Reaching our goal is of utmost importance. The money that we do raise will be placed in the company funding account. We will continue to raise money from our own pockets as well as continue to seek investors in our project.

 

The Challenge!

Lets propose a challenge. YOU donate at least $10. Then YOU forward this link to 10 PEOPLE and get them to donate $10 too. (larger contributions are more than welcome and are rewarded with a sliding scale of "grateful love" gifts listed on the right.

 

Get the word out! Make some noise and share!

If you know anyone that would love our campaign and or would like to promote their work, tell them about us and whatâ€™s in it for them.  Also, if you know of any organization that would love to donate items not just money to S.A.L.T. tell them about us.  We could use all the help we can! 

Last, support all your local artists and businesses that help the community!

story:
THE STORY

My name is Tulaya, otherwise known as ‘CreativeAdvokate’. Advocating creativity is my lifetime pursuit. Presently, I am on a mission to revive the use of proverbs by rediscovering folk wisdom with contemporary art.

 

In a world spinning rapidly towards modernization, bits and pieces of tradition can easily be left behind. More susceptible are oral traditions as they fall prey to ever-changing urban slang and social trends. Such change is obvious in the dying art of proverbs where usage can only be found amongst older generations and are close to non-existent amongst the young.

 

‘Thai Folk Wisdom’ features a selection of 50 proverbs with visual interpretations to bring life to 'out of date' traditions in a light and whimsical manner. Aiming to reach out to 3rd culture Thais and young-generation Thais alike to understand and ultimately value Thai cultural heritage; bridging olden-day Thai wisdom with modern-day Thai society. Alongside these proverbs are delightful short tales written by Jane Vejajiva, the S.E.A.Write award-winning author of, "Happiness of Kati." The exhibition received great interest by the public while the book became a best seller.

 

Realizing that this is a worldwide phenomenon, the pursuit continues. Currently on tour in Singapore where a nation-wide event has begun with the original exhibition 'Thai Folk Wisdom ' set to debut at Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts' New Asian Imagination Symposium. Followed by a 6 months campus road show intended to encourage on-campus cultural exchange to a deeper level and consequently activate an interest in proverbs amongst younger generations. All activities will culminate to a grand finale at Asian Civilization Museum that will include public workshops, forum of proverb experts from around the world and campus tours to view works on display on each campus.

 

The waning of verbal tradition is a tragic phenomenon, luckily there is still time for a revival. It is my every intention to bring back the subject thus my global art and cultural crusade, ‘Wisdom Beyond Borders’ begins.

 

THE IMPACT

Wisdom in its pure perception travels far beyond borders. With the unfolding of the crusade, we will begin to see striking similarities in principles, reason and knowledge across all countries the world over. Some proverbial wisdom varies only in imagery marked by the environment and surrounding as it crosses one terrain to another.

 

Don’t make a mountain out of a molehill. -English Proverb

Riding an elephant to catch a cricket. -Thai Proverb

 

In a world that is discouraged by segregation, ‘Wisdom Beyond Borders’ unites people on the basis of expressions of truth, based on common sense and practical experience that has inspired these oral traditions.

To ensure this is instilled in the minds of the next generations, we intercept students during their formative years with ‘Wisdom Beyond Borders’ workshop. Allowing them the chance to think critically on the subject of proverb and how such wisdom can be applied to their day to day life; approaching the matter with creative writing and more importantly artistic expression. That they are not merely words to memorize this workshop is intended to bring these words of wisdom to life - playing on words.

 

Thus far, the dream of bringing this global campaign to life is half way to the tipping point. I humbly seek your support and patronage to take this crusade beyond borders, across continents and around the world as it should be an integral part to our future education.

Social spheres are greatly expanded by the openness of the web and the ease at which people can search for online communities and interact with others that share the same interests and concerns. Therefore, developing www.wisdombeyondborders.org is the most viral and efficient approach to reach out to potential proverb aficionados in this crusade.  As Maria Montessouri once said, “If help and salvation are to come, they only come from the children, for the children are the makers of men.”

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We're looking to raise $20,000 to develop the website and mobile application, hire a full time editor a translator to ensure the site is well maintained and kept dynamic. Note. The site is intended to be self sustainable after the initial first year. Last but not least to hold a public workshop during Wisdom Beyond Borders, Singapore Grand Finale 2012.

 

If we don't reach our entire goal, the ‘Wisdom Beyond Borders’ crusade will take a lifetime longer to accomplish. By then a generation of experts may also have vanished….

 

We're offering a wide range of perks, full of style and sass. Limited edition, so take a look at what we're offering while we are offering -for Indie GoGo pledges only!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP!

If you'd like to see this become a reality as much as we do, but can't make a pledge (or already have); please feel free to share this with everyone you know! Spread the word via Facebook/Twitter/Blogs/News outlets or any other place that more people will find out about  ‘Wisdom Beyond Borders.’ This crusade can only be accomplished through your enthusiasm and support. Don't forget, Indie GoGo has some great "share" options right here on this page, so check them out and spread the word! With some luck, this fundraising will be a success then we will be seeing more of you at www.wisdombeyondborders.org!!! As an old English proverb goes, ‘A chain is no stronger than its weakest link.’ The future of proverb revival is in your hands!

story:
Some Background:

Did you know that the first ever National Poetry Slam ("NPS") was held right here in the Bay Area? That was waaay back in 1990 and there were only 2 teams involved (SF & Chicago). Since then things have changed; Both NPS and the spoken word poetry scene in the Bay have flourished. This summer 72 teams will head to Charlotte NC for The 2012 National Poetry Slam, among them is the first ever BayArea UNIFIED team.

That's right, for the first time ever, the four longstanding Poetry Slams from the Bay are combining forces and sending a single team to represent the entire area from SF & the East Bay all the way to San Jose. The venues combining efforts to field this monster team are The SF Slam & Experimental Mic; The Berkeley Poetry Slam; The Oakland Poetry Slam & Open-Mic and San Jose's Oversocial MoFo Review. At the conclusion of the "regular season" the 24 winingest poets from across the Bay competed in one of four semi-finals from which the top 8 advanced on to the first ever UNIFIED Finals! There the team that will go on to represent YOU in Charlotte was picked.

The good news is we have a GREAT team! The bad news is while we raised a sizable chunk of the funds needed to get them to and through a week in Charlotte we need your help to close the gap. 100% of the funds raised in this campaign will go to funding team travel and lodging to and at NPS; the production of a team chapbook and DVD

What We Need:

All told it'll take about $6,500 to register for Nationals, fly the team to Charlotte and house them while they're there. We'll also be self-publishing a collection of poetry and creating a DVD featuring performances from team members to aid in fundraising. If we need to hitchhike and crash on another team's floor while we're in N. Carolina we will. With your help though we'll meet our goal. Either way 100% of your donation will go to the expenses listed here. If we somehow manage to surpass our goal, the surplus will be divided among the team to be used as a per-diem while in NC.

What You Get:

YES - We have PERKS for you! A small donation will get you a chapbook with a (handwritten) poem from each team member and both coaches OR a chapbook from one of the team members. If you're able to be slightly more generous you'll recieve a copy of the DVD mentioned above, the team chapbook and one from each team member. If you're straight ballin and can afford a larger donation, in addition to all the items above we'll give you 2 lifetime passes to all our shows AND arrange a special feature performance by the team just for you!

Other Ways You Can Help:

Tell you friends and help us spread the word! We're on facebook, google+, youtube, myspace, twitter and pretty much everyplace else you can think of online - check us out. If you know someone who's a fan of poetry (or comedy, theater and live performance in general) point them in our direction and earn a little good karma.

Tell you friends and help us spread the word! We're on facebook, google+, youtube, myspace, twitter and pretty much everyplace else you can think of online - check us out. If you know someone who's a fan of poetry (or comedy, theater and live performance in general) point them in our direction and earn a little good karma.
campaign_city: San Francisco, Oakland, Berkeley, United States

story:
Help us to bring blankets back!  It has been about 15-20 years since we last had them, and feel that the time is right to get everybody covered up (literally) for another 15-20 years, as well as let the new generation in on all this goodness!

The minimums are high, so we decided in order to make this happen, we knew we would need to do a something to help get the word out and give people around the world a place where they could get them.  

It took us a while to get this going again because we had to be absolutely sure the quality would be at least as good as the previous ones, as we want to make sure everybody can enjoy these next round of blankets  for just as long, if not longer!

story:
Nergal is a funny and goofy demon that's always here to help anyone with a burning wish in their chest. After two graphic novels (one of them only available in italian, sorry!), Nergal is now ready for a new adventure!

 

"The Great Downpour" is Sympathy for the Demon's third graphic novel, in which Nergal and his boss Lucy will have to deal with humanity's biggest menace so far: a misterious entity with greater powers then the Devil itself. Will our red-headed demon find a way to save the day, or will he create more troubles as he always do?

 (Language: English or Italian; Format: 16,5x24cm; Lenght: 72 pages.)

story:
30 Covers in 30 Days

Hi there! My name is George Cotronis, and I've been a book designer and illustrator for close to 15 years now. Past clients include tabletop RPG companies like Evil Hat Games, Pelgrane Press, Cubicle 7, Renegade Games Studios and Stygian Fox, on projects such as Night's Black Agents, Don't Turn Your Back, The Laundry Files RPG, Hudson & Brand and more. Book publishers include Haikasoru, Grindhouse Press, PMMP and others.

In October of 2016 I came up with a little challenge of my own inspired by Inktober: Create a new book cover every day for a month. It sounded easy, but wasn't. I ran out of steam on about day 20 and stopped when it didn't feel like much fun any more.

I've decided to up the stakes and see if I could combine a challenge with a way to pre-sell some of my work to clients. One of the toughest parts of making a living as a freelance illustrator and designer is the uncertainty that comes with not knowing where your next paycheck will come from (and when!). It also hobbles creativity and your ability to take advantage of opportunities, being constantly cash poor. This is where my campaign comes in. On the off chance that I sold all 30 covers in this campaign, I'd be in a good position to plan future projects better, finally make some merchandise I've been working on and perhaps buy that overpriced Wacom drawing tablet. 

To see full size images of my old stock and non-exclusive images, as well as past client work and more information, visit my website at www.cotronis.com

 

What I'm Making

This campaign will produce the following:

  • 25 exclusive pre-made book covers/stock art.
  • 5 non-exclusive pre-made book covers/stock art.

To see the new covers, scroll to the bottom. 

 

How It Works:

Choose your pledge and either wait for new covers to be revealed or email me to call dibs on the one you like. Strict first come, first served basis. You can change your dibs at any time.

 

Reward Clarification:

$250 - Main Reward - A brand new pre-made cover made for the campaign.

$150 - Old pre-made cover.

$399 - Completely Custom Cover Commission.

$50 - Ten non-exclusive premades.

$100 - Twentyfive non-exclusive premades.

 

Main Reward ($250)

 

Reward #2 (pick 1 or 3)

 

Reward #3 (pick 10 or get all 25)

 

Stretch Goals and Bonuses:

$4000 - Brand new non-exclusive included for all backers.

 

 

Day 1 (launch reveal)

 

Day 2 (launch reveal)

 

Day 3

 

 

Day 4

 

Day 5

 

Day 6

 

Day 7

 

Day 8 

 

Day 9

 

Day 10

 

Day 11 

 

Day 12

 

Day 13

 

Day 14

 

Day 15

 

Day 16 

 

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge is not being able to produce the set amount of covers in the set amount of time. This will only be a problem if I completely sell out on them, which is unlikely. In that case, I have already created a small buffer of covers that will only come into play should I fail the challenge I've set for myself, ensuring everyone gets what they paid for.

story:
A Little Bit of History...

Capital Slam was founded on 2004 in Ottawa as the very first Canadian National Slam Festival was coming to a close. Then called the Wordlympics, the renamed Canadian Festival of Spoken Word and Capital Slam both became very important pieces of poetic history in Ottawa.

Capital Slam became the centre of a burgeoning Spoken Word scene in Ottawa and has sent a team to represent the city at the National Festival every year since, including 2009 & 2010 when the CapSlam team won the Championship in back-to-back years, against very tough competition

The festival was hosted in Ottawa in 2010 and the largest Slam Audience in festival history not only watched Capital Slam take home the title, but the second place team was ALSO representing an Ottawa series (Urban Legends), showing what a hotbed for amazing Spoken Word talent that Ottawa had become. Since then two different CapSlam reps have even gone on to win the WORLD Slam Championships in Paris!

As of this year, thirty different poets have represented Capital Slam at the Canadian Festival of Spoken Word and now five of them will be heading out to Victoria – the site of the first CapSlam National Championship win in 2009 – in order to remind the country that Ottawa poets have something to say.


This Year's Team:

GAVIN RUSSELL – 2014 CapSlam Champ and TWO TIME Capital Slam team member.

CANDICE BRUCHHAEUSER – TWO TIME CapSlam finalist and first time team member.

ARTEMYSIA FRAGISKATOS – FIRST TIME CapSlam finalist and team member.

RUSTY PRISKE – SIX TIME CapSlam team member – including the 2009 Championship team.

AVONLEA FOTHERINGHAM – FIRST TIME CapSlam finalist and team member.

-

With a mix of veteran and rookie voices, the CapSlam team is set to make its mark.

Join us as we RAISE IT!

What We Need & What You Get

Our national spoken word community here in Canada may be close, but the 2014 Canadian Festival of Spoken Word is not close at all; our team needs to travel almost 5000 km from our home and native slam here in Ottawa to Victoria, BC, and when we get there we might need a place to sleep—or more likely, to rehearse. Our goal amount will cover the cost of two plane tickets and two nights in a hotel, making a serious dent in the funds we have yet to raise (obligatory “ONLY TWO PLANE TICKETS?”).

In exchange for your support, you have a kickin’ selection of perks to reap, but you also have the satisfaction of helping 20% of our team get to Victoria and back safely—and can therefore claim 20% of the victory feels if we return triumphantly!


Come See Us! (A.K.A. Other Ways You Can Help)

Saturday, August 23rd - Ottawa, ON CPC Summer Slam Featuring Gavin Russell, Mercury Lounge, 56 Byward Market Square

Friday, September 26th - Ottawa ON - Last Chance Fundraiser - Pressed Cafe, 750 Gladstone Avenue

Saturday, September 27th - Cornwall ON - Invitational Slam

story:
We (Chris Joy and Zach Keeting) established Gorky's Granddaughter in 2009 as a way to engage in and intensify artistic discourse. Through making video documents of working artists and publishing them on the web, Gorky's has established a large and dedicated audience of artists, art-world practitioners, collectors, and art lovers. 

By providing access to artists in their personal studios, we create a safe space for intimate and in-depth conversations that don't happen anywhere else. Both intensely focused and refreshingly informal, our conversations get to the heart of artists' thoughts as well as the complex meanings that surround the work they show us.

In a sense, we see ourselves as creating a visual, living version of long-form catalogue essays in an engaging, accessible, and entertaining format. So far, we've made more than 200 videos and have attracted a viewership of thousands of people each week. (You can visit our site at www.gorkysgranddaughter.com). 

We love what we're doing, and are exciting to take the project even further. We are asking for your help to grow Gorky's, as to date, this endeavor has been entirely self-funded. Specifically:

- we'd love to take Gorky's on the road throughout the US and even internationally: Chicago, Los Angeles, Paris, Berlin, Tokyo. 

- we want to make sure we're reaching as many interested viewers as possible with these videos-- we can't do more without dedicating resources to advertising and outreach. 

- we also need additional outside help to manage everything from studio visit scheduling, to social media, and all the daily logistics that keep this project humming.

Thanks for all your support so far. If you can, please contribute to this important work-- and keep watching our videos!

- Chris and Zach

story:
The Gaza Project

I am a Mexican artist based in Switzerland with solo and group exhibitions in the past that include The Biennale International dell'Arte Contemporanea in Florence, The Economic Symposium in Churburg, South Tirol, The Cité Internationale Universitaire de Paris, various collaborations with the Mexican Embassy in Bern, as well as exhibitions in other galleries, art fairs or institutions in Zurich, Basel, Mexico City and Buenos Aires among others.

Founder of the educational and peace building children's art project "MAKE ART NOT WAR - Like Children Do".

Art teacher, mother, language teacher and Buddhist meditation and yoga practitioner.

This is an important and unique project for me as an artist that is not only engaged with the creative mind and life with art but in our social and personal contributions to world issues, education, peace and understanding building among people of diferent backgrounds and cultures, specially when it comes to building new perspectives and new ways of thinking for the new generations.

With this first visit to Gaza I want to make an impact in the children I will be working with through art and creativity, motivating them to build their lives and perspectives around a positive input of life that will help them achieve their goals and dreams even in the restricted circumstances they live in at the moment.

I'm doing this campaign to fund the trip as well as the things I will be bringing for the kids

With your support I want to finance the trip as well as the printing of the books of both editions of my project to bring for the children in the school that have taken part in my children's art project and have their work printed in the book as selected work. I will as well bring the prizes for the children that won for the best works and some working material like color pencils or other creative material.

I am also very proud of having the opportunity to bring my own work for a joint exhibition with one of the renowned local artists in the Gallery Windows for Gaza which is a gallery founded by several local artists to make a window to the world and to Gaza through art.

The Impact

Since I started my project "MAKE ART NOT WAR - Like Children Do" I was very aware that with it I would not "change the world" as we dream to do, but I was also always convinced that if I could make a positive impact to even one single children taking part in it, all of it would be already worth the world! In both editions until now I have had children of over 30 countries from all continents participating, including children from all over Europe, USA, Canada, Mexico, Iran, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Palestine, Israel, India, New Zealand and Australia among others.

I am completely convinced that with this visit to Gaza and working directly with the children as well as other people in the community I can bring them a highly positive impact from the world to them as well as motivation for the children to strive for their dreams and goals through creative means.

And I know they will as well have a huge impact in myself, in my life, and this will of course be reflected also in my work as an artist.

Risks & Challenges

People have told me I put myself at risk by going there but after much research and mainly by the trust I have in the many lovely people of Gaza I have had contact with for the past couple years, I know it all will be more than fine.

The two main challenges are, one, getting the permit from the Israeli government to go in, which some people tell me will be the hardest, but it is already in process and I am confident it will go through, and second, being able to finance the whole thing and make it happen, this is why I need your help!

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides your financial support, you can also help me by sharing this with your friends, talking about it with people and/or groups or institutions that might be interested in helping. Also if you know anybody working at places that can make possible some sponsorship for art material I can bring to the children, this will be of big help.

story:
Short Summary

I’ve wanted to do this for years, and anyone familiar with my work will know I’ve been asked about it MANY times. The time and expense of undertaking this project has been fairly extreme, but we’re in the final stretch.

My work with snowflakes has been featured in documentary films from CBC (The Nature of Things), BBC (Forces of Nature) and National Geographic (One Strange Rock) as well as on Canadian currency in the form of limited edition pure silver coins. Each winter, my “Snowflake-a-Day” aims to publish dozens of new images a month to keep the magic of the season shining brightly.

If you’ve ever seen one of my snowflake posts, you know that I dive into the physics of how exactly each snowflake is formed. That knowledge has been directly applied to this ornament.

What We Need & What You Get

Much of the expense here has been paid out of pocket to get to this point. Not including the time spent, the costs for designing a 3D model, prototyping and defining, and experimenting with different materials has cost roughly $5000 over a 10-month timeframe.

If that amount of profit can be made back, this is a project that will likely return in future years.

You will receive a 3D-printed snowflake ornament with a ring and a ribbon to attach it to your Christmas tree, or anywhere else in your home. There are three types of materials we’ve decided on for the ornaments:

White Polished Plastic

This appears as the brightest snowflake from all angles, and maintains fairly decent detail in the branches. The plastic material is the least expensive production option so it’s the “entry level” snowflake ornament material. That shouldn’t take away from its beauty – and it’s likely the most durable!

 

Transparent Acrylic

Plenty of testing has been done on transparent materials and the technology used to create them. This is the most affordable with a good sense of transparency to help imitate the nature of a “real” snowflake made of ice. The production cost is higher, but in a well-lit Christmas tree it’ll take on all the colours of the lights behind it.

 

Sterling Silver

Printing the model in precious metal is something I always wanted to do. Other metals like pewter or steel wouldn’t work with a model of this detail, at least not at affordable sizes. A wax cast is made of the snowflake and the silver is poured inside. For small production runs in silver, the cost is unfortunately very high, but the mark-up percentage is lower here to make it a little more appealing!

 

Transparent Resin (the big one)

Absolutely the best transparency, detail, and a great way to see detail inside the snowflake – bubbles in the ice are maintained in the model and visible from the outside. This is the first snowflake we prototyped, and it’s the most beautiful… but there’s a catch.

Stereolithography 3D printing uses ultraviolet lasers to turn a liquid into a solid. Cool technology, but it means that the resulting model is sensitive to UV light and will turn yellow over time, even when coated with a UV-protecting varnish (it slows down the process but doesn’t stop it). This means the large and expensive model needs to be placed in a display case with museum-quality glass. There will be internal LED lights to illuminate it from the edges, but the extra expense for the enclosure pushes this much higher than the cost of the silver model.

 

Platinum

Really? Sure, its crazy expensive and it wouldn’t be as detailed as the silver model, but if you want this thing in platinum I’ll make exactly one of them in this material. How’s that for limited edition?!

 

Where are they made?

These 3D printed ornaments are being created through the production house Shapeways, which I’ve had great success prototyping with. They have been flexible and very helpful in getting these models to work using a number of cutting-edge printing technologies.

The larger transparent resin model is being produced by a smaller company in London UK.

 

What happens if the funding goal is not met?

Because these items are printed on demand, I can fulfill every order I receive even if the goal isn’t reached. If I cannot reach the funding goal than it becomes difficult pursuing this project farther and getting new models created in future years. Wouldn’t it be great to have your Christmas tree completely covered in real snowflakes?

 

The Impact

Your contribution here will help further the research and design of new snowflakes in years to come, and hopefully allow for more extensive research of materials for future years as well. If the goal is met and exceeded, it’ll be far easier to spend the hundreds of hours this coming winter on presenting new snowflake images to the world.

 

Risks & Challenges

Much of the risk has already been absorbed – prototypes are now perfect and ready to be ordered… but it was not an easy road to get here.

Firstly, this snowflake was photographed on both sides, the front and the back, in order to have a very clear view of the features. Flipping the snowflake with a small artist’s paintbrush and photographing it with the same angle of reflection is not easy. Having photographed thousands of snowflakes, it was at least possible.

While I understand the topography of a snowflake very well, it only came after years of intensely studying them. When I was searching for a person capable of modelling this in 3D, there were a number of false starts. Using websites with designers for hire was an initial mistake, and the resulting models were so poorly done I couldn’t even give feedback to start fixing them.

It was recommended that I check out Ian McKinnell and his work, specifically his detailed “x-ray” view of certain electronic gadgets, and I knew I found someone capable. There were still dozens of revisions based on the properties of the ice, everything from how ridges form with sharp edges to the concave nature of the center “gem” in the snowflake. Ridges, bubbles, cavities, they all went through some level of adjustment to get it to look and feel real to a trained eye.

The challenges continued when it came time to print this snowflake. Some of the bubbles inside the ice needed to be tattooed on the surface, and the overall model is likely thicker than the original snowflake due to production constraints. Countless conversations based on the available materials, and many visits to 3D printers before we decided on stereolithographic resin for the large model. We contacted more than 20 different printers that had this technology, and many of them flat-out refused to print it. Because the snowflake technically has detail on both sides, it can’t be printed flat. Some people stated that essentially “it can’t be done”.

It can be done, and a company in London is handling the large resin prints. Shapeways has the full capability to produce the smaller ornaments, with decent prices at or below the industry standard.

 

But wait… tell us more about THIS snowflake!

(full image can be found here)

I thought you’d never ask. This snowflake has a few classic features that add extra beauty to these designs, starting in the very center. The hexagonal button-like gem in the center is what remains of a twin plate growing out of a center column connecting the two; this snowflake began its life as a column.

Column-type snowflakes usually form in slightly warmer weather, a few degrees below the freezing point. If the temperature drops while the crystal is still growing, it will shift into plate-like growth on either ends of the column. At this early stage, the two plates will likely be growing outward at an equal pace, but if a gust of wind or a pocket of higher humidity hits one side of the snowflake before the other, it gets more building blocks (water vapour) and grows a little faster.

At that point, the battle is over. As soon as one plate grows beyond the footprint of the other, the smaller plate has very little access to water vapour and will remain a tiny gem for the rest of the snowflake’s life. The larger plate will continue to grow outward, eventually growing branches, side-branches, and more unique features.

At the point where we see the first side-branches, the tip of the out-growing branch develops a small cavity. This happens when the top and bottom edge grow faster than the area inside the facet and it’s responsible for all the bubbles we see inside of snowflakes. If a cavity on the tip of a branch becomes larger, it’ll eventually split the top and bottom edges into new plates that compete for growth just like what happened in the center. The bottom-side won again, and you can even see a shadow in the original image that illustrates this shift

One of the side-branches doesn’t match the others, but showcases a very interesting phenomenon in snowflake growth. If a droplet of super-cooled water collides with the snowflake, it’ll freeze on impact (we see a lot of that along the outer edge, left off of the model, called “rime”). In one instance, this droplet protruded enough at exactly the right stage of growth to replace what would have been a normal side-branch. This branch is growing on a different plane, almost like it was just glued on top of the crystal. It also has its surface features on the opposite side of the crystal compared to everything else.

One side of a snowflake typically has surface detail, and the other is mostly void of any features except for some inward-growing lines caused by a thick outer edge growing back towards the center of a snowflake. In a split-crystal design, it’s very common for branches growing on different planes to have features on opposing sides, and we get a little hint of that here as well.

This snowflake has a lot of complexities, but is still has a very “classic” feel. That’s why it was chosen for the first snowflake ornament! Some features were left off such as a few hitchhiking small snowflakes and the rime on the outer edges, just to keep the core snowflake at the heart of the presentation.

I could go on, but let’s leave the rest for now. :)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute but love this project, it would be great if you could help in other ways!

Spread the word, most importantly! The more people that see this page, the more trees will be adorned with larger-than-life snowflakes.

Check out Sky Crystals, a book originally funded here on Indiegogo. It’s now out in a very affordable eBook format! https://www.skycrystals.ca/

Ian McKinnell worked very closely with me on this project - his 3D modelling skills made it possible. You can find him here: http://www.ianmckinnell.com/portfolios

Check out Howard Lopez – he wrote the music used in the intro video titled “Snow Flurries”. http://www.howardlopez.com/
story_txt: Short SummaryI’ve wanted to do this for years, and anyone familiar with my work will know I’ve been asked about it MANY times. The time and expense of undertaking this project has been fairly extreme, but we’re in the final stretch.My work with snowflakes has been featured in documentary films from CBC (The Nature of Things), BBC (Forces of Nature) and National Geographic (One Strange Rock) as well as on Canadian currency in the form of limited edition pure silver coins. Each winter, my “Snowflake-a-Day” aims to publish dozens of new images a month to keep the magic of the season shining brightly.If you’ve ever seen one of my snowflake posts, you know that I dive into the physics of how exactly each snowflake is formed. That knowledge has been directly applied to this ornament.What We Need & What You GetMuch of the expense here has been paid out of pocket to get to this point. Not including the time spent, the costs for designing a 3D model, prototyping and defining, and experimenting with different materials has cost roughly $5000 over a 10-month timeframe.If that amount of profit can be made back, this is a project that will likely return in future years.You will receive a 3D-printed snowflake ornament with a ring and a ribbon to attach it to your Christmas tree, or anywhere else in your home. There are three types of materials we’ve decided on for the ornaments:White Polished PlasticThis appears as the brightest snowflake from all angles, and maintains fairly decent detail in the branches. The plastic material is the least expensive production option so it’s the “entry level” snowflake ornament material. That shouldn’t take away from its beauty – and it’s likely the most durable! Transparent AcrylicPlenty of testing has been done on transparent materials and the technology used to create them. This is the most affordable with a good sense of transparency to help imitate the nature of a “real” snowflake made of ice. The production cost is higher, but in a well-lit Christmas tree it’ll take on all the colours of the lights behind it. Sterling SilverPrinting the model in precious metal is something I always wanted to do. Other metals like pewter or steel wouldn’t work with a model of this detail, at least not at affordable sizes. A wax cast is made of the snowflake and the silver is poured inside. For small production runs in silver, the cost is unfortunately very high, but the mark-up percentage is lower here to make it a little more appealing! Transparent Resin (the big one)Absolutely the best transparency, detail, and a great way to see detail inside the snowflake – bubbles in the ice are maintained in the model and visible from the outside. This is the first snowflake we prototyped, and it’s the most beautiful… but there’s a catch.Stereolithography 3D printing uses ultraviolet lasers to turn a liquid into a solid. Cool technology, but it means that the resulting model is sensitive to UV light and will turn yellow over time, even when coated with a UV-protecting varnish (it slows down the process but doesn’t stop it). This means the large and expensive model needs to be placed in a display case with museum-quality glass. There will be internal LED lights to illuminate it from the edges, but the extra expense for the enclosure pushes this much higher than the cost of the silver model. PlatinumReally? Sure, its crazy expensive and it wouldn’t be as detailed as the silver model, but if you want this thing in platinum I’ll make exactly one of them in this material. How’s that for limited edition?! Where are they made?These 3D printed ornaments are being created through the production house Shapeways, which I’ve had great success prototyping with. They have been flexible and very helpful in getting these models to work using a number of cutting-edge printing technologies.The larger transparent resin model is being produced by a smaller company in London UK. What happens if the funding goal is not met?Because these items are printed on demand, I can fulfill every order I receive even if the goal isn’t reached. If I cannot reach the funding goal than it becomes difficult pursuing this project farther and getting new models created in future years. Wouldn’t it be great to have your Christmas tree completely covered in real snowflakes? The ImpactYour contribution here will help further the research and design of new snowflakes in years to come, and hopefully allow for more extensive research of materials for future years as well. If the goal is met and exceeded, it’ll be far easier to spend the hundreds of hours this coming winter on presenting new snowflake images to the world. Risks & ChallengesMuch of the risk has already been absorbed – prototypes are now perfect and ready to be ordered… but it was not an easy road to get here.Firstly, this snowflake was photographed on both sides, the front and the back, in order to have a very clear view of the features. Flipping the snowflake with a small artist’s paintbrush and photographing it with the same angle of reflection is not easy. Having photographed thousands of snowflakes, it was at least possible.While I understand the topography of a snowflake very well, it only came after years of intensely studying them. When I was searching for a person capable of modelling this in 3D, there were a number of false starts. Using websites with designers for hire was an initial mistake, and the resulting models were so poorly done I couldn’t even give feedback to start fixing them.It was recommended that I check out Ian McKinnell and his work, specifically his detailed “x-ray” view of certain electronic gadgets, and I knew I found someone capable. There were still dozens of revisions based on the properties of the ice, everything from how ridges form with sharp edges to the concave nature of the center “gem” in the snowflake. Ridges, bubbles, cavities, they all went through some level of adjustment to get it to look and feel real to a trained eye.The challenges continued when it came time to print this snowflake. Some of the bubbles inside the ice needed to be tattooed on the surface, and the overall model is likely thicker than the original snowflake due to production constraints. Countless conversations based on the available materials, and many visits to 3D printers before we decided on stereolithographic resin for the large model. We contacted more than 20 different printers that had this technology, and many of them flat-out refused to print it. Because the snowflake technically has detail on both sides, it can’t be printed flat. Some people stated that essentially “it can’t be done”.It can be done, and a company in London is handling the large resin prints. Shapeways has the full capability to produce the smaller ornaments, with decent prices at or below the industry standard. But wait… tell us more about THIS snowflake!(full image can be found here)I thought you’d never ask. This happens when the top and bottom edge grow faster than the area inside the facet and it’s responsible for all the bubbles we see inside of snowflakes. If a cavity on the tip of a branch becomes larger, it’ll eventually split the top and bottom edges into new plates that compete for growth just like what happened in the center. The bottom-side won again, and you can even see a shadow in the original image that illustrates this shiftOne of the side-branches doesn’t match the others, but showcases a very interesting phenomenon in snowflake growth. If a droplet of super-cooled water collides with the snowflake, it’ll freeze on impact (we see a lot of that along the outer edge, left off of the model, called “rime”). In one instance, this droplet protruded enough at exactly the right stage of growth to replace what would have been a normal side-branch. This branch is growing on a different plane, almost like it was just glued on top of the crystal. It also has its surface features on the opposite side of the crystal compared to everything else.One side of a snowflake typically has surface detail, and the other is mostly void of any features except for some inward-growing lines caused by a thick outer edge growing back towards the center of a snowflake. In a split-crystal design, it’s very common for branches growing on different planes to have features on opposing sides, and we get a little hint of that here as well.This snowflake has a lot of complexities, but is still has a very “classic” feel. That’s why it was chosen for the first snowflake ornament! Some features were left off such as a few hitchhiking small snowflakes and the rime on the outer edges, just to keep the core snowflake at the heart of the presentation.I could go on, but let’s leave the rest for now. :) Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can’t contribute but love this project, it would be great if you could help in other ways!Spread the word, most importantly! The more people that see this page, the more trees will be adorned with larger-than-life snowflakes.Check out Sky Crystals, a book originally funded here on Indiegogo. It’s now out in a very affordable eBook format! https://www.skycrystals.ca/Ian McKinnell worked very closely with me on this project - his 3D modelling skills made it possible. You can find him here: http://www.ianmckinnell.com/portfoliosCheck out Howard Lopez – he wrote the music used in the intro video titled “Snow Flurries”. http://www.howardlopez.com/

story:
Y

January 19th , UPDATE one week left ! Hello supporters ~!   IM ON MY WAY!!   boarding my flight to Australia later today !     Please note that any contributions sent after January 20th , your art reward delivery will be delayed till the end of February .  Although I will graciously accept poster sticker and tapestries order, I won’t be available to send your new art from Australia.   I recommend considering the $111 level as I will still be able to create your custom art this next month in Australia! Speaking of which , I am ecstatically looking forward to diving into all these amazing commissioned paintings in OZ!  Thank you for believing in me for this opportunity! It’s such a gift to be able to share my work in new place!  All my Love rae

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

~In search for a new vision !
My ambition and imagination takes me to the land down under... 

~ Greetings ~ 

  My name is Rae Vena . I am a visual artist of visionary surrealism based out of Washington State. Thank you for taking a moment to check out my art project!

 

My passion...

has always been painting and inspiring creative culture.   Over the last 10 years working as a Freelance Artist, I have been living an artful life. Many miles,  festivals , and several countries later.. I still thrive on sharing my colorful vision and positive heart through live painting performances and art installations with festivals and concerts everywhere!  This past year I have been painting imaginative and fantasy works inspired by my 2018 tour theme "Prism Palette" From this motif a new vivid work of art as emerged !       I am proud to share with you my newly finished prismatic painting:

"Rainbow Angel"

This project launches the first available prints of "Rainbow Angel" !  

This picture was taken on thanksgiving with my trophy painting from this year. After months of perfecting this piece, it certainly has a particular strength that manifests from the heart <3  This work of art has undoubtably changed my life ~ I want to keep creating mystic meaningful art like this one !   ~always~      UPDATE: If I reach 100% funding I will be creating a video about the meaning and process behind the angel~!   Looking forward to sharing an in-depth view and interpretation of my art with you~

 

The Opportunity -->

At the same time, I am also  excited to announce a unique opportunity:  Art in Australia !! Mid January through mid February.  This quest has been on my mind for a couple years and it is now ~I am proud to make this step forward and take this years chromatic vision that much further ⚡️so surreal!!   After finishing my most momentous painting "Rainbow Angel"  I will celebrate by taking this years: "Prism Palette" theme on tour in a new land!~    #aussieartadventure ~ here I come! 

 

Your Support <3

With your support, I will have the opportunity to travel, create my art in a new country!

To make this trip happen~ I'll need your help! and Im offering amazzzzing awards in honor of your support~ As of today (December 21st ) plane tickets cost ME  $1000 roundtrip from Washington to Melbourne Australia- Your support means A-LOT to me as it will help me focus on just creating and finding nw inspiration for art while Im traveling abroad! 

 

What you get !

~Amazing perks for sponsors!   ~

 USA shipping included      

+get some neato art for your home! My deepest gratitude for your donation or contribution any size <3

  • $6 Give a tip to the artist! :  Suggested donation! Thank you for supporting my work as an artist ~All contributors of $6 or more will receive a surprise sticker of my art in the mail. Plus you will have access to my donor exclusive weekly e-newsletter where ill be posting images and updates during my Aussie art adventure abroad!
  • $15 - Sticker set! :  

 For a $15 contribution you will receive 3 stickers!    2 holographic stickers of my newest paintings  "Rainbow Angel"  and "Rose Gold".  +plus one bonus surprise sticker of my art !

 

  • $25  Poster perk! : 

For your contribution of $25 you will receive a  11 x 17 inch paper print  of "Rainbow Angel" signed by artist Rae Vena!    (  OR choose a different  painting for your poster from the photo album on this project )

 

  • $35 Scarf supporter! :  

For your contribution of $35 you will receive a  23 x 23  inch scarf featuring my art! Super soft double sided and washable ! Choose from 3  scarf designs:  "Rose Gold" or "Earth Night" or "Psychedelic Ice cream" 

 

  • $50 Total fan bag! :

For your contribution of $50 you will receive a tote bag featuring my art!   Available exclusively through this project and perfect to carry art supplies, kittens or even groceries!. Choose from 3 bag designs "Rainbow Angel" , "Rose Gold" or "Our Dream"

 

  • $60  Trophy T-shirt : Show your support and wear the art ! You will receive a t-shirt of "Rose Gold" Available in X-small, small, medium, large, X-large and XL-large . Pick your shirt size and style from a crew cut or women's scoop neck!

 

  • $77  Tapestry trailblazer! :

For your contribution you will receive a tapestry of my art! A washable, larger than life version of my paintings , easy to bring with you to festivals, camping or hang indoors for wall sized art! Sizes range depending on the painting ratio between 40 - 60 inches . Choose from 11 different  tapestry designs featured in the photo album on this project!. 

 

  • $100  Bundle for a bill! :  

For a $100 bill you will receive the Christmas art bundle!  2 piece holographic sticker set,  11 x 17 inch poster of my newest painting of "Rainbow Angel" and a "Rose Gold" T-shirt.  All the best goodies and in time for the holidays! 

 

  • $111- Original Painting:  

At this special sponsorship level you will receive : one,  8 x 10 inch original painting created during my tour in Australia!  ~Limited ! ONLY  4 left available ! at this unique offering and  Inspired by my unique "PRISM PALETTE" theme! Each painting will be approximately 8 x 10 inches, arrives  in February, framed and ready to hang for your home!  Choose your main color theme from : Red Yellow, Orange, or Violet.  (Already picked but also available: Indigo, green, blue)

 

  • $150- 300  Limited Edition Canvas art print  Giclee canvas print of "Rainbow Angel" Signed and numbered in a limited edition of 100.   Print release! Available here for the first time ever~  Choose between 15 x 20 inch or  large  24 x 32 inch archival  canvas.  Arrives ready to hang in your home!   (you also have the option of choosing a different painting for your canvas print from my photo album on this project)   

 

  • $200 Art Abundance! :

A surreal deal ~art in abundance! For your contribution you will receive the 2 piece holographic sticker set, "Rose Gold" t-shirt and a high quality 15 x 20 inch limited edition signed and numbered canvas print of "Rainbow Angel" A great bundle of art in time for Christmas! 

 

  • $1000- The Deluxe deal:   You're a one of a kind sponsor! As my number one fan you will receive my large Original main event painting, inspired by my theme "Prism Palette" and created in Australia at Rainbow Serpent music festival 2019!  Approximately 24 x 36 inches, your original painting arrives in February framed and ready to hang! (available here for pre-purchase sponsorship!) 

 

   Thank you for your support!~

It's the end of an incredible, life changing year and Im celebrating my newly finished masterpiece  "Rainbow Angel". Feeling so ready for an art adventure!

Bringing colorful, powerful, and positively strengthening artwork to life, is my greatest success. Every moment that I get to spend doing what I love and sharing love and light and rainbows through art is a cherished and blessed gift. Each painting shares the essence of a joyous moment during my journey as an artist...  Reminding me everyday of a positive and surreal place in my heart that I am grateful to translate to many people through my art.  With your support~ Ill be able to share my talents somewhere new! I see Australia as the next step of momentum.  I am confident that all of the artwork that I have made available through this project will bring color and a smile to any room in your home :) Thank you for being apart my journey and lifting me up , you inspire my heart to soar anew!

 

{ Other Ways You Can Help }

Every bit helps! Even if you can't contribute or donate at the moment, you can still help by sharing my new project with your friends and family~ 

If you have any questions, or special requests please do reach out! 

All my best, Rae Vena

<3

 

On the left is the painting only 4 days working from a  blank canvas at Electric Forest...

and the on the right is the finished art !

 

 

CREDITS:

 

Artwork, paintings and this project : Rae Vena

 http://www.raevena.com

http://www.instagram.com/raevena_visual_artist

 

Video production: Israel Medrano

http://Vimeo.com/Medranoproductions

 

Music : w/both shoulders broken

http://wbothshouldersbroken.bandcamp.com

I see Australia as the next step of momentum.  I am confident that all of the artwork that I have made available through this project will bring color and a smile to any room in your home :) Thank you for being apart my journey and lifting me up , you inspire my heart to soar anew!
 

{ Other Ways You Can Help }
Every bit helps! Even if you can't contribute or donate at the moment, you can still help by sharing my new project with your friends and family~ 
If you have any questions, or special requests please do reach out! 
All my best, Rae Vena
<3
 

On the left is the painting only 4 days working from a  blank canvas at Electric Forest...
and the on the right is the finished art !
 
 
CREDITS:
 
Artwork, paintings and this project : Rae Vena
 http://www.raevena.com
http://www.instagram.com/raevena_visual_artist
 
Video production: Israel Medrano
http://Vimeo.com/Medranoproductions
 
Music : w/both shoulders broken
http://wbothshouldersbroken.bandcamp.com

story:
Short Summary

Stairwell’s is a project started in 2011 by Bay Area artists Sarah Hotchkiss and Carey Lin. We organize site-specific exhibitions and lead group walking tours called Field Trips. We focus our programming outside of traditional gallery settings to create art experiences in unexpected places, like stairwells.

We need your help to increase the scope of our programming in our fifth year. If we reach this goal, we’ll mount our eighth exhibition, lead 3 new Field Trips and continue to reinvent what Stairwell’s is and can be.

Everyone who has contributed to Stairwell’s -- the artists, writers, Field Trip participants and photographers -- make this project the most exciting thing we have ever done. Help us continue to spread the stair gospel, one step at a time.

What We Need & What You Get

100% of the money we raise will go to Stairwell’s programming. This means paying everyone we work with, covering the material costs of Field Trips and exhibitions and attending artist residencies to bring our programming to audiences beyond the Bay Area.

We have some amazing perks for our contributors, from a custom Field Trip for you and a group of friends to a deeply-considered stair-themed mixtape. Accessorize with a limited edition Stairwell’s fanny pack or tote bag! Ask us anything about stairs over drinks in a scenic stairway!

With the flexible funding model, any amount we raise through this campaign will still go towards Stairwell’s programming even if we don’t meet our goal.

The Impact

Our projects create temporary communities of curious and engaged individuals. Since 2011 we’ve mounted 7 exhibitions with 14 artists in 6 different stairwells. We’ve led 11 field trips with 11 guest field trip leaders, produced 8 publications with content from 14 writers, and participated in 3 artist residencies.

We’ve traced secret pathways between homes, tested the resonance of an interior stairwell with singing exercises led by an a capella group, learned the history of escalators while riding them and played kazoos on buses.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’ve ever taken part in Stairwell’s programming, or have heard about us and would like to participate in the future, please consider contributing at any level. Even if you’re not able to contribute monetarily right now, please share this with your networks to help us meet our goal and sustain the future of Stairwell’s.

CREDITS: Video footage by Phoebe Tooke and Stairwell's, sound by Wayne Grim. Photos by Catherine McElhone and Matt Shapiro.

story:
Hi, my name is Philip and I have been drawing ever since I could remember. I live in a small town on the North Coast of KwaZulu Natal called Ballito. Art is my creative outlet, I can honestly say I know what I want to do with my life... study Art and find my inner voice as an artist and as an individual.

I’m raising money for a road trip from Durban to Cape Town to visit Michaelis School of Fine Art and for the art material needed to prepare my entry exam portfolio.

I have a big dream of going to study the one thing I’m really passionate about - ART ! I am appealing to you if you could please help me make this dream a reality.

 

I'm hoping to travel from Durban to Cape Town and back. I will pass through the Wild Coast and the Garden Route which is one of the most beautiful parts of South African coast line. I can just Imagine the Cape Point where the two oceans meet, the wine farms and the cold waters of Blouberg all in one place. When I return I will travel the inland route through the semi-desert of the Klein Karoo and the lovely farming towns. My journey ends in the Dolphin Coast of KwaZulu Natal.

I will make plenty of sketches and drawings along the way and use them to prepare for my entry exam portfolio.

 

The funds raised will go towards:

  • A ten days long trip from Durban to Cape Town and back including transport, accommodation and all living expenses
  •  Art material needed to compile the visual diary and an art portfolio
  •  Donation to Livingstone Primary School in Durban a short- term remedial school for children with learning difficulties; which I proudly attended for three years (5% of any amount of money raised)
  •  Campaign costs (perks material and shipping, Indiegogo hosting & bank charges)

Any extra money, if raised, will be used to buy the art material such as paints, canvases, books etc.

 

All the perks listed on the campaign page, some of which includes my art work! Once on the road, I will be keeping a visual diary which I'll be sharing with you via social media, along with all the excitement every step of the way.

 

 

If you are unable to donate, don't worry, you can still help by:

  • Sharing this campaign link on your social network pages (Facebook, Twitter etc.)
  • Checking out my website
  • Joining me on Facebook
  • Supporting my YouTube channel
  • Sharing your thoughts and comments by following me on Twitter 

Your donations and support will help me to continue learning and expressing my self through the wonders of art.

A big thank you,

Philip

“Art is not what you see, but what you make others see.” Edgar Degas

story:
My name is Dave, and I'm an artist.

The rough (ok, very rough) sketch you see above is of the Video Feedback Machine Sculpture I would like to build. The prototype I made to create the above video can be seen here. The prototype represents the functional part of the sculpture, but as you can cleary see, not the aesthetic part.

The prototype used a cheap standard definition camera and an old television set. The sculpture, however, will use a 4K camera and screen (that's quite a bit higher resolution than HD). The images produced with this setup will be spectacular (and never seen before).

The sculpture itself will be a combination of kinetic and performance art, a thing of beauty to look at and also to interact with. The sculpture will stand about twelve feet high and will be made of iron or aluminum and will be intended as an installation piece.

Below is a description of what is actually going on to make these images, and some philosophy to go with it:

This is old-school analog feedback. No computers were used (or injured) in the creation of these images. 

The Video Feedback Machine allows the Operator to create a small universe in a plexiglass box.   

The plexiglass box contains a 4K camera pointed at a small 4K monitor that displays what the camera sees. This creates a video feedback loop.

You may have seen video feedback as wild spinning colors in '70s Hendrix videos.  But when the feedback is tightly controlled, as with the Feedback Machine, it can be quite sophisticated and intricate, creating beautiful morphing organic shapes found in nature.

This amount of extreme control comes from the camera's ability to move smoothly in relation to the monitor.  The Operator sits in the chair and uses something much like a yoke on an airplane to very smoothly move the camera forward, backwards, and 360 degrees around its axis. Small changes in degrees of rotation and distance create amazing changes in the feedback image.

On this yoke are control dials, among them: Brightness, Contrast, Color saturation and Tint.  These affect the monitor in the plexiglass box and allow even more control over the created image.

The image being created on the monitor in the plexiglass box is mirrored on the large 4K monitor, which is what the Operator (and others in the room) will be viewing.

I say this creates a small "universe" because the world we live in is a complex feedback loop.  All biological functions operate on a feedback loop and it is no wonder that the images created using video feedback are so organic looking.

Ecosystems, geological systems and social systems all operate on feedback loops, and they operate according to the inherent rules of that system.  

With the Feedback Machine, these rules, or laws of the universe, are the camera's angle, distance from the monitor and control dial positions.

But where does the image come from you might be thinking, and why does it actually exist?  It comes from itself, and exists only because it exists. Something worth pondering.

To me this must be what the brain is like. What I mean is, if some scientists, say from another planet, came in to the room where the feedback was being created, and tried to derive where it came from, they'd be at a loss. If they dissected the apparatus, the monitor, the camera, the wires, they'd find no clue to the origin of the pattern they saw on the screen. 

This is like opening up the brain, poking around, and trying to find the mind or soul. These things grow through iterations, through cycles that start small and flourish, and can't be seen once they are gone (or the screen has gone blank).

Imagine a dark room where the camera is looking at a dark screen. It will stay dark this way forever (no life, no soul) until a "spark of life" (say the lighting of a match) brings forth an image, which will then perpetuate itself on and on. But, then imagine something blocking the camera's view of the screen, just for an instant. All of a sudden, the image goes out, never to return exactly as it was. To me, this is what the mind is, just a complex pattern.

So the question of "where do you go when you die?" is as meaningless as the question "where does the feedback pattern go when it disappears?" or, "where does the snowflake pattern go when the snowflake melts?"

To complete the analogy, the Universe is the monitor, matter and energy are the image, and God is the camera, the all seeing eye in the sky. Or something like that.

Please help me build the Video Feedback Machine Sculpture. Let's create something amazing together. 

Thank you!
