story:
Short Summary

The Transition Stage Company is a multimedia company for exceptional Artistic Talent and artists who need a spring board to be seen. This Multimedia spectrum may seem broad but Transition stage company will be working in Film, Theatre and Visual Art and organizing Networking events to bring like minded people together; as we all know part of surviving in the visual Art industry is based on Networking. Not only do we plan to do events but we have a hosting website in production for savvy artists who would like to push there brand even more on the world wide web, We aim to bridge the gap between amateur/student to the professional. We want to work on projects that are relevant also to provoke thought, to challenge and change the world. Transition Stage company encourages exceptional Artists to take the Leap, and with a continuously growing network of connections  we are able to unite like-minded people who make a great team and produce amazing projects like the GWEN AND GWEN art Instillation project . 

The Transition stage company is the brain child of Natalie Yesufu . Born and raised in England she moved to New York in 2011 to pursue her dream of Acting and passion in film and theatre. Before moving to the United states: Natalie has a back ground in Event organizing. She has organized and produced events for the government and high-end events for charities. Natalie also produced and acted in her first feature film in 2010 "Entwinement". Natalie has been in New york for just little over a year and has produced a off broadway showcase which was near full capacity and has organized networking parties for actors and filmmakers alike and produced numerous projects in New York . Natalie believes Actors and Artists have so many obstacles  and it is imperative to work hard and of course have talent but be social and dynamic. This  is why she set up the Transition Stage Company to give this much needed support to the serious Artist.

THE PROJECT

The Gwen & Gwen Art Installation play is a thought challenging experiment project which deals with topic of mental health with Women . The play Gwen and Gwen is a three act play by Nancy Kiefter and the event will run nightly for a week .

The play will take place in an art gallery/venue with a collaboration of other Artists exploring the themes of identity and mental health in society. There will be paintings and Art on the wall for your viewing pleasure and the possibility to buy. It will be an interesting evening with a free bar. The Artists will be confirmed throughout the campaign. 

About the play:

Gwen has just been released from the home where she has been under psychiatric care and is trying to re-establish her life, her identity and her relationship with her estranged young children

After the social worker who has provided emotional support during the last year leaves her in a dingy apartment, a disturbing side of Gwen appears as a separate character .

In a tour de force for two actresses, Gwen’s alter ego torments and goads her toward self destruction. Spiced with dark humor, this psychological drama is a captivating evening of theatre.

 . 
 

The Impact

Mostly Gwen & Gwen is an amazing play and can really give one an insight on the battles of people who suffering from mental illness . One in Four people suffer with this illness and you see many homeless people in New York battle with this plight. Natalie also lost a close relative due to mental health. She believes through a great theme, and  collaboration of Art it will bring great awareness and will be a new and exciting project which has rarely been seen In New York. It will be a great way of bringing awareness and also showing what Transition Stage company is all about. 
 
This would be a dream come true for Natalie. And of course all her fellow TSCers,  Vicky,  .... and Ted Olsen

 

What We Need & 

What we will need funding for :

Venue 

Rental of lighting  stage , seating , carpet 

Advertising . Public relations etc

Director , staff, set designer, costume designer, lighting designer 

Set and materials 

Hosting site 

Branding 

copy write legal advice 

Hospitality 

Pre-Launch night 

THE COST BROKEN DOWN

 

Chairs, Lighting and stage rental $4500

Staff & Labour of set development $1000

PR/ Advertising for company set up and play $3000

Prop Rental $1000

Location hire $11000

Branding and graphic design $1000

Development of hosting site $1000

Costume design $500

Set Design $1000

Also idiegogo take a percentage of the cost of funding so we have added the cost to the budget 26500

 

All the funds will get this show on the road and be the grand opening of Transition stage Co !

 

THE CAMPAIGN

With this campaign, TSC is hoping to raise enough funds so that we can put on our very own first Art/Installation play . For most of us at TSC, this has been a dream for a very long time, but with the fight for space in this great city, prices are steep (as all you New Yorkers will know). We are hoping for enough money to hire a great space for a one week run. TSC would love for you to join us on this adventure, we really appreciate any donations.

 

The money will also go to the development of the Transition stage company hosting website and branding .

Your contributions could really fulfill some long standing goals. The film and theatre industry is such a tough industry to break into, but the beauty of it is, that we can create our own art. We have to start small to get big. Your donations will really make a difference to size and scale of our production, and to the success of our future endeavors. We do not have the words to thank you enough. Any amount will help, no donation is to small.

What You Get

Go to Perks ... 

The perks well be updated through out the progress of the campaign

story:
“One’s destination is never a place, but a new way of seeing things.”- Henry Miller

UPDATE 7/24/13 with 14 hours left:

Dr. Oz comes out in favor of the technology we are using for our Time Traveling Guided Audio Meditations!
http://www.doctoroz.com/videos/have-out-body-ex...

UPDATE 7/14/13 with 10 days left:  

Dear Friends & Time Travelers:

LARGE OR SMALL - PLEASE DONATE TODAY!!!

DO NOT BE INFLUENCED BY OUR TOTAL FUNDING #'s AT ANY TIME. WE HAVE DESIGNED THIS PROJECT SO THAT IT CAN BE CREATED FOR $1 OR MORE THAN $25K (all that changes is how big and physically dynamic it will be.)

If we can not raise a large amount of funding, we will still produce a mind-blowing, heart-opening, consciousness exploring Guided Audio Journey & Meditation that we can share with everyone!

 

Have you ever dreamed of traveling through time and space in a real Time Machine? We have! And now, with your help, we can manifest our dream and play it out together with the creation of the TIME MACHINE U.F.O. (Unusual Fantastic Object)

A Little History . . .

Cosmic Cowboy aka Jonathan Yudis and Cyberius Rex aka Timothy Johnson first met in 1993 when attending NYU Film School.  While working together on film and TV projects they discovered a shared desire to also create transformational, interactive-art installations and a life-long friendship began.  When Cowboy was introduced to Burning Man in 1998 through another mutual friend, he was absolutely blown away and inspired to return in 1999 with Cyberius in tow to create the multi-media piece "Hands Across the Man and the Psychedelic Torah", which was simultaneously a participant-based art installation and event celebrating our collective 'unity in diversity', as well as, the basis for a documentary film project about the group of artists and adventurers on the journey to create this art project for Burning Man.  The joy experienced by putting our ideas out there and seeing what happened proved to be a powerful force and over the last 14 years our various projects have had profound impacts on those who participate and experience them, as well as, helping us to develop artistically and creatively which is, in and of itself, profoundly inspiring.

At the beginning of 2004, Cowboy had a vision that we build a large-scale UFO (The Healing Mothership) inside of which participants could enter and experience a combination of lights, video projections, and sound that would create a transformational experience.  While intriguing, the motivation was just not specific enough to justify the cost of building something so elaborate and having personally funded all of our other projects, it proved too costly for us to manifest. Fast forward to 2012 and Cowboy had created a new Guided Audio Meditation track  (The first was actually the basis of The Living Coffin project executed in 2000) We tested this experience out on 65 people in our theme camp, Camp Mystic, to rave reviews.  Later that year, Cosmic Cowboy and Mr. Fun (aka Eric Gilliom) produced another Guided Audio Meditation track that we launched at the transformational event 'ReBirth 2012' in Maui, HI, again to rave reviews for the 100 or so participating.  We now had a truly inspirational reason to pursue an installation vessel in which to share this experience with as many Burning Man participants as possible day and night, throughout the week and the UFO concept was reborn.  In addition, when BMORG announced the 2013 Burning Man theme of Cargo Cult, complete with the Man perched atop a UFO-like circular tower, we knew the time had come to push hard to make The Time Machine UFO a reality and a spectacular, memorable Playa installation for the citizens of Black Rock City.

 In contributing and supporting to this campaign, you are contributing to the proliferation of Love, Joy, Creativity, Radical Artistic expression, and the exploration of the ongoing evolution of human consciousness!

 The primary distinction between 2004 and 2013 is the concept of crowdfunding. It is now entirely possible via this very Indiegogo campaign to reach out to and ask participants directly to help contribute financially to meeting our funding goal so we can afford to construct this installation.  If you are a Burning Man participant, you can look forward to interacting with this project and being dazzled by what it has to offer.  If you do not go to Burning Man, you can be inspired by a team of creatives exploring mind-altering, heart-opening, joy-producing experiences that we hope to bring to even larger audiences in the future, perhaps via theme park installations or a traveling venue you might see at concerts and festivals around the world. It's exciting to be a patron of the arts, especially those that challenge human beings into experiencing new and beautiful levels of being alive.


THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!

The Technology of Time Travel

" Today, we know that time travel need not be confined to myths, science fiction, Hollywood movies, or even speculation by theoretical physicists. Time travel is possible."

- Clifford Pickover (Author: Time: A Travellers Guide)

 

Time travel is the concept of moving between different points in time in a manner analogous to moving between different points in space. Time travel could hypothetically involve moving backward in time to a moment earlier than the starting point, or forward to the future of that point without the need for the traveler to experience the intervening period (at least not at the normal rate). Any technological device – whether fictional or hypothetical – that would be used to achieve time travel is commonly known as a time machine.

Though most common interpretations of time travel involve transporting ones self or ones corporal body within a physical machine or device through 3-dimensional space, mystics throughout the ages have spoken of a far more radical and dynamic form of time travel, that which involves transcending the ordinary limitations of time and space within the fabric of consciousness.

Utilizing sound technologies and binaural beats to balance brainwaves and the left and right hemispheres of the brain, the TMUFO is a vessel in which participants can lay down and relax the physical body and travel to various dimensions within the consciousness. These dimensions allow participants to journey into the past or the future and commune with beings and loved ones not in the physical body and ultimately arrive in the Eternal Now, or present moment.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $25,000 to make this project possible for the following reasons:

$10,000 - will purchase a re-usable 20' geodesic dome structure with a unique all weather 2-sided cover that will be the basis and home of our installation.  It will provide the practical shelter necessary for the Black Rock Desert environment of Burning Man and also begin the artistic and psychological representation of our flying-saucer experience.

$15,000 - will purchase: 1) Audio/Video Gear in the form of headphones, loudspeakers, and instructional video screen and playback equipment, 2) Lighting and Power in the form of LED strips and the necessary programming equipment, batteries, solar collectors and/or a gas generator, 3) Lumber and supplies that will make up the saucer-section around the dome and the relaxation platform inside, 4) Shipping/Transport/Storage for all of the components that will be pre-assembled in the beginning of August for reconstruction at Burning Man at the end of August and stored afterwards in Reno.

You have perks!?!?  You don't say . . .

$10 THANK YOU & Welcome aboard courageous Time Traveler, your name will be printed and displayed upon the physical construction of the TMUFO and included in our initiation for cosmic exploration into consciousness.

$15 THANK YOU + All of the above plus a custom designed TMUFO Bumper Sticker!

$25 THANK YOU + All of the above plus recieve a digital download of a Time Travel Journey so you can explore different dimensions of consciousness whenever you like!

$50 THANK YOU + All of the above plus recieve a healing quartz crystal that's been activated within the TMUFO and facilitated travel through multi-faceted dimensions of consciousness.

$100  THANK YOU + All of the above plus an 8"x10" autographed portrait of the TMUFO on the playa at Black Rock City.

$250 THANK YOU + All of the above plus an invitation to the TMUFO Initiation and Launch Ceremony plus a custom designed TMUFO space suit (T-Shirt)!

$500 THANK YOU + All of the above plus a cosmic 2-hour tour of Black Rock City with (Cosmic Cowboy or Cyberius Rex) or both of us drawing on our unique 15 year perspective of the Incredible Burning Man Festival

$1,000 THANK YOU + All of the above plus a 3-hour tour of Black Rock City aboard the Peanutbutter & Jelly Interactive Art Car

$5,000 - THANK YOU + All of the above plus you and 12 friends get a personal TMUFO journey and meditation with Cosmic Cowboy & C-Rex at the controls.

$10,000 - THANK YOU + All of the above plus (for those attending the 2013 Burning Man Festival): a private introduction and audience with John Frum to hear his message for humanity; (and for those unable to attend the 2013 Burning Man Festival): a custom & personalized Time Travel Audio Meditation designed specifically for YOU to facilitate your dreams coming true! 

What if, {GASP!!} we don't reach our goal!?!?

Our devotion and dedication to creating this Time Machine UFO is total regardless of how much financing we can raise together. The financing and budget simply defines the level at which the project can be manifested and realized. If we do not reach our goal of $25,000, we are prepared to create either a smaller 16' version of the TMUFO or create a simpler, safe space for participants to experience the Guided Audio Meditations.

Why should I even care?

If you are a Burning Man participant you are well aware of the many life-altering experiences you have likely had in Black Rock City.  As artists, Cosmic Cowboy and Cyberius Rex believe that contributing to this possibility is one of the most beautiful things about the community that exists at Burning Man and the experience of the Guided Audio Meditations is truly something that has the potentional to eventually enrich hundreds, to thousands, to millions of people's lives and we would love to see that happen.  In the same way that Burning Man is a beta test for humanity as a whole evolving, by sharing our UFO with Burning Man we are testing its impact and transformational power with those most open to experiencing it.

So far the few hundred people who have experienced these Guided Audio Meditations have reported back having an amazing experience that in some cases produced breakthroughs or life-altering realizations in healing or life purpose.  We can only hope to continue to make these GAM's more and more beneficial and the delivery system more and more satisfying and exciting.

Artists have always required the support of Patrons and we honor that age-old relationship by always using funding to produce at least some version of what we propose.  Whether you will be a direct participant this year at Burning Man or encounter us somewhere else in the future, you can take pleasure in knowing that you are supporting truth, beauty, love and the advancement of the human condition through entertaining and mind-expanding ideas and technology.

I don't have a lot of cash right now, but I'm excited to help . . .

If you find that you are unable to contribute $1, $5, $10 or more dollars to our campaign, yet are inspired and excited about the idea please share this Indiegogo campaign with all of your friends, family, theme camps and beyond.  Don't forget that Indiegogo makes it easy for you to share this campaign via email, Facebook and other social media.

 

Thank you in advance,

Sincerely,

Cosmic Cowboy & Cyberius Rex

Camp Mystic
story_txt:
“One’s destination is never a place, but a new way of seeing things.”- Henry Miller
UPDATE 7/24/13 with 14 hours left:
Dr. Oz comes out in favor of the technology we are using for our Time Traveling Guided Audio Meditations!http://www.doctoroz.com/videos/have-out-body-ex...

story:
Hey guys,

My name is Ashlee, but most people call me Kira or Twisted Ribbon. I'm about to be 21 years old and have been living off and on in Albuquerque, New Mexico most of my life. I started drawing as a passion when I was 11 years old, though you could say I've been drawing since I could pick up a crayon. One night I happened across a anime called InuYasha and since that day I've been working on my own style, character design, and stories for all of my original characters, creating all kinds of them for different fandoms throughout the years. But now I've worked up the courage to take the next step and share my progress with you all.

This campaign will be to raise the funds to go to a convention in the next 2 months called Jackocon. It's there where I hope to get a booth to sell prints, stickers, and even commissions to local buyers or even to mail/ship products if you're unable to attend. Now, I need this all to come together because I've worked for over 10 years now trying to get the self-confidence to share my work with others but sadly, I'm not exactly rolling in money right now. 

Anyone who is kind enough to donate will be helping me take the next step in achieving a life-long dream of becoming a accomplished artist as well as helping me come out of my shell a bit more as a person.

So in total I need about $900 dollars. I know the goal says $1000, so let me explain. For those who haven't used Indiegogo for a campaign, they take a percentage of what you donate if I get to my goal or not. If I reach my goal, they're still going to take about 4% of my total goal amount out of what you give to my cause, but rest assured, the extra money isn't going to be going into my own pocket. Any extra funds will be used to purchase more prints, stickers, or materials for the convention or any other conventions down the road.

The first goal will be at $300 dollars, that will guarantee that I will have the booth for the convention and will be attending.

At $450, I'll be able to print 500 stickers to sell at the convention; I hope to have 10+ stickers to sell, with at least 50-100 of each available, depending on how close we get to the final goal of $1000.

And at the $900 goal, I will have 300 8 1/2x11 prints made as well as 30-50 11x17 prints made. Once again, the closer we get to the $1000 goal, the more prints and stickers will be available.

Now for the part that you've been waiting for: Prizes!

Now, a donation of $1 will get you a printable. Now that means any one of the stickers I will be selling at the convention is a choice as a printable picture that I will have printed on high gloss paper and will either mail to you or have available for pick-up at the convention itself.

A donation of $5 will get you a actual sticker of your choice, which is also available for pick-up or mail out.

$10 will get you a 8 1/2x11 print of your choosing, available for mail or pick-up which will be signed by yours truly. Did I mention it's a discounted price?!

$20 will get you a 11x17 print of your choosing, once again available for mail or pick-up, which will be signed, and it is also at a discounted price!

Now, donate $50 dollars and you will recieve a black and white commission with up to 2 characters printed on 8 1/2x11 semi-gloss paper.

And a $100 dollar donation will get you a full color commission with up to 2 characters, on either 8 1/2x11 or 11x17 semi-gloss paper.

All prizes will include a typed letter of thanks and appreciation from myself, and all are available for pick-up or mail depending on the donator's preference.

Now... If we happen to not reach our goal, I will provide the prizes to those who did donate, if need be, out of my own pocket or discuss alternate prize options if the problem should arise. All donations will go to the prints, stickers, and booth at the convention, though I may not be able to accommodate the entire amount stated above if we don't reach the goal.

Now, I understand that the economy isn't great right now. I know I'm not the only one struggling to make ends meet here, but if you can't donate and still want to help, please share my Indiegogo campain anywhere and everywhere you can. Every little share and donation counts.

Thank you so much for your interest, I hope to have a video up within the week so I can connect on a deeper level than text on a screen.

story:
The Winkler House is now under new management and we have a lot of catching up to do. 

What is The Winkler House?:

The Winkler House is a two story building within walking distance to the U of L college campus, the Papa Johns Cardinal Stadium and the prestigious Churchill Downs. The building is currently owned by Framers Supply and now placed under our management. Framers has been a local business for 30+ years in Louisville and has lately been struggling in our weak economy.

Our plans for The Winkler House is to be the premiere hangout for Louisville KY and visiting artists and their fans. By art we mean all art. We want to host concerts, small theater shows, film viewings, mini conventions (film, Horror etc...), comedy/improv shows, art galleries, art classes, theater classes, family night, VHS movie night, birthday parties, monthly flea market, a place for film makers to build sets and shoot their films, special events (parties, PPV screenings, watch UofL games on the big screen etc...) and anything else we, or YOU, can think of.

Our ULTIMATE goal is to start a new coffee shop that would not only serve the students of U of L and the surrounding community but also focus on supporting the ARTS

We have a huge space that will be fully equipped to handle any and all events. We will have two fully furnished, fully functional apartments upstairs for visiting acts and/or for rent during local special events. Events such as Thunder over Louisville, The Kentucky Oaks and Kentucky Derby, U of L sporting events etc...

In order to do all this, we need your help. Our first step is to keep the lights on. We've recently gained control of the building, as of last week, and unfortunately the building is behind on it's electric bill among other things. The electric will be shut off by the end of next week, Feb 22nd, which doesn't give us a lot of time!

As filmmakers, art is our life. We love all art and want to be able to show it off in all it's forms. With your help we can do that!

If all goes well, we would like to have a kick-off party during the month of April starting around Thunder over Louisville. We also plan to have a HUGE Derby Party during The Kentucky Oaks and Kentucky Derby, just minutes away from our building!

GOALS:

$1500: Our first goal is to reach $1500 by Friday February 22nd. This will keep our electric on and give us a month to try and get things in order. If all of our FACEBOOK FRIENDS donated just $1 we would reach our entire goal in a matter of days! So instead of hitting the value menu at the local fast food restaurant one day this week you could donate that dollar instead to help SAVE THE ARTS and a 30 year old LOCAL BUSINESS! $1 goes a long way!

About the $1500 goal: No money donated will be spent until we hit the $1500 goal. If we don't hit the $1500 mark by at least the end of February we will have to cancel this project and refund all money donated. This is due to the electric bill issue. If we do make the $1500 by the end of Feb we will continue as planned.

$3500: Our second goal is to reach $3500 to help us start restoring the building. The apartments can use a major overhaul and the downstairs events area is going to need a lot of work.

$5000: Reaching the $5000 mark will help us not only restore the inside of Winkler House but also it's exterior. We need a major cleaning and repainting on the outside as well as some foundation work. This is our main focus.

$10,000: This would be a major goal. The Winkler House is in dire need of a new roof and QUICK. During any significant rainfall, our roof leaks as if it were Niagara. We have several kiddie pools in the attic catching the water now and they need constant bailing. A new roof is a must. For now we do what we can, when we can.

$25,000: Would help us reach our ultimate goal of creating a local coffee shop, Tip O' The Cup, for the surrounding area. Especially the students of U of L. Not only would these funds help restore our building and save a local Louisville business of 30+ years but also help us support and serve the local college community and help save the arts in our area.

In addition to the coffee shop we would also like to help serve our community better by working with the local church and help those in need.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

We are not only looking for financial help but also volunteers and donations. Here are the things we could use, new or used, to help us restore our building:

Paint (indoor and outdoor) any and all colors. We'll use what we can and donate what we cant.

Furniture. All types. Couches, beds, tables, chairs, shelves, desks, etc... This will be both for the apartments and events area.

Carpet. This is mostly for the apartments but could also be used in the event area.

Lumber. To be used for numerous projects.

Drywall. Also for numerous projects.

Bedding, appliances (fridge, freezers, stoves, dishwashers etc...), Televisions, electronics, linen (towels, blankets etc...), tile (for apartment bathrooms), kitchen cabinets, tools, sanders, curtains (and blinds), windows, doors, fencing, lighting and any other items you may think useful for such a project.

WE ARE OPEN TO IDEAS!

Volunteers:

We could use the expertise of Electricians, Carpenters, Painters, Plumbers, Roofers and Landscape among others. 

When we say volunteer we mean for someone to come out and help us assess the building and what it would take to fix it properly. The money raised will be put into materials and ALSO help pay those that could help us fix what is broken. 

SHARE:

Just by sharing this to your friends could help us tremendously. Like we say, if everyone of our friends would donate just $1 we would be well on our way to restoring this building and creating a place to showcase art in all it's forms.

We thank you for any and all support you can give and appreciate your time.

CONTACT US:

If you're an artist (Film, painting, photographer, musician/band, etc...) and would like to participate in future events or you have any questions or would like to help in any way please email us at: thewinklerhouse@gmail.com

SPECIAL PERKS:

Thunder Over Louisville Package:

Thunder Over Louisville  is the official opening ceremonies for the Kentucky Derby Festival. Thunder is also North America's largest annual fireworks show and North America's largest air show!

Rated as one of the top 100 events in North America, Thunder Over Louisville a sight to behold. Each year, more than 700,000 fans from all over the world come to Louisville to view this amazing spectacle! 

The Thunder Over Louisville package includes 3 days/2nights (Friday April 19th - Sunday April 21st) stay at The Winkler House. Our rooms are fully epuipped with a working kitchen, living room (w/pull out couch) and one bedroom.

  • Enjoy complimentary breakfast all 3 days.
  • Rooms include free cable and WiFi.
  • VIP, all you can eat and drink status (including alcohol for 21+), at are pre Thunder party Friday night April 19th.
  • Free Shuttle Service to The Thunder Event and 4th Street Live. (Also Shuttle service to and from the airport if needed.)
  • 4 official Pegasus Pin's for free entry into Thunder.
  • Complimentary Free Parking in are parking lot. Equipped with security cameras.

*You are free to split this package among friends. Sleeping arrangments are limited.

Kentucky Oaks/Derby Package:

Stay within walking distance of the Greatest Two Minutes in Sports! 

Our Kentucky Oaks/Derby package includes 4 days/3nights (Thursday May 2nd - Sunday May 5th) stay at The Winkler House. Our rooms are fully epuipped with a working kitchen, living room (w/pull out couch) and one bedroom.

  • Receive 2 tickets general admission tickets to the Ky Oaks and 2 general admission tickets to the KY Derby!
  • Enjoy complimentary breakfast all 4 days.
  • Rooms include free cable and WiFi.
  • VIP, all you can eat and drink status (including alcohol for 21+), at our official KY Derby party Saturday night May 4th.
  • Free Shuttle Service to the Oaks and Derby and 4th Street Live. (Also Shuttle service to and from the airport if needed.)
  • 2 Official KY Derby Glasses
  • Complimentary Free Parking in are parking lot. Equipped with security cameras.

*You are free to split this package among friends. Sleeping arrangments are limited.
story_txt:
The Winkler House is now under new management and we have a lot of catching up to do. 
What is The Winkler House?:
The Winkler House is a two story building within walking distance to the U of L college campus, the Papa Johns Cardinal Stadium and the prestigious Churchill Downs. The building is currently owned by Framers Supply and now placed under our management. Framers has been a local business for 30+ years in Louisville and has lately been struggling in our weak economy.
Our plans for The Winkler House is to be the premiere hangout for Louisville KY and visiting artists and their fans. By art we mean all art. We want to host concerts, small theater shows, film viewings, mini conventions (film, Horror etc...), comedy/improv shows, art galleries, art classes, theater classes, family night, VHS movie night, birthday parties, monthly flea market, a place for film makers to build sets and shoot their films, special events (parties, PPV screenings, watch UofL games on the big screen etc...) and anything else we, or YOU, can think of.
Our ULTIMATE goal is to start a new coffee shop that would not only serve the students of U of L and the surrounding community but also focus on supporting the ARTS
We have a huge space that will be fully equipped to handle any and all events. We will have two fully furnished, fully functional apartments upstairs for visiting acts and/or for rent during local special events. Events such as Thunder over Louisville, The Kentucky Oaks and Kentucky Derby, U of L sporting events etc...
In order to do all this, we need your help. Our first step is to keep the lights on. We've recently gained control of the building, as of last week, and unfortunately the building is behind on it's electric bill among other things. The electric will be shut off by the end of next week, Feb 22nd, which doesn't give us a lot of time!
As filmmakers, art is our life. We love all art and want to be able to show it off in all it's forms. With your help we can do that!
If all goes well, we would like to have a kick-off party during the month of April starting around Thunder over Louisville. We also plan to have a HUGE Derby Party during The Kentucky Oaks and Kentucky Derby, just minutes away from our building!
GOALS:
$1500: Our first goal is to reach $1500 by Friday February 22nd. This will keep our electric on and give us a month to try and get things in order. If all of our FACEBOOK FRIENDS donated just $1 we would reach our entire goal in a matter of days! So instead of hitting the value menu at the local fast food restaurant one day this week you could donate that dollar instead to help SAVE THE ARTS and a 30 year old LOCAL BUSINESS! $1 goes a long way!
About the $1500 goal: No money donated will be spent until we hit the $1500 goal. If we don't hit the $1500 mark by at least the end of February we will have to cancel this project and refund all money donated. This is due to the electric bill issue. If we do make the $1500 by the end of Feb we will continue as planned.
$3500: Our second goal is to reach $3500 to help us start restoring the building. The apartments can use a major overhaul and the downstairs events area is going to need a lot of work.
$5000: Reaching the $5000 mark will help us not only restore the inside of Winkler House but also it's exterior. We need a major cleaning and repainting on the outside as well as some foundation work. This is our main focus.

story:
Short Summary

Hello!,

My name is Zoe McDonald and I am the owner of Zoe Marie Designs, a company that specializes in Artistic/Wearable Jewelry, Clothing Design and Interior Design.  I have a B.S. in Fashion Design from Howard University and studied Interior Design for 3 yrs and Marymount University.  My business is my passion and my love for it feeds my soul which is evident in the work I produce!

I have been recently (last night - June 17th) been blessed with the opportunity to share Vending space at the Essence Music Festival on the weekend of July 4th, 2014.  I have solely run my business full time for the past 4 months and have been able to do so with the support of family and friends.  One of my methods of generating income is though vending at festivals, art shows, displaying my work in galleries and sponsored home shows.

With short notice of this great news, I knew I would need to fundraise today and tomorrow (June 18th & 19th) and ask for $550 in contributions to cover the cost of the vending space as it is due to my Supporter and Chief renter of the space by this Friday, June 20th. 

My long term goal with my business is to open a Studio where I can produce and sell my work and also help up and coming artists like myself get started with their own dreams. You can view my work via Facebook @ Zoe Marie Designs or my web site:  http://zoeonline.wix.com/zoee 

The Perks of this fundraiser will be that I will match contributions equally with a gift-certificate to shop at Zoe Marie Designs that can be used toward any of my products and/or services. 

This is Part I of a 2 Part fundraiser.  The total amount needed for me to travel and lodge to New Orleans is $2750.  I will set up the second part of the fundraiser on Friday, June 20th.  Part 1 fundraiser is $550 covering the cost of the booth which is due almost immediately.  Part 2 of the fundraiser, the remaining  $2200 will cover airfare, hotel and transportation for 4 days.  

The Essence Music Festival is one that is visited by hundreds of thousands of people for 3 days out of the year.  This will be my biggest opportunity yet to gain exposure and prayerfully expand my clientele' and share my love and spirit through my work.

If I do not reach my goal, the funds earned from your wonderful and heartfelt donations will go directly toward application and vending fees for other similiar events and showings throughout the remainder of the year.

I would like to thank you for your consideration and help and please share the news with your associates and friends.  You can use the Indegogo tools or other forms of social media. The more people that see this fundraiser, the better my chances in reaching this goal!

Wishing you much success in your own endeavors and many blessings!

Thank you!,

Zoe McDonald
